caption: Ice covered Lake Baikal in late January 2011, as snow coated nearby peaks.

title: Seasonal Fires in Southeastern Asia
caption: Mid-January 2011 saw the beginning of the agricultural fire season in Southeast Asia. Widespread fires burn throughout the region between January and May, when farmers are preparing the land between harvest and the next growing season.

title: Landslides in Brazil
caption: Following extreme rainfall in early January 2011, the Serrana region of southeastern Brazil suffered devastation mudslides and floods.

title: Haze over India and Bangladesh
caption: Haze hovered over parts of India and Bangladesh in late January 2011. The haze might have resulted at least in part from a temperature inversion.

title: Cyclone Zelia
caption: Cyclone Zelia formed over the Coral Sea and became a Category 2 cyclone by January 16, 2011.

title: Activity at Mt. Etna
caption: Europe’s largest and most active volcano rumbled with tremors, spewed ash, and spit lava into the Sicilian night.

title: Rare Snow in the U.S. South
caption: A winter storm brought rare snow and ice to states across the U.S. South between January 9 and January 11, 2011.

title: Winter Storm along the U.S. East Coast
caption: A classic winter storm swept up the U.S. East Coast on January 12, 2011.

title: Dust across Central Africa
caption: Dust mixed with smoke across central Africa in early January 2011.

title: Heavy Rains in Sri Lanka
caption: Heavy rains struck Sri Lanka for the second time in a month in February 2011.

title: Heavy Rains in Philippines
caption: Very heavy rains in the Philippines

title: Dust Storm in Northern Mexico
caption: On December 30, 2010, a dust storm blew from northern Mexico across the borders of Texas and New Mexico.

title: Flooding in Australia
caption: Widespread flooding in eastern Australia in late December 2010 and early January 2011 isolated entire communities and forced thousands to evacuate.

title: Activity at Kizimen Volcano
caption: Kizimen Volcano began erupting in 2010. More than two years later the eruption continued, with frequent ash and gas emissions, pyroclastic flows, and an active lava flow.

title: Dust over the Gulf of Alaska
caption: Continuing an intermittent pattern, dust plumes blew off the Alaskan coast and over the Gulf of Alaska on December 23, 2010.

title: Dust Plumes off Morocco
caption: Parallel dust plumes blew off the coast of Morocco and over the Atlantic Ocean in late December 2010.

title: Fire in Western Australia
caption: Amid high summer temperatures, a fire broke out in Western Australia, south of Perth, in December 2010.

title: Winter Storm in the Northeastern United States
caption: A severe winter storm dropped up to 32 inches (80 centimeters) of snow on parts of the northeastern United States in late December 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Tasha
caption: On December 24 and 25, 2010, Tropical Storm Tasha brought heavy precipitation to the Queensland coast.

title: Oil Fire on Mexican Pipeline
caption: On December 19, 2010, an explosion on an oil pipeline ignited a deadly fire in a small town east of Mexico City.

title: Drought in East Africa
caption: Poor rains in late 2010 and 2011 brought much of East Africa into drought that led to famine.

title: Arctic Oscillation Chills U.S. and Europe
caption: The first week of December was a chilly one for much of Europe and parts of the United States because of a climate pattern called the Arctic Oscillation.

title: Record-Setting Storm in Minnesota
caption: A large snowstorm dumped record snow on Minnesota on December 10–11, 2010.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze once again hugged the southern face of the Himalaya in early December 2010.

title: Dust and Violent Weather in the Eastern Mediterranean
caption: Strong winds, high waves, snowstorms, thunderstorms, and dust storms struck the eastern Mediterranean in early December 2010.

title: Dust Storm in Eastern China
caption: Dust and clouds filled the skies over eastern China in early December 2010.

title: Snow Storm across the U.S. Midwest
caption: On December 5, 2010,  a powerful winter storm raced across the United States from the Upper Midwest to Virginia, leaving a swath of white in its wake.

title: Flooding in Southern Spain
caption: Heavy rains in early December 2010 caused floods in southern Spain.

title: Bloom around the Chatham Islands, New Zealand
caption: A large springtime bloom colored the ocean near the Chatham Islands, New Zealand in early December 2010.

title: Dust Storm over Southwest Asia
caption: Dust blew over the borders between Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Iran in early December 2010.

title: Flooding in Australia
caption: Heavy rains led to rising rivers in South Australia, New South Wales, and Queensland in early December 2010.

title: Heavy Rains in Central and South America
caption: Relentless rain wreaked havoc in Venezuela and Costa Rica in late November and early December 2010.

title: Winter Storm in Europe
caption: A powerful winter storm hit much of northern Europe in early December 2010.

title: Dust over the Gulf of Alaska
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Alaska and over the Gulf of Alaska at the beginning of December 2010.

title: Deadly Forest Fire in Northern Israel
caption: A large forest fire broke out near the Israeli city of Haifa on December 2, 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Abele
caption: Tropical Cyclone Abele formed at the end of November 2010 over the southern Indian Ocean.

title: Seasonal Fires in West Africa
caption: Widespread fires began to burn in West Africa in November 2010 as the region's annual fire season got underway.

title: Dust off Tunisia and Libya
caption: Dust blew off the coasts of Tunisia and Libya in late November 2010.

title: Snowstorm covers Western United States
caption: A storm system passing over the northwestern United States left a trail of heavy snow as it passed, bringing many a white Thanksgiving Day.

title: Dust over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Dust mingled with clouds over the Mediterranean Sea in late November 2010.

title: Bright Waters off the Namibian Coast
caption: Ocean waters glowed bright peacock green off the northern Namibian coast in late November 2010.

title: Dust Storm off Alaska
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of Alaska in mid-November 2010.

title: Dust over the Mediterranean
caption: Saharan dust drifted northward across the Mediterranean Sea toward Greece in early November 2010.

title: Bezymianny and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes
caption: The most recent eruption of Kyluchevskaya Volcano ended on November 4, 2010, while lava dome growth continues at nearby Bezymianny.

title: Gobi Dust Storm
caption: Gobi dust blew across north-central China in early November 2010.

title: Cyclone Jal
caption: Cyclone Jal formed over the northern Indian Ocean in early November 2010.

title: Hurricane Tomas
caption: Tomas strengthened and weakened multiple times after forming on October 29, 2010. On November 5, the storm was a Category One hurricane hovering between Haiti and Cuba.

title: Eruption at Mount Merapi, Indonesia
caption: On October 26, 2010, Mount Merapi began a series of deadly eruptions that lasted into November.

title: Haze from India to the Arabian Sea
caption: Haze stretched from the southern side of the Himalaya to the Arabian Sea at the beginning of November 2010.

title: Volcanic Activity at Popocatépetl
caption: The towering volcano in Mexico has been erupting since January 2005, with near constant venting from fumaroles, punctuated by steam, gas, and ash emissions.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Thick haze hung over eastern China, just south of the capital city of Beijing, at the end of October 2010.

title: Fires in Louisiana and Arkansas
caption: Hundreds of wildfires burned through drought-dried vegetation along the southern Mississippi River in October 2010.

title: Flooding in Thailand
caption: By late October 2010, parts of Thailand had been hit by the worst floods in decades.

title: Eruption of Piton de la Fournaise
caption: Piton de la Fournaise is a volcano on Réunion Island, in the Indian Ocean east of Madagascar. Its eruptions are similar to Kilauea’s on the island of Hawaii—very frequent emissions of fluid lava. The latest eruption of Piton de la Fournaise began on October 14, 2010.

title: Fire near Vandenberg Air Force Base, California
caption: A fire burned on the southern edge of Vandenberg Air Force Base in southern California on October 28, 2010.

title: Typhoon Chaba
caption: Typhoon Chaba formed over the northwest Pacific Ocean on October 21, 2010, and gradually strengthened as it moved toward Japan.

title: 7.7 Magnitude Quake off Sumatra
caption: At 9:42 p.m. local time (14:42 UTC) on October 25, 2010, a 7.7-magnitude earthquake occurred off the coast of Indonesia. The quake sent a 3-meter tsunami over Pagai Island.

title: Fires in Northwest India
caption: Northwest India was ablaze in October 2010 as farmers prepared to plant in time for the winter growing season.

title: Hurricane Richard
caption: Tropical Storm Richard intensified into a hurricane before making landfall on Belize on October 24, 2010.

title: Flooding in Benin
caption: Heavy rains flooded parts of West and Central Africa in the rainy season of 2010, and among the hardest-hit countries was Benin.

title: Dust over Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Dust plumes blew over the border between Afghanistan and Pakistan in late October 2010.

title: Fires in Botswana
caption: Several large fires burned in Botswana, Africa, on October 15, 2010.

title: Taklimakan Desert Dust Storm
caption: In late October 2010, clouds and dust hovered over the Taklimakan Desert.

title: Cyclone Giri
caption: Within a day of forming, Cyclone Giri exploded into a powerful and dangerous Category 5 storm over the Bay of Bengal on October 22, 2010. The storm was forecast to hit Myanmar (Burma).

title: Fires in Queensland, Australia
caption: A large grassfire burned in Queensland, Australia on October 13, 2010.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the southern slopes of the Himalaya in late October 2010.

title: Typhoon Megi
caption: After forming quickly on October 13, 2010, Typhoon Megi grew to “super” typhoon status by October 16. After striking the Philippines on October 18, the storm moved over the South China Sea toward China.

title: Fall Colors in the Allegheny Mountains
caption: By mid-October, autumn was in full swing in the northeastern United States.

title: Hurricane Paula
caption: Small but powerful, Paula strengthened to a hurricane over the Caribbean Sea before weakening to a tropical storm.

title: Toxic Sludge in Hungary
caption: On October 4, 2010, an accident at an alumina plant in Hungary released a torrent of toxic red sludge that inundated local communities.

title: Flooding in Nigeria
caption: Flooding in northern Nigeria destroyed crops, pastures, and homes in late September 2010.

title: Heavy Rains in Jamaica
caption: Heavy rains caused flash floods and landslides in Jamaica in late September and early October 2010.

title: Dust over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Dust hovered over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterranean Sea at the beginning of October 2010.

title: Dust Plumes off Libya
caption: Dual-toned dust plumes blew off the coast of Libya and over the Mediterranean Sea in late September 2010.

title: Kamchatka Volcanoes
caption: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya volcanoes continue their long-running eruptions.

title: Barren Island Ash Plume
caption: Barren Island continues a series of small eruptions that began in 2005.

title: Flooding in Northern India
caption: Heavy monsoon rains pushed the Ganges and other rivers in northern India over their banks in September 2010.

title: Planchón-Peteroa Volcano
caption: Beginning on September 6, 2010, Chile’s ice-covered Planchón-Peteroa Volcano has erupted a series of small ash and gas clouds.

title: Fires in Utah
caption: Dry weather and high winds fueled large fires in Utah in September 2010.

title: Hurricane Karl
caption: Hurricane Karl strengthened to a major hurricane on September 17, 2010, as it approached the Gulf Coast of Mexico.

title: Fires in Yukon Flats, Alaska
caption: Late-season fires filled the air with smoke over the Yukon Flats in interior Alaska.

title: Typhoon Fanapi
caption: Fanapi strengthened from a tropical depression to a tropical storm on September 15, 2010. The following day, Fanapi strengthened into a typhoon.

title: Dust Plumes off Western Africa
caption: Multicolored dust plumes blew off the coast of western Africa in mid-September 2010.

title: Seasonal Fires in Southern Africa
caption: Hundreds of land-management fires burned throughout southern Africa at the end of the dry season in September 2010.

title: Hurricane Igor
caption: Tropical Storm Igor strengthened into a hurricane on September 11, 2010, becoming the fourth hurricane of the season.

title: Dust Storm in Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: A dust storm struck the border region between Iran, Afghanistan, and Pakistan in mid-September 2010.

title: Dust Storm in Idaho
caption: Dust plumes mingled with clouds in southeastern Idaho in early September 2010.

title: Flooding in Southern Mexico
caption: Heavy rains filled dams to capacity and forced thousands from their homes in southern Mexico by early September 2010.

title: Taklimakan Desert Dust Storm
caption: Thick dust clogged the air over the Taklimakan Desert in early September 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Hermine
caption: Tropical Storm Hermine formed on September 5, 2010, in the extreme southwestern Gulf of Mexico. Though the storm never reached hurricane strength, it dumped extreme rain and caused flooding in Mexico, Texas, and the lower Midwestern U.S.

title: 7.0 Quake near Christchurch, New Zealand
caption: A large earthquake damaged Christchurch, New Zealand, early on September 4, 2010.

title: Fourmile Canyon Fire
caption: A wildfire broke out west of Boulder, Colorado, in early September 2010, threatening hundreds of structures and bathing Boulder in smoke.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Barents Sea
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom spread across the southern Barents Sea in late August 2010.

title: Fire on Oil Platform in Gulf of Mexico
caption: A fire broke out on an oil platform in the Gulf of Mexico on September 2, 2010.

title: Typhoon Kompasu
caption: Tropical Storm Kompasu formed over the western Pacific Ocean on August 30, 2010, and strengthened to a Category 3 typhoon the next day.

title: Flooding in Niger
caption: Beginning in late July 2010, torrential rains fell on Niger. The rains continued for weeks, flooding much of the country.

title: Sinabung Volcano Erupts
caption: Dormant since at least the year 1600, Indonesia’s Mount Sinabung erupted on August 29, 2010. More eruptions followed on August 30, and the volcano remains active.

title: Hurricane Earl
caption: Tropical Storm Earl developed over the tropical Atlantic Ocean in late August 2010 and became a major hurricane as it headed north and west toward the East Coast of the U.S.

title: Forest Fires in Oregon
caption: Lightning ignited several large fires in the Cascade Mountains in central Oregon in August 2010.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust blew eastward out of the Taklimakan Desert in late August 2010.

title: Breakup on the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf
caption: In mid- to late August 2010, a Bermuda-sized ice island broke free from the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf along the northern coast of Ellesmere Island.

title: Hurricane Frank
caption: Hurricane Frank strengthened from a tropical depression in late August 2010 over the eastern Pacific Ocean.

title: Dust Storm in Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Just hundreds of kilometers away from the flooded Indus River, a dust storm struck western Pakistan and southern Afghanistan.

title: Tropical Storm Mindulle
caption: Tropical Storm Mindulle hovered over the South China Sea, off the coast of Vietnam, in late August 2010.

title: Hurricane Danielle
caption: Danielle formed as a tropical depression over the Atlantic Ocean on August 22, 2010, and strengthened to a tropical storm the next day. On August 27, Danielle strengthened into a major hurricane. By August 29, the hurricane was back to category one and losing energy in the North Atlantic.

title: Sea Ice in McClure Strait
caption: In mid-August 2010, the northern route through the Northwest Passage was nearly free of sea ice, although some ice remained in McClure Strait.

title: Landslide in Zhouqu, China
caption: Heavy rains caused deadly flooding and landslides in northwest China in early August 2010.

title: Fires in South America
caption: The annual fire season in Brazil and Bolivia ramped up in August 2010 with unusually widespread and intense fires.

title: Fires in Madeira, Portugal
caption: A large fire burned on the Portuguese island of Madeira on August 13, 2010.

title: Fires in Portugal
caption: Forest fires burned in northern and central Portugal in August 2010.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Newfoundland
caption: A phytoplankton bloom spanned hundreds of kilometers off the Newfoundland coast in early August 2010.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide and Dust Plumes along the Coast of Namibia
caption: Hydrogen sulfide bubbled up from the depths while dust plumes blew overhead along the Namibian coast in early August 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Dianmu
caption: Tropical Storm Dianmu blew over the East China Sea in early August 2010, traveling slowly toward the Korean Peninsula.

title: Tropical Storm Estelle
caption: Tropical Storm Estelle strengthened from a tropical depression over the eastern Pacific Ocean in early August 2010.

caption: In early August 2010, a massive ice island calved off Petermann Glacier in northwestern Greenland.

caption: Weeks of torrential rains caused flooding and mudslides throughout China in July and August 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Colin
caption: On August 3, 2010, Tropical Depression Four strengthened into Tropical Storm Colin, the third third tropical storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season.

caption: The fast-moving Bull fire started near the southern edge of California’s Sequoia National Forest on July 26, 2010.

title: Severe Storms Strike U.S. East Coast
caption: One of the most destructive storms in years struck Washington, D.C., and the surrounding area on July 25, 2010.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: Multiple dust plumes blew eastward across the Red Sea in late July 2010.

title: Dust off Western Africa
caption: A dust plume blew off the west coast of Africa and hovered over the eastern Atlantic Ocean in late July 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Bonnie
caption: Tropical Depression Three strengthened into Tropical Storm Bonnie east of Florida on July 22, 2010, and traveled toward the west-northwest.

title: Severe Drought in Southern Russia
caption: A severe and persistent drought across southern Russia damaged crops in June and July 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Chanthu
caption: Tropical Storm Chanthu formed over the western Pacific Ocean and headed for mainland China, on the heels of already severe flooding.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: July 21, 2010, turned out to be a dusty day in parts of Iraq, including Baghdad.

title: Bumper Crops in China
caption: Good growing conditions in June 2010 yielded a bumper wheat crop in northern and central China.

title: 7.3 Quake in New Britian
caption: Multiple earthquakes occurred in the region of New Britain on July 18 and 19, 2010. The largest quake had a magnitude of 7.3.

title: Multi-colored Dust Storm over Bolivia
caption: A large dust storm blew across the highlands of southern Bolivia in mid-July 2010. The dust storm may be related to ongoing drought in Bolivia.

title: Dust Storm in Egypt and Sudan
caption: Thick dust blew across the deserts of Egypt and Sudan in mid-July 2010.

title: Smoke from Fires in Canada
caption: Large forest fires generated thick smoke that spread across western Canada in July 2010.

title: Flooding in Northern Mexico
caption: Heavy rains from Hurricane Alex pushed a dam to capacity in northern Mexico in early July 2010. Authorities opened floodgates on the dam, flooding a community downstream.

title: Heavy Rain in Bangladesh and India
caption: Heavy rain deluged Bangladesh and India in July 2010.

title: Heavy Rain in China
caption: Heavy rain triggered devastating flooding in China in July 2010.

title: Dust Storm over Southern Afghanistan
caption: Dust blew over the borders of Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Iran in early June 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Conson
caption: Tropical Storm Conson blew over the Pacific Ocean east of the Philippines in mid-July July 2010.

title: Dust off the West Coast of Africa
caption: Saharan dust blew past the Canary Islands and over the Atlantic Ocean in early July 2010.

caption: Fires burned along the Volga River, not far from Nizhniy Novgorod, in early July 2010.

caption: Fires littered the ground while smoke clogged the skies over eastern China in early July 2010.

caption: Dust blew over the borders of Niger, Algeria, and Mali in early July 2010.

title: Fires in Saskatchewan
caption: Several large fires were burning in northern Saskatchewan Province, Canada, in early July 2010.

caption: After years of drought, 2010 brought excellent growing conditions to the Middle East. It also brought an infestation of yellow rust, a destructive fungus.

caption: By late June, flooding had killed at least 379 people and forced some 100,000 more from their homes in southern China.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Iceland
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom lit the waters west of Iceland in late June 2010.

caption: The first tropical depression of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season also turned into the season's first hurricane in late June 2010.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Thick haze covered eastern China on June 25, 2010.

title: Tropical Storm Darby
caption: Tropical Storm Darby became the fourth named storm of the 2010 eastern Pacific hurricane season. On June 23, Darby strengthened to a hurricane.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: Strong winds brought a dense cloud of dust to central Iraq on June 23, 2010.

title: Deadly Floods in Brazil
caption: Two weeks of torrential rains brought deadly floods to northeastern Brazil, leaving some 1,000 people missing as of June 23, 2010.

title: Flooding along the Missouri River
caption: The Missouri River spilled over its banks along parts of its route in mid- to late June 2010.

title: Hurricane Celia
caption: Celia strengthened to a Category 2 hurricane over the eastern Pacific Ocean in late June 2010.

caption: Nearly 9,000 acres and growing, the Schultz Fire was burning in forests north of Flagstaff, Arizona in the fourth week of June 2010.

title: Dust Storm in Sudan
caption: A large dust storm blew across Sudan in late Jun 2010.

caption: Frequent strong winds during the late spring, summer, and fall blow bands of dust from the Sahara Desert in western Africa over the Atlantic Ocean. This dust storm started on June 20, 2010.

caption: Dust from Syria blows along the course of the Euphrates River into Iraq in mid-June 2010.

caption: Hydrogen sulfide bubbled upward and dust plumes blew southwestward along the coast of Namibia in mid-June 2010.

caption: In mid-June 2010, Tropical Storm Blas hovered over the eastern Pacific, just off the west coast of central Mexico.

title: Heavy Rains in Burma and Bangladesh
caption: In June 2010, relentless monsoon rains triggered floods and landslides near the Bay of Bengal.

caption: Deadly flash floods swept through the Albert Pike campgrounds in Arkansas after torrential rain caused a surge along the Little Missouri River.

title: Saharan Dust Storm
caption: A giant dust plume blew across the Sahara Desert in early June 2010.

caption: Ulawun Volcano on the island of New Britain released a small plume in early June 2010.

title: Saharan Dust Over the Red Sea
caption: Thick billows of dust blew over Sudan and the Red Sea in early June 2010.

title: Wildfires in Northern Australia
caption: Wildfires burned along Australia’s northern coast in early June 2010.

title: Fires in Alaska and Yukon Territory
caption: Wildfires burned in Alaska and Yukon Territory in early June 2010.

title: Plumes from Gaua and Ambrym Volcanoes
caption: Two volcanoes in Vanuatu, Gaua and Ambrym, emitted simultaneous plumes in mid 2010.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: A plume of dust hundreds of kilometers long covered Iraq on June 7, 2010.

caption: A small volcanic plume, fresh debris flows, and ash indicate recent activity at the remote Mount Cleveland Volcano.

title: Dust over India
caption: A wide swath of dust blew over western India on June 2, 2010.

title: Dust Storm over Egypt and Libya
caption: A large dust storm swept across Libya and Egypt on May 26 and May 27, 2010.

caption: Tropical Cyclone Phet headed for the coast of Oman in early June 2010, with maximum sustained winds of 125 knots and gusts up to 150 knots.

caption: Central Africa’s highly active Nyamuragira and Nyiragongo volcanoes simultaneously release volcanic plumes.

caption: Dust plumes blew off the west coast of Africa and crossed the Atlantic Ocean in late May and early June 2010.

title: Canadian Fires Send Smoke Over New England
caption: A river of smoke from several large fires in Quebec flowed southeast over New England on Memorial Day 2010.

title: Flooding in Southern China
caption: Nearly a month of heavy rain flooded provinces throughout southern China, forcing the evacuation of some 685,000 residents and causing more than 100 deaths.

title: Flooding in Southern China
caption: Nearly a month of heavy rain flooded provinces throughout southern China, forcing the evacuation of some 685,000 residents and causing more than 100 deaths.

title: Smoke over the U.S. from Spring Burning
caption: Smoke from agricultural fires raised carbon monoxide concentrations slightly in parts of Mexico, the US Great Plains, New England, and southern Canada in mid-May 2010.

title: Flooding in Poland
caption: Severe flooding raised Poland’s rivers to their highest levels in over a century in May 2010.

caption: Tropical Cyclone Laila affected the Bay of Bengal, the northern Indian Ocean, India, and Sri Lanka in late May 2010.

caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of Libya and over the Mediterranean Sea in mid-May 2010.

title: Fires in Democratic Republic of Congo
caption: In Democratic Republic of Congo south of the equator, the annual fire season was underway in mid-May 2010.

caption: Severe floods struck Kentucky on May 1–2, 2010. A week later, the Green River remained at a major flood stage at Paradise, Kentucky.

caption: Thick dust blew over the Fertile Crescent of Syria on May 11, 2010.

caption: A strong spring storm blew thick dust across eastern Washington on May 3, 2010.

title: Dust Storm Over Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Thick dust blew over the border region between Afghanistan and Pakistan on May 5, 2010.

title: Record Floods in Tennessee
caption: Intense rain on May 1-2 triggered record flooding on rivers across Tennessee.

title: Heavy Rains in Kentucky and Tennessee
caption: Record-breaking rain inundated Kentucky and Tennessee on May 1-2, 2010.

caption: A spring storm filled the air over the Tarim Basin and nearby deserts with thick dust in late April 2010.

title: Fires across Tyumen and Omsk Regions, Southern Russia

title: Sahara Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm spanned hundreds of kilometers over the Sahara Desert and the Sahel in late April 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Sean
caption: Tropical Cyclone Sean spanned hundreds of kilometers over the southern Indian Ocean in late April 2010.

caption: In April 2010, an oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico turned into one of the worst environmental disasters in the region’s history.

caption: Heavy rains struck eastern India for several days in mid-April 2010.

title: Dust over Pakistan and India
caption: A broad veil of dust hung over the Thar Desert on the border between India and Pakistan on April 20, 2010.

title: Lush Vegetation Brings Locusts to Eastern Australia
caption: In the wake of heavy rain, lush vegetation spread across eastern Australia in March 2010, providing habitat for swarms of crop-consuming locusts.

title: Earthquake on Tibetan Plateau, Qinghai, China
caption: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck the Tibetan Plateau in southern Qinghai Province, China, on April 13, 2010, killing hundreds of people and injuring as many as 10,000.

title: Magnitude 7.7 Earthquake off Sumatra
caption: Active subduction off the Indian Ocean coast of Sumatra is responsible for both the regionâ€™s geography and its earthquakes. Although rare on human timescales, over geologic time, earthquakes are frequent in the area. The same forces that produce the earthquakes also created Sumatra, its volcanoes, the nearby islands, and shaped the sea floor.

title: Wildfire in Central Chile
caption: A large fire in central Chile in early April scorched thousands of acres of natural woodland, pasture, and timber plantations.

title: 7.2-Magnitude Quake near Mexicali, Mexico
caption: On April 4, 2010, a major earthquake (magnitude 7.2) and numerous aftershocks struck near the Laguna Salada Fault in northern Baja California.

title: Flooding in the Northeastern United States

title: Tropical Cyclone Robyn
caption: Tropical Cyclone Robyn spanned hundreds of kilometers over the southern Indian Ocean in early April 2010.

title: Erupting Kamchatka Volcanoes
caption: The Kamchatka Peninsula, the northwestern edge of the Pacific Ring of Fire, is one of the most volcanically active regions on Earth. At least 114 Kamchatkan volcanoes have erupted in the past 12,000 years. A handful of these volcanoes is erupting currently.

title: Dust in the Taklimakan Desert
