title: Late March Dust Storm in Northeastern China
caption: Thick dust plumes blew over northeastern China at the end of March 2010.

title: Aral Sea Dust Storm
caption: Dust plumes rose from desiccated lakebed sediments of the Aral Sea in late March 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Paul
caption: Tropical Cyclone Paul traveled over the northern coast of Australia in late March 2010.

title: Eruption of Eyjafjallajökull Volcano, Iceland
caption: Iceland’s Eyjafjallajökull Volcano burst into life on March 20, 2010. By the last week of May, it appeared to have quieted down.

title: Flooding near the Betsiboka River, Madagascar
caption: Croplands along the Betsiboka River in Madagascar flooded in March 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Imani
caption: Tropical Cyclone Imani swirled over the Southern Indian Ocean in late March 2010.

title: Dam Failure near Kyzylagash, Kazakhstan
caption: A reservoir flooded the village of Kyzylagash in March 2010 when unusually heavy snow melt and rain overwhelmed the dam wall, sending a surge of water downstream.

title: Mount Etna
caption: Mount Etna, one of the most active volcanoes in Europe, continues to experience the occasional paroxysm.

title: Flooding in Upper Midwest
caption: Rain, snowmelt, and ice jams backed up rivers and flooded agricultural fields throughout much of the Dakotas in March 2010.

title: Spring Sandstorm Scours China
caption: A huge sandstorm arrived in China on the first day of spring in 2010. Dust spread over the Korean Peninsula and Japan as the storm progressed.

title: Rising Waters in St. Paul
caption: In anticipation of flooding along the Mississippi River, authorities in St. Paul closed streets in late March 2010. In the Twin Cities region, waters rose in several waterways.

title: Massive Dust Storm Sweeps Across Africa
caption: Dust stretched from the Red Sea to the Atlantic Ocean on March 19, 2010, as a massive dust storm swept across the southern Sahara Desert.

title: Landslide Lake in Northwest Pakistan
caption: On January 4, 2010, a landslide occurred in the Hunza Valley of northern Pakistan, creating a landslide lake that threatened to flood nearby communities.

title: Landslide in Maierato, Italy
caption: On February 16, 2010, a hill west of a small town in southern Italy crumbled and slid away.

title: Tropical Cyclones Tomas and Ului
caption: Tropical Cyclone Ului approached the Queensland coast in late March 2010.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide Emissions along the Namibian Coast
caption: Hydrogen sulfide erupted along the coast of Namibia in mid-March 2010.

title: Dust over China
caption: A wide band of dust swept across eastern China on March 12, 2010.

title: Large Landslide in Uganda
caption: Heavy rains triggered these landslides on the steep slopes of Mt. Elgon in Uganda, on March 1, 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Hubert
caption: Tropical Cyclone Hubert hovered over the Indian Ocean off the east coast of Madagascar in early March 2010.

title: Flooding in Mozambique
caption: By early March 2010, flooding in the Sofala Province of Mozambique had claimed at least two lives and flooded a major highway as a river overflowed its banks near the coast.

title: Flooding in Southern Spain
caption: By late February 2010, flooding had forced the evacuation of more than 1,000 people in southern Spain.

title: Flooding in Southwestern Queensland and South Australia
caption: Rivers swelled in southwestern Queensland in early March 2010 as settlements experienced varying levels of flooding. Rivers drained this water south, where it entered usually dry desert lakes.

title: Icebergs off the Antarctic Coast
caption: Two massive icebergs drifted along the coast of East Antarctica in early March 2010.

title: Snow in Eastern United States and Canada
caption: By early March 2010, repeated winter storms had left snow cover stretching from Canada southward to West Virginia.

title: Thick Ice in the Gulf of Bothnia
caption: Thick ice stranded dozens of ships in the Baltic Sea in late February and early March 2010.

title: Snow across the Upper Midwest
caption: Winter weather left a blanket of snow stretching from Missouri north to Canada by early March 2010.

title: Heavy Rains in Queensland
caption: In late February and early March 2010, a monsoon low-pressure system moved from Australiaâ€™s Northern Territory into Queensland.

title: Dust Plumes between Jordan and Iran
caption: Dust blew east-northeastward across Jordan, Syria and Iraq in early March 2010. The dust continued its eastward journey across Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and the Persian Gulf.

title: Windy Weather Carries Dust over Egypt and Saudi Arabia
caption: An intense storm sent strong winds gusting across Egypt and Saudi Arabia in late February 2010. The winds carried dust over the Red Sea and the Arabian Peninsula.

title: Violent Storm Strikes Western Europe
caption: An extratropical cyclone named Xynthia brought hurricane-force winds and high waves to Western Europe at the end of February 2010.

title: 8.8-magnitude Quake in Chile
caption: A magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck Chile on February 27, 2010, causing extensive damage around the capital city, Santiago, and triggering tsunami warnings around the Pacific Ocean. In the weeks that followed, several large aftershocks also occurred.

title: Snow Blankets the Rocky Mountains
caption: Winter snowstorms blanketed the Rocky Mountains in late February 2010.

title: Southern Madeira
caption: On February 20, 2010, torrential rain inundated the Portuguese island of Madeira. Water, rocks, and mud gushed down the slopes of the steep-sided island and though the streets of Funchal and other cities on the islandâ€™s populated southern coast.

title: Dust over Syria and Iraq
caption: A thick plume of dust blew out of Syria and over Iraq on February 22, 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gelane
caption: Tropical Cyclone Gelane spanned hundreds of kilometers east of Madagascar and Mauritius in the southern Indian Ocean in late February 2010.

title: Dust over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Dust swept north from the deserts of North Africa over the Mediterranean Sea in mid-February 2010.

title: Fires in Western Australia Nature Reserve
caption: Large bushfires in southern Western Australia in February 2010 affected visibility in a nature reserve, but as of February 18, they were not threatening communities or private property.

title: Activity at Sakurajima Volcano Intensifies
caption: Sakurajima Volcano erupted more than 400 times during 2009, and frequent activity continued through 2014 and 2015.

title: Heavy Rain in Central Australia
caption: Heavy rain fell over Australiaâ€™s interior in the second week of February 2010.

title: Partial Dome Collapse at Soufriere Hills
caption: At 12:35 p.m. local time on February 11, 2010, Soufri&eagrave;re Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat experienced a partial dome collapse. The event caused extensive damage to the nearby settlement of Harris, and disrupted Caribbean air traffic.

title: Snow in the US South
caption: An unusual winter storm covered a broad swath of the southern United States with snow on February 12-13, 2010.

title: Second Blizzard Strikes U.S. East Coast
caption: The second blizzard in less than a week pounded the U.S. East Coast on February 9 and 10, 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Rene
caption: Tropical Cyclone Rene raged over the southern Pacific Ocean in mid-February 2010.

title: Submarine Volcano Fukutoku-Okanoba Erupts
caption: Fukutoku-Okanoba erupted in early February 2010, releasing steam and ash plumes and coloring the nearby ocean water.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Argentina
caption: Jewel-toned waters glimmered off the coast of Argentina in early February 2010, thanks to a phytoplankton bloom.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Hundreds of fires were detected across Southeast Asia in February 2010. Widespread fires are a common occurrence during the region's annual dry season.

title: Dust Plumes over the Canary Islands
caption: Saharan dust skirted the Canary Islands in early February 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Pat
caption: Tropical Cyclone Pat raged over the southern Pacific Ocean in early February 2010.

title: Dust over Iran
caption: Dust plumes blew over Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and the Gulf of Oman in early February 2010.

title: Heavy Rains in Uruguay
caption: Along the southern margin of a heat wave in South Americaâ€™s mid-continent, strong thunderstorms led to heavy rain in the region of Buenos Aires and Uruguay early February 2010.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the Himalaya in early February 2010, perhaps resulting from a temperature inversion.

title: Heavy Snow around U.S. Capital
caption: An exceptionally severe winter storm dropped several feet of snow around the Washington, D.C., area in early February 2010.

title: Cyclone Oli
caption: Tropical Cyclone Oli swirled over the South Pacific in early February 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Fami
caption: Tropical Cyclone Fami hovered over Madagascar and the Mozambique Channel in early February 2010.

title: Flooding near Machu Picchu, Peru
caption: Heavy rain in the Andes Mountains in early February 2010 damaged roads, trails, train tracks, and bridges around the Incan ruins of Machu Picchu.

title: Ongoing Eruption of Tungurahua, Ecuador
caption: Tungurahua volcano began a significant eruption of ash on April 26, 2011. The eruption continued until at least May 4, 2011.

title: Dust over Iraq
caption: Dust blowing from the west covered southern Iraq on January 25, 2010.

title: Patagonian Dust over the Atlantic Ocean
caption: The Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASAâ€™s Aqua and Terra satellites tracked a dust storm moving from southern Argentina over the Atlantic Ocean on January 24, 2010.

title: Dasht-e Lut Dust Storm
caption: A large dust storm swept across the Dasht-e Lut Desert in eastern Iran on January 23, 2010.

title: Unrest at Turrialba Volcano, Costa Rica
caption: Strong, long-lasting volcanic tremors and emissions of gas and ash in early January 2010 marked an increase in activity at Costa Ricaâ€™s Turrialba volcano. Activity continued through January 2012.

title: Tropical Storm Olga
caption: Tropical Storm Olga crossed over northern Queensland, Australia, in late January 2010, but did not cause any significant damage.

title: Cyclone Magda
caption: Tropical Cyclone Magda came ashore in Western Australia on January 22, 2010, and was expected to quickly dissipate over land.

title: Storms in California
caption: A series of severe storms pounded California in January 2010, bringing strong winds and heavy rains.

title: Flooding in Tanzania
caption: By mid-January 2010, several weeks of heavy rain had destroyed homes, crops, pastures, roads, and bridges, and displaced thousands of residents in Tanzania.

title: Haze over China
caption: A temperature inversion—cold air near the ground and warm air aloft—likely contributed to widespread haze over much of China on January 18, 2010.

title: Floods in Australian Channel Country
caption: Rains flooded normally dry river channels in southwestern Queensland in January 2010.

title: Dust over Queensland, Australia
caption: A dust storm clouded the skies over Queensland, Australia, on January 17, 2010.

title: Annular Solar Eclipse over India
caption: On January 15, 2010, an annular eclipse lasted for 11 minutes and 8 seconds, visible from Africa to Asia.

title: Rapid Sea Ice Breakup along the Ronne-Filchner Ice Shelf
caption: On the morning of January 13, the MODIS sensor on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite spotted a large area of sea ice breaking away from the Ronne-Filchner Ice Shelf.

title: 7.0 Quake Near Port Au Prince
caption: On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck Hispaniola Island, just 15 kilometers (10 miles) southwest of the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince. More than 30 aftershocks rocked the region over the next day.

title: Snow across U.S. Midwest
caption: Cold and snow gripped much of the U.S. Midwest in early January 2010.

title: Snow around the Aral Sea
caption: Snow surrounded the Aral Sea in early January 2010.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Iran
caption: Winds blowing out of the north sent a thick plume of dust over western Afghanistan and eastern Iran on January 7, 2010.

title: Snow across Great Britain
caption: Heavy snow fell across Great Britain in early January 2010, followed by frigid temperatures.

title: Tropical Cyclone Edzani
caption: Tropical Cyclone Edzani formed over the southern Indian Ocean in early January 2010 and intensified rapidly.

title: Eruption of Gaua Volcano
caption: Activity at Gaua Volcano, in the South Pacific archipelago of Vanuatu, began in October 2009 and increased in April 2010. Steam and gas emissions continued into 2013.

title: Flooding in New South Wales
caption: Heavy rains in New South Wales, Australia, in January 2010 forced the evacuation of hundreds of residents and left extensive standing water near the town of Coonamble.

title: Heavy Snow in Eastern China and Korea
caption: Up to 30 centimeters (12 inches) of snow fell on Beijing and the nearby port city of Tianjin in early January 2010. The snow was reportedly the heaviest to fall in the Chinese capital city since 1951. Record-breaking snow fell in South Korea, as well.

title: Snow in South-Central United States
caption: Snow cover stretched across the south-central United States on December 25, 2009.

title: Dust over Eastern China
caption: Dust hovered over eastern China in late December 2009. Much of the dust likely arose in Mongolia.

title: Deadly Cold Across Europe and Russia
caption: A wave of frigid air spilled down over Europe and Russia from the Arctic in mid-December, creating a deadly cold snap.

title: Snowstorm Hits the U.S. East Coast
caption: Deep snow blanketed the U.S. East Coast after a powerful snow storm on December 19-20, 2009.

title: Heavy Rain in the Southeast United States
caption: Heavy rains and flash floods struck parts of Alabama and Louisiana in mid-December 2009.

title: Tropical Cyclone Laurence
caption: The first cyclone of the Australian season, Laurence struck off the northwest coast in mid-December 2009.

title: Mayon Volcano Threatens Major Eruption
caption: In late December 2009, the volcano hazard at Mayon Volcano in the Philippines reached Alert Level 4, which means â€œa hazardous explosive eruption is possible within days.â€

title: Iceberg B17-B in the Indian Ocean
caption: Far from its birthplace on the Ross Ice Shelf, iceberg B17-B was adrift off the southwestern coast of Australia in late 2009 and early 2010.

title: Fires near Perth, Western Australia
caption: Scattered bushfires in southern Western Australia spread smoke over Perth in mid-December 2009.

title: Cyclone Mick
caption: Cylone Mick battered Fiji in December 2009.

title: Lava and Snow on Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: Klyuchevskaya is one of the world’s most active volcanoes.

title: Winter Storm Crosses the United States
caption: A severe winter storm blustered its way across the United States on December 7 and 8, 2009.

title: Fires in Western Africa
caption: Agricultural fires burned in western Africa in early December 2009.

title: Ash Plume from Tavurvur, Papua New Guinea
caption: Intermittent activity has been the norm at Tavurvur Cone on the northeast rim of Rabaul Caldera since a massive eruption in 1994. Showers of lava and columns of ash marked a late-November 2009 eruption.

title: Harmful Bloom in Lake AtitlÃ¡n, Guatemala
caption: Normally a picturesque blue lake surrounded by steep volcanoes and Mayan settlements, Guatemalaâ€™s Lake AtitlÃ¡n acquired a film of green scum in October and November 2009.

title: Flooding in Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay
caption: Late November 2009 brought severe flooding to South America, affecting areas along the Atlantic coast, including northern Argentina, Uruguay, and southern Brazil.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Thick haze piled up along the Himalaya Mountains in northern India in early December 2009.

title: Dust over Southeast Australia
caption: Dust blew over southeastern Australia on November 29, 2009.

title: Bezymianny Volcano
caption: Bezymianny Volcano on Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula continued to erupt in 2013.

title: Tropical Storm Nida
caption: Nida formed as a tropical depression over the western Pacific Ocean on November 22, 2009, and soon strengthened to a tropical storm.

title: Landslides on Volcan de San Vicente
caption: Torrential rains in November 2009 triggered landslides and deadly mudflows north of San Vicente Volcano in El Salvador.

title: Fire in Western Australia’s Nuytsland Nature Reserve
caption: A fire in the Nuytsland Nature Reserve in Western Australia was triggered by lightning in the second week of November, and it had burned about 30,000 hectares (74,130 acres) as of November 20.

title: Snow in Ontario
caption: A broad band of snow striped Ontario between James Bay and Lake Superior in mid-November 2009.

title: Mid-November Colorado Snowstorm
caption: Not long after the snow from an October storm melted, the Denver area experienced another significant autumn snowstorm, in mid-November 2009.

title: Spring Bloom in the South Atlantic Ocean
caption: A springtime phytoplankton bloom colored the South Atlantic Ocean off Argentina in November 2009.

title: Dust over Afghanistan
caption: Dust blew out of the Sistan Wetlands along the Afghanistan and Iran border in mid-November 2009. The dried wetlands are a frequent source of dust.

title: Tropical Cyclone Anja
caption: Anja formed over the Southern Indian Ocean in mid-November 2009, strengthening to a Category 3 cyclone.

title: Heavy Snow in Northern China
caption: The heaviest snowfall in decades struck northern China in mid-November 2009. Hardest hit was Hebei Province in eastern China, where snow collapsed buildings, iced roads, and caused 38 deaths.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Chile
caption: Jewel-toned waters swirled in the Pacific Ocean off the Chilean coast on November 10, 2009.

title: Fires in Northwestern India
caption: Fires burned in northwestern India near the Pakistan border in early November 2009.

title: Sediment in the Gulf of Mexico
caption: Tan and green clouds of sediment colored the Gulf of Mexico in November 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Phyan
caption: Tropical Storm Phyan came ashore near the India-Pakistan border in early November 2009. The storm was expected to dissipate over land.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: Winter winds blew dust from southwest Asia over the Arabian Sea in November 2009.

title: Argentina Dust over the Atlantic Ocean
caption: A plume of dust from the agricultural grasslands of Argentina blew over the South Atlantic Ocean on November 5, 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Ida
caption: Late in the Atlantic hurricane season, Tropical Storm Ida soaked Central America in the first week of November 2009.

title: Flooding along the Illinois River
caption: Heavy rains caused flooding in southern and western Illinois in late October and early November 2009.

title: Flooding in Eastern Arkansas
caption: At the end of October 2009, a slow-moving storm dropped 3 to 6 inches (8 to 15 centimeters) of rain on Arkansas, just west of the Mississippi River.

title: Egyptian Dust Storm
caption: Saharan dust blew north over the Mediterranean Sea on November 4, 2009.

title: October Snow in Colorado
caption: A large storm blanketed Denver with heavy snow in late October 2009.

title: Glacial Dust off Alaska
caption: Fine dust blew over the Gulf of Alaska on October 29, 2009.

title: Oil Fire in India
caption: An intense fire broke out at an oil depot in western India on October 29, 2009.

title: Ash Emissions at Nevado del Huila
caption: Volcanic tremors and emissions of ash have affected Colombiaâ€™s Nevado del Huila Volcano since October 16, 2009.

title: Haze over India
caption: Haze built over the Ganges Plain along the front of the Himalaya Mountains in late October 2009.

title: Haze over China
caption: Thick haze covered eastern China on October 28, 2009.

title: Dust Storm in North Central Australia
caption: A dust storm blew across Northern Territory and Queensland in Australia in late October 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Mirinae
caption: Tropical Storm 23 strengthened to a named storm, Mininae, in late October 2009. Initially located northwest of Guam, the storm strengthened into a typhoon and headed toward the Philippines.

title: Spring Bloom in New Zealand Waters
caption: The spring 2009 phytoplankton bloom off the east coast of New Zealand colored the waters shades of turquoise and green.

title: Fire at Fuel Storage Facility in Puerto Rico
caption: A fire at a fuel storage facility in Puerto Rico billowed brownish smoke over the Caribbean Sea in late October 2009.

title: Fires in Northwestern India
caption: Agricultural fires burned in northwestern India in late October 2009.

title: Hurricane Neki
caption: Neki formed as a tropical depression over the Pacific Ocean on October 18, 2009. By October 21, the storm had strengthened to a Category 3 hurricane and was headed toward the Papahanaumokuakea National Monument.

title: Fires in Queensland, Australia
caption: Multiple fires burned along the coast of Queensland, Australia, in late October 2009 and into November.

title: Tropical Storm Rick
caption: Hurricane Rick was downgraded to a tropical storm on October 20, 2009. A tropical storm warning remained in effect for Mexico on October 21.

title: Fires in North Korea
caption: Multiple fires burned in North Korea in mid-October 2009, sending a plume of smoke over the Sea of Japan.

title: Fires in Southwestern Australia
caption: Multiple fires burned in Western Australia, south of Perth, on October 16, 2009.

title: Typhoon Lupit
caption: Lupit began as a tropical depression over the Western Pacific on October 14, 2009. By October 16, the storm had strengthened to a typhoon.

title: Australian Dust Storm
caption: Dust from inland Australia blew east over the Australian coast and the South Pacific Ocean in mid-October 2009.

title: Dust over the Black Sea
caption: Thick dust blew north across Turkey and over the Black Sea on October 13, 2009.

title: Fires in South Central Russia
caption: Wildfires and/or agricultural fires burned in south Central Russia in early October 2009.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Bering Sea
caption: A phytoplankton bloom brightened the Bering Sea in early October 2009.

title: Earthquakes Near Vanuatu
caption: On October 8 and 9, 2009, more than a dozen earthquakes of magnitude 5.0 or greater occurred near the island nation of Vanuatu.

title: Ship Trails over the Pacific Ocean
caption: A bank of clouds off the west coast of North America featured a series of ship trails in early October 2009.

title: Vog from Ambrym Volcano
caption: Ambrym Volcano in the Vanuatu archipelago remains active in 2013.

title: Soufriere Hills Volcano Resumes Activity
caption: After 10 months of relative quiet, Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island Montserrat resumed activity in early October 2009. It remained active in early 2010, covering large areas with pyroclastic flows.

title: Floods in Southern India
caption: Several days of heavy rain in southern India left millions homeless in October 2009.

title: Dust Storm in Eastern Washington
caption: Visibility dropped to zero in parts of eastern Washington on October 4, 2009, as a large dust storm blew through.

title: Super Typhoon Melor
caption: Super Typhoon Melor formed over the Pacific Ocean in early October 2009. As of October 7, the storm was being predicted to come ashore on the island of Honshu southeast of Osaka.

title: Fires in Eastern Africa
caption: Fires burned near the shores of three East African lakes in early October 2009.

title: Haze in China
caption: Patches of gray-white haze covered eastern China and snaked east to Korea on October 2, 2009.

title: Earthquake off Samoa Generates Tsunami
caption: A large (magnitude 8.0) undersea earthquake near Samoa in late September 2009 generated a destructive tsunami that killed over 100 people.

title: 7.6-Magnitude Earthquake off Sumatra
caption: Two earthquakes, one with a magnitude of 7.6 and the other with a magnitude of 5.5, struck southern Sumatra on September 30, 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Parma
caption: Typhoon Parma moved westward across the Pacific Ocean in late September 2009. Parma was downgraded to a tropical storm as it passed over the Philippines, but moved back toward the islands, apparently interacting with Typhoon Melor to the northeast. Parma finally dissipated on October 14.

title: Fires in Yellowstone
caption: Fires broke out in Yellowstone in September 2009. The Arnica Fire near Yellowstone Lake started on September 13 but grew dramatically starting on September 24, thanks to warm, dry weather.

title: Tropical Storm Ketsana
caption: After causing devastating floods in the Philippines in late September 2009, Tropical Storm Ketsana (Ondoy) continued westward toward Southeast Asia.

title: Heavy Rains in the Philippines
caption: On September 26, 2009, Tropical Storm Ketsana dropped a month's worth of rain in a matter of hours on the Philippine capital, Manila.

title: Wildfires in Oregon
caption: Lightning strikes caused wildfires not far from Eugene, Oregon, in early September 2009. Unfavorable weather conditions hampered firefighting efforts later in the month.

title: Fires in Baja California
caption: Wildfires burned in Baja California in late September 2009.

title: Fires in Eastern Australia
caption: Fires burned throughout Queensland, Australia in late September 2009. Fires burned along the coast, and a large complex of fires burned near Tambo, Queensland.

title: Fire in Ventura County, California
caption: The Guiberson Fire broke out in Ventura County, California, on September 22, 2009, threatening  hundreds of homes.

title: Dust over Eastern Australia
caption: A powerful dust storm swept over eastern Australia on September 23, 2009, extending from Northern Queensland to Victoria across the eastern coast of Australia.

title: Saharan Dust over the Atlantic
caption: A tan cloud of Saharan dust hung over the North Atlantic Ocean on September 21, 2009.

title: Heavy Rain in U.S. Southeast
caption: In September 2009, several storms over the southeastern United States left behind acres of standing water and multiple deaths.

title: Earthquake in Bhutan
caption: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck the mountainous nation of Bhutan on the afternoon of September 21, 2009. According to reports from AFP, at least 10 people died, and some houses and monasteries near the epicenter were damaged. Shaking from the earthquake was felt throughout Bhutan and in Tibet and northeastern India.

title: Fires in Mozambique
caption: Agricultural fires and wildfires burned in and around Mozambique in mid-September 2009.

title: Ol Doinyo Lengai Ashfall
caption: A series of explosive eruptions altered Tanzaniaâ€™s Ol Doinyo Lengai, the only volcano in the world that erupts natrocarbonatite lava.

title: Australian Dust over the Pacific Ocean
caption: A dense cloud of dust blew across southern Australia and over the Pacific Ocean in mid-September 2009.

title: Earthquake off the Coast of Venezuela
caption: A strong earthquake struck off the Venezuelan coast on September 12, 2009.

title: Dust Plume Across Northern Patagonia
caption: A rippling plume of dust crossed northern Patagonia, Argentina, in mid-September 2009.

title: Super Typhoon Choi-Wan
caption: Super Typhoon Choi-Wan reached a dangerous Category 5 status as it tracked northwest across the western North Pacific Ocean in mid-September 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Koppu
caption: Tropical Storm Koppu headed northwest through the South China Sea toward southern China in mid-September 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Mujigae
caption: Tropical Storm Mujigae traveled westward between the Philippines and Vietnam in early September 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Linda
caption: Tropical Storm Linda traveled north-northwestward over the Pacific Ocean in early September 2009. As of September 11, the storm was expected to weaken as it traveled over cool waters.

title: Heavy rain in Istanbul
caption: The worst rain in 80 years struck northwestern Turkey, including the city of Istanbul, in early September 2009.

title: Hurricane Fred
caption: Hurricane Fred traveled northwestward across the Atlantic Ocean in early September 2009.

title: Fires and Smoke in Borneo
caption: Thick smoke covered much of Borneo in September 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Dujuan
caption: Tropical Storm Dujuan formed over the western Pacific Ocean in early September 2009.

title: Floods across the Western Sahel
caption: In late August and early September 2009, widespread flooding occurred throughout western North Africa along the western expanse of the Sahel.

title: Tropical Storm Erika
caption: Between September 1 and 4, 2009, Tropical Storm Erika formed and degraded over the warm waters of the western Atlantic Ocean.

title: 7.0 Quake off Java
caption: A 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck off the southwestern coast of Java on September 2, 2009. The quake triggered landslides south of the capital city, Jakarta.

title: Oil Slick in the Timor Sea
caption: An oil rig in the Timor Sea began leaking oil and gas on August 21, 2009, and fuel continued to spill into the sea in mid-September.

title: Tropical Storm Krovanh
caption: Tropical Storm Krovanh blew along the coastline of Japan, near the capital city, Tokyo, on August 31, 2009.

title: Hurricane Jimena
caption: Hurricane Jimena headed toward the Baja Peninsula as a Category 4 hurricane on August 30, 2009. The storm had weakened by September 3, 2009, but poured heavy rain on Mexico.

title: Fires in Los Angeles County
caption: Wildfires raged in Los Angeles County in late August and early September 2009.

title: Activity at Koryaksky Volcano
caption: Koryaksky Volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula released intermittent plumes of ash and/or steam in late August 2009.

title: Floods along the India-Nepal Border
caption: Late-arriving monsoon rains caused rivers along the India-Nepal border to rise above their banks, flooding crops and villages in northern India.

title: Flooding along the Brahmaputra River
caption: Late-arriving monsoon rains stranded tens of thousands in Bangladesh and flooded tens of thousands of hectares of cropland in late August 2009.

title: Afghanistan Dust Storm
caption: Thick plumes of dust blew from the Sistan Wetlands of western Afghanistan and eastern Iran on August 25, 2009, blanketing the region with a cloud of dust.

title: Tropical Storm Hilda
caption: Tropical Storm Hilda was more than 500 miles southeast of Hawaii on August 25, 2009, and was headed west.

title: Fires in Greece
caption: Aided by strong winds, forest fires burned out of control in Greece in August 2009. The largest fire burned on the outskirts of Athens.

title: Smoke over the Pacific Northwest
caption: Fires in British Columbia smothered parts of that province as well as Washington state with thick smoke on August 19, 2009.

title: Typhoon Vamco
caption: Typhoon Vamco built into a powerful storm as it tracked north across the Pacific in August 2009. By August 25, it was weakening as it headed northeast.

title: Floods in Northwestern Pakistan
caption: Floods struck northwestern Pakistan in mid-August 2009. Some 70,000 to 80,000 people were affected as floods destroyed homes, killed livestock, and swept away stored grain.

title: Dust Over Iraq and Kuwait
caption: Thick clouds of dust blew from the agricultural lands between the Euphrates and Tigris Rivers in Iraq on August 15, 2009.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust plumes formed over the Taklimakan Desert in mid-August 2009.

title: Hurricane Bill
caption: Bill became the first hurricane of the 2009 Atlantic hurricane season on August 17. It reached Category 4 strength, but fortunately for East Coast residents, the storm stayed away from  shore.

title: Dust Storm in Argentina
caption: Thick plumes of dust blew from the exposed shore of Argentina's Laguna Mar Chiquita on August 16, 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Claudette
caption: The fourth tropical depression of the 2009 Atlantic hurricane season matured into Tropical Storm Claudette around noon (Eastern Standard Time) on Sunday, August 16.

title: Lockheed Fire, Santa Cruz Mountains
caption: On August 12, 2009, the Lockheed Fire broke out in the mountains southwest of San Jose, California, and burned through an estimated 2,600 acres of brush and timber by the morning of August 14.

title: Drought in California’s Central Valley
caption: By the end of July 2009, California was well into its third dry year in a row.

title: Hurricane Guillermo
caption: Guillermo formed on August 12 about 1,085 kilometers (675 miles) southwest of the southern tip of Baja California and grew into a weak hurricane as it tracked west over the Pacific Ocean.

title: Fires in California
caption: A large wildfire was burning in the Los Padres National Forest northwest of Santa Barbara, California, in mid-August 2009. Farther north, a wildfire near Santa Cruz forced more than 2,000 people to evacuate their homes.

title: Drought on the Canadian Prairie
caption: Regional drought hit farmers on the Canadian prairie during the critical period in which grains are planted and begin to develop in the spring and early summer of 2009.

title: Smoke from Fires in Russia and Alaska
caption: Intense fires burning in the boreal forests of northern Russia, Alaska, and Canada darkened Northern skies with smoke in July and August 2009.

title: Drought in Texas
caption: Extreme drought settled over southern Texas in the summer of 2009.

title: Plume from Bagana
caption: Bagana Volcano on the island of Bougainville in Papua New Guinea released a faint plume in early August 2009.

title: Typhoon Morakot
caption: Typhoon Morakot became a Category 2 storm before moving over Taiwan on August 7, 2009.

title: Hurricane Felicia
caption: Hurricane Felicia became a dangerous Category 4 hurricane as it tracked west across the Pacific Ocean in August 2009.

title: Bloom in the Norwegian Sea
caption: A brilliant summer phytoplankton bloom developed in the waters of the Norwegian Sea in August 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Enrique
caption: Tropical Storm Enrique and Hurricane Felicia formed near each other and tracked west together across the Pacific Ocean in early August 2009.

title: Summer Haze in the Eastern United States
caption: Though air quality was good to moderate along the Eastern seaboard on August 4, 2009, light summer haze settled over the region.

title: Fires in British Columbia, Canada
caption: Thousands of people were evacuated from their homes in British Columbia in the first week of August 2009 because of hundreds of forest fires.

title: Floods in Northeastern India
caption: The northeastern Indian state of Bihar experienced severe flooding in early August 2009, leaving thousands of residents homeless.

title: Fire on La Palma, Canary Islands
caption: A fire in the Canary Islands forced several thousand people to evacuate homes and tourist accommodations during the first weekend of August 2009.

title: Fires in Yukon Territory, Canada
caption: Numerous lightning-caused fires were burning in Yukon Territory, Canada, in late July 2009.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: A second severe dust storm in just over a month struck Iraq in late July 2009, blowing southeastward over the Tigris and Euphrates floodplains.

title: Heavy Rain in Southern Japan
caption: Heavy rains struck southern Japan in July 2009.

title: Wildfire at Okanagan Lake, British Columbia
caption: British Columbia, Canada, was experiencing extremely dry conditions in July 2009, and hot, dry weather was predicted to continue. Those conditions set the stage for a large fire that broke out northwest of Kelowna in mid-July.

title: Eclipse Shadows Southeastern China
caption: An unusually long solar eclipse darkens Eastern Hemisphere skies on July 22, 2009.

title: Dust Storm over Southern Bolivia
caption: Dust blew across southern Bolivia on July 21, 2009. Most of the plumes arose from or near large salt flats along the western border.

title: Weak Rains from India’s Monsoon
caption: With isolated exceptions, the Indian monsoon brought far less rain than normal to south Asia in 2009.

title: Fires in Eastern Russia
caption: Intense fires burning in the boreal forests of northeastern Russia, Alaska, and Canada in July 2009 filled Arctic skies with smoke.

title: Typhoon Molave Floods the Philippines
caption: Typhoon Molave caused extensive flooding when it moved over the northern Philippines island of Luzon on July 17 and July 18, 2009.

title: Dust Plumes in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust plumes fringed the southwestern rim of the Taklimakan Desert on July 18, 2009.

title: Typhoon Molave
caption: After inundating the Philippines with flood-inducing rain, Typhoon Molave moved across the South China Sea and into China.

title: Dust Plumes off West Africa
caption: A new dust storm began blowing off the west coast of Africa on July 18, 2009. The dust remained visible the next day.

title: Plume from Nyiragongo
caption: Nyiragongo Volcano in the Democratic Republic of the Congo is one of Africa’s most active.

title: 7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off New Zealand’s South Island
caption: A 7.6-magnitude earthquake struck the southwest coast of New Zealandâ€™s South Island on July 15, 2009.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: Dust blew across the Red Sea, from Sudan toward Saudi Arabia, in mid-July 2009.

title: Volcanic Activity at Krakatau
caption: Anak Krakatau has erupted frequently since 2009.

title: Drought in Africa
caption: Rain came late in East Africa’s March-to-June rainy season and little fell. Following a poor rainy season in 2008, the ensuing drought caused food and water shortages.

title: Flooding on the Amazon
caption: Rivers in the Amazon basin flood annually, but 2009 brought extreme floods to the region near Manaus, Brazil.

title: Dust Plume off West Africa
caption: Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over Cape Verde on July 12, 2009.

title: Dust Plumes from Afghanistan
caption: Dust plumes blew along the borders between Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Iran in early July 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over the Red Sea
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Sudan and over the Red Sea in early July 2009.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: As the rainy season migrates north and south across Africa each year, a wave of widespread fires precedes its arrival. Fires were widespread across central Africa in early July 2009.

title: Manam Volcano
caption: Manam Volcano off the coast of Mainland Papua New Guinea released a faint volcanic plume in late June 2009.

title: Fires in Interior Alaska
caption: "Lightning season" in interior Alaska peaks in late June and early July. Numerous lightning-triggered fires continued to burn in August 2009.

title: Intense Rain Floods China and Vietnam
caption: Unusually heavy rain pounded southern China and northern Vietnam in early July 2009, causing widespread flooding.

title: Plume from Suwanose-jima
caption: Suwanose-jima in the Ryukyu Islands of Japan released plumes of ash and steam in early July 2009.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq and Iran
caption: A dust storm struck Iraq in late June 2009 and continued for over a week, disrupting air traffic and forcing hundreds to seek medical assistance.

title: Dust Plumes off the West Coast of Africa
caption: Saharan dust formed giant arcs off the west coast of Africa at the beginning of July 2009.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: A dust storm blew across the Red Sea on June 30, 2009, from Sudan toward Saudi Arabia.

title: Dust Storm over the Aral Sea
caption: A dust storm formed over the southern portion of the Aral Sea on June 28, 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over Turkey
caption: Dust plumes, which likely originated on the Arabian Peninsula, hovered over Turkey in late June 2009.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Thick haze blew eastward off the coast of China, over Bo Hai and the Yellow Sea in late June 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Nangka
caption: Tropical Storm Nangka passed through the Philippines in late June 2009, bringing floods, landslides, and tornadoes. This image shows the storm track and rainfall amounts in the region between June 18 and June 25, 2009.

title: Hurricane Andres
caption: The first named storm of the eastern Pacific hurricane season fired up in mid-June 2009. Tropical Storm Andres briefly reached hurricane strength on June 23 before weakening.

title: Dust Plumes off Western Africa
caption: Saharan sand blew off the coasts of Mauritania and Senegal on June 22, 2009.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Fires burned throughout Central Africa in mid-June 2009, from Lake Tanganyika to the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Dust Storm in the Middle East
caption: A dust storm struck the Middle East on June 18, 2009, affecting countries from Syria to Iran.

title: Landslide in Southern China
caption: On June 5, 2009, a mountainside collapsed in the Chongqing region of southern China. The landslide dropped some 12 million cubic meters (420 million cubic feet) onto several homes and an iron ore mine, trapping dozens of people. According to a June 18 report from Xinhua News Agency, 64 people remained missing.

title: Dust Storm along the Iranian Coast
caption: A dust storm struck Iran in mid-June 2009. The dust blew along the Iranian coast over the Gulf of Oman.

title: Eruption of Sarychev Peak, Kuril Islands
caption: Sarychev Peak in the Central Kuril Islands released volcanic ash plumes and a large cloud of sulfur dioxide in early June 2009. The volcano was intermittently active over the following year.

title: Crop Recovery in Afghanistan
caption: Following months of dry weather, beneficial rains arrived in Afghanistan in March 2009, resulting in robust plant growth.

title: Drought in Iraq
caption: The drought that gripped Iraq beginning in the 2007-2008 growing season extended into 2009.

title: Fires in Australia’s Kakadu National Park
caption: Early-season fires (probably controlled burns to reduce dead vegetation) were widespread across northern Australiaâ€™s Kakadu National Park in mid-June 2009.

title: Dust and Clouds over the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust and clouds hovered over the Taklimakan Desert in  early June 2009.

title: Tornadoes in Northeastern Colorado
caption: A violent spring storm brought funnel clouds and hail to the Denver metropolitan area on June 7, 2009.

title: Dust Storm in the Middle East
caption: Dust blew through Syria, Iraq, and Saudi Arabia in early June 2009.

title: Dust Plumes off the West Coast of Africa
caption: Dust plumes blew off the west coast of Africa and over the Atlantic Ocean in early June 2009.

title: Dust Plume off the Libyan Coast
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Libya at the end of May 2009.

title: Floods from Cyclone Aila in India and Bangladesh
caption: Cyclone Aila flooded large areas of India and Bangladesh in late May 2009.

title: 7.3 Magnitude Quake off the Honduras Coast
caption: A 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck just off the coast of Honduras at 2:24 a.m. local time (08:24 UTC) on May 28, 2009. Smaller aftershocks followed the initial quake.

title: Cyclone Aila
caption: Tropical Storm Aila struck southern Bangladesh and eastern India in late May 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over India and Pakistan
caption: Dust swirled over the India-Pakistan border in late May 2009.

title: Fires in Russia’s Far East
caption: Forest fires were burning in Russia's Far East in late May 2009.

title: Dust over Cape Verde
caption: Dust plumes blew off the west coast of Africa and over Cape Verde in late May 2009.

title: Rare Cyclonic Storm over Northern Argentina
caption: A rare cyclonic storm inundated Argentina and Paraguay in the third week of May 2009.

title: Smoke Plume near Japan
caption: Smoke colored the sky while phytoplankton colored the water near Japan in late May 2009.

title: Dust over Iraq, Syria, and Turkey
caption: Dust blew across Iraq, Syria, and Turkey on May 21, 2009.

title: Fires in Russia and Mongolia
caption: Large, smoky fires were burning in the forested mountains of Russia's Buryatia region and Mongolia's Belenge province in May 2009.

title: Smoke over Northeastern China
caption: Wildfire smoke blew across Mongolia, Inner Mongolia, and northeastern China in mid-May 2009.

title: Floods in South America
caption: Heavy rain began to fall over northern Brazil in early April 2009 and persisted for several weeks, causing the most severe flooding in more than two decades.

title: Activity at Shiveluch Volcano
caption: Shiveluch is one of the largest and most active volcanoes on Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula

title: Typhoon Chan Hom
caption: Within the span of a week in early May 2009, two cyclones struck the northern Philippines island of Luzon, causing extensive flooding.

title: Fires Across West Siberian Plain
caption: Scores of fires, probably agriculture-related, were burning in central Russia in mid-May 2009.

title: Jesusita Fire, California
caption: Pushed by strong winds, the Jesusita fire near Santa Barbara, California, had damaged or destroyed at least 75 buildings and forced the evacuation of thousands of residents by May 8, 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over the Middle East and Europe
caption: Thick dust plumes blew over Syria and Iraq as thinner plumes blew as far north as Russia in early May 2009.

title: Dust Storm over Sudan
caption: A massive dust storm hovered over Sudan and neighboring countries in early May 2009.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Another dust storm blew eastward out of the Taklimakan Desert in early May 2009, continuing a pattern of intermittent dust-storm activity in the region.

title: Dust Plumes off Pakistan and Iran
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coasts of Pakistan and Iran in early May 2009.

title: Plume from Dukono
caption: Dukono, a volcano on the Indonesian island of Halmahera, released a plume of ash and steam in early May 2009. This pattern of intermittent activity continued through April 2014.

title: Fires in Eastern Russia
caption: In late April 2009, widespread fires burned in the Amur River region of eastern Russia.

title: Cyclonic Clouds over the South Atlantic
caption: Two polar cyclones circled gracefully over the cold waters of the South Atlantic Ocean on April 29, 2009.

title: Plume from Batu Tara
caption: Batu Tara, a volcano on the Pulau Komba island in the Lesser Sunda Islands, remained active in 2012, emitting sporadic plumes.

title: Dust Plume off Libya
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Libya and over the Mediterranean Sea on April 28, 2009.

title: Agricultural Fires in Western Russia
caption: Widespread agricultural fires were burning across western Russia in mid-April 2009.

title: Dust Storm in China and Mongolia
caption: A day before dust settled over eastern China, dust storms blew through northern China and southern Mongolia on April 23, 2009.

title: Plume from Shiveluch Volcano
caption: Shiveluch Volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula released continuous plumes of ash and steam in late April 2009.

title: Dust Storm in Eastern China
caption: Dust storms struck northern China in late April 2009. Thick dust plumes hovered over the lowlands west of Bo Hai.

title: Fires along the South Carolina Coast
caption: Wildfires raged along the coast of South Carolina in late April 2009, burning more than 40 homes and damaging 100 more.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust plumes hovered over the Taklimakan Desert in mid-April 2009.

title: Tropical Storm Bijli
caption: Tropical Storm Bijli formed in the Bay of Bengal in mid-April 2009, and the storm appeared to be headed for landfall in eastern Bangladesh on April 17.

title: Dust Storm in Southeastern Australia
caption: A dust storm struck southeastern Australia in mid-April 2009, west of the capital city of Canberra.

title: Dust Plumes over Iraq
caption: Dust plumes hovered over Iraq and the surrounding region in mid-April 2009.

title: Plume from Mount Pagan
caption: Starting in 2009, and continuing into 2013, North Pagan Volcano has emitted intermittent plumes of gas and ash.

title: Haze over the Gulf of Mexico
caption: Fires across the Yucatan Peninsula sent haze northward over the Gulf of Mexico and toward the United States in early April 2009.

title: Dust Plumes off Libya
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of Libya and over the Mediterranean Sea in early April 2009.

title: Fires in Texas and Oklahoma
caption: Severe weather in the second week of April 2009 fanned wildfires in northern Texas and southern Oklahoma.

title: Eruption on Isla Fernandina
caption: In early April 2009, La Cumbre Volcano on Isla Fernandina in the Galapagos Islands erupted.

title: Haze over the Sea of Japan
caption: A thick band of haze blew over the Sea of Japan on April 10, 2009.

title: Haze over the Sea of Azov
caption: A narrow band of haze formed over the Sea of Azov on April 7, 2009.

title: Wilkins Ice Bridge Collapse
caption: A narrow ice bridge between Charcot Island and Antarctica's Wilkins Ice Shelf broke apart in early April 2009. In subsequent days, ice fragments in the region showed characteristics of post-breakup deformation.

title: Eruption from Llaima Volcano, Chile
caption: After months of low-level seismic activity, Llaima Volcano in Chile erupted in early April 2009.

title: Dust Storm in Northeastern Arizona
caption: A dust storm struck northeastern Arizona on April 3, 2009, forcing the temporary closure of part of Interstate 40.

title: Tropical Storm Jade
caption: Tropical Storm Jade came ashore over Madagascar on April 6, 2009.

title: Fires in Southern Mexico and Central America
caption: Scores of fires were burning in southern Mexico, on the Yucatan Peninsula, and in northern Guatemala and northern Honduras in early April 2009.

title: Plume from Rabaul Volcano
caption: Rabaul Volcano on the northeastern end of New Britain released plumes of volcanic ash and/or steam in early April 2009. After a pause of several years, vigorous activity resumed in early 2013.

title: Dust Plumes off Libya
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Libya and over the Mediterranean Sea on April 1, 2009.

title: Deadly Flooding in Namibia
caption: At least 350,000 people were affected by flooding in Namibia during the annual rainy season in southern Africa in March 2009. Nearly 100 people died, and more than 10,000 were displaced as the Zambezi River rose to its highest level in 40 years.

title: Fires in East Gippsland, Victoria
caption: Several bushfires were burning in state and national parks in the eastern corner of Victoria in late March 2009, spreading smoke across a large area of southern Victoria, including Melbourne.

title: Dust Plumes off Argentina
caption: Drought-ravaged Patagonia continued producing dust in late March 2009.

title: Floods on the Red River
caption: Swollen by melting snow, the Red River reached record levels near Fargo, North Dakota, and Moorhead, Minnesota, in late March 2009. By April, the flooded river threatened Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.

title: Spring Snow Storm over the US Central Plains
caption: An intense spring snow storm buried Denver, Colorado, in as much as 17 inches of snow before continuing east across the Central Plains.

title: Severe Thunderstorms over Mississippi
caption: Severe thunderstorms swept through the southeastern United States on March 26, 2009. The storms dropped heavy rain and hail and spawned tornadoes.

title: Dust Plumes over Central Asia
caption: Dust plumes blew over central Asia in late March 2009.

title: Cyclone Izilda
caption: A small cyclone that formed in the strait between southern Africa and Madagascar on March 24, 2009, Cyclone Izilda was not forecast to go ashore.

title: Dust East and West of the Red Sea
caption: Dust stirred on either side of the Red Sea in late March 2009.

title: Floods in Southern Africa
caption: Heavy seasonal rain triggered floods in Angola and Namibia in March 2009.

title: Haze in the Sichuan Basin
caption: Haze hovered over the Sichuan Basin in China in late March 2009.

title: Cyclone Ilsa
caption: Far from the west coast of Australia, Cyclone Ilsa tracked west-southwest through the Indian Ocean in mid-march 2009.

title: Submarine Eruption in the Tonga Islands
caption: A submarine volcanic eruption occurred in the Tonga Islands of the South Pacific in mid-March 2009.

title: Fires in West Africa
caption: Agricultural and other land-management or trash-burning fires were widespread across West Africa in mid-March 2009.

title: Dust Storm over Argentina
caption: A dust storm struck the coast of Argentina in mid-March 2009.

title: Dust over Eastern China
caption: Dust from China's interior deserts moved eastward across the country in mid-March 2009.

title: Dust over Iraq
caption: A massive dust plume hovered over eastern Iraq and skirted the Iranian border in mid-March 2009.

title: Forest Fires in Nepal
caption: Several large forest fires burned in the Himalaya Mountains of northern Nepal in mid-March 2009.

title: Dust over the Canary Islands
caption: Saharan dust swept over the Canary Islands in early March 2009.

title: Dust Clouds over Central Africa
caption: Dust plumes blew over central Africa in early March 2009.

title: Ashfall from Shiveluch
caption: In the first week of March 2009 several large ash eruptions occurred at Shiveluch Volcano in northeast Russia. Between March 8 and March 10, ash eruptions reached altitudes of 6.1-6.4 kilometers (20,000-21,000 feet) above sea level, and the clouds of ash drifted southeast, coating the snowy landscape.

title: Ashfall from Karymsky Volcano
caption: Karymsky continues to emit ash after more than a decade of activity.

title: Ice on Saginaw Bay, Lake Huron
caption: Lakeshore residents of Linwood, Michigan, were invaded by mountains of ice on the evening of March 8, 2009, as winds drove ice ashore from Saginaw Bay in Lake Huron. These images show the break-up of ice on the bay.

title: Dust Storm over the Arabian Peninsula
caption: Dust plumes swept across the Arabian Peninsula in early March 2009, stretching from the Red Sea to the Persian Gulf and beyond.

title: Haze over the Ethiopia-Sudan Border
caption: Haze that was probably a combination of dust and smoke lined the border between Sudan and Ethiopia in early March 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over the Taklimakan Desert
caption: A combination of dust and clouds swirled over the Taklimakan Desert in early March 2009.

title: Fires in Eastern India and Northwest Burma
caption: Agricultural and other land-maintenance fires are common in eastern India and northwest Burma (Myanmar) during the winter dry season. Scores of fires were burning across the region on March 9, 2009.

title: Tropical Cyclone Hamish
caption: Powerful Tropical Cyclone Hamish formed in the Coral Sea off northeast Australia on March 5, 2009, and intensified into a strong Category 4 storm as it moved southeast along the Queensland coast.

title: Dust over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coasts of Libya and Egypt in early March 2009.

title: Minchinmavida and Chaitén Volcanoes, Chile
caption: Chile's Chaiten Volcano continues to erupt, but activity is slowing.

title: Utah Dust Storm
caption: Strong winds created a dust storm in northern Utah on March 4, 2009.

title: Floods in East Java, Indonesia
caption: Days of heavy rain sent the Solo River in East Java over its banks, inundating thousands of homes.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: Dust plumes rippled and swirled over the Arabian Sea in early March 2009.

title: Dust Blowing Over the United Arab Emirates
caption: Heat and dust storms plagued the United Arab Emirates at the end of February 2009.

title: Snow Storm Blankets East Coast
caption: A major snowstorm blanketed the U.S. East Coast with heavy snow in the first days of March 2009.

title: Dust South of the Sahel
caption: A combination of dust and clouds hovered over Africa south of the Sahel at the beginning of March 2009.

title: Redoubt Volcano Stirs
caption: After keeping volcanologists waiting for weeks, Mount Redoubt erupted five times in one night, beginning on March 22, 2009. The volcano followed up with more eruptions in April, and showed continued signs of unrest in early May.

title: Haze in the Sichuan Basin
caption: A combination of clouds and heavy haze hung over the Sichuan Basin in late February 2009.

title: Drought in Southern South America
caption: Since December 2008, Argentina's major agricultural areas have been suffering from severe drought.

title: Dust over the Middle East
caption: Dust blew through Syria, Iraq, and Saudi Arabia in late February 2009.

title: Dust Plumes off Argentina
caption: Continuing an intermittent pattern from the previous month, more dust plumes blew off the coast of Argentina in mid-February 2009.

title: Volcanic Activity on Mt. Erebus
caption: The worldâ€™s southernmost volcano to show activity during recorded history, Erebus holds a lava lake, and it occasionally experiences explosive eruptions.

title: Dust over the Arabian Peninsula
caption: Starting in Iraq and northern Saudi Arabia, dust storms spread southward across the Arabian Peninsula in mid-February 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over Central Africa
caption: Dust plumes spread over central Africa in early February 2009.

title: Volcanic Activity on Mt. Asama, Japan
caption: Asama Volcano on the Japanese island of Honshu showed signs of unrest starting in late January 2009.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Agricultural fires of many kinds are common in Southeast Asia in the late winter, which is the mid-dry season for the region. Widespread fires were detected across eastern Burma (Myanmar), Thailand, and Laos in satellite images from early March 2009.

title: Bushfires in Southeast Australia
caption: Out-of-control bushfires killed at least 200 people in southeastern Australia in early February 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over the Gulf of Oman
caption: Multiple dust plumes blew southward over the Gulf of Oman in early February 2009.

title: Cyclone Gael
caption: Tropical Cyclone Gael loomed over the small island of Mauritius in the southern Indian Ocean in early February 2009, headed west toward Madagascar.

title: Cyclone Ellie
caption: Cyclone Ellie made landfall on February 2, 2009, in Queensland, bringing heavy rains and flooding.

title: Exceptional Australian Heat Wave
caption: An exceptional heat wave punished southern Australia in mid-summer 2009.

title: Snowy England
caption: The first days of February 2009 brought a fierce winter storm to countries throughout Western Europe. England received its heaviest snowfall in 18 years.

title: Dust Plume off Libya
caption: A dust plume blew off the coast of Libya in early February 2009.

title: Ice Storm Hits the United States
caption: On January 27, 2009, a winter storm coated a broad swath of the United States with ice and snow.

title: Ash Plume from Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: The Klyuchevskaya Volcano released a plume of ash and steam in late January 2009.

title: Dust Plume off Argentina
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Argentina in late January 2009.

title: Fires in Central Chile
caption: In mid-January 2009, multiple fires burned in central Chile.

title: Fires in Southeast Australia
caption: A crippling heat wave in southeastern Australia contributed to an outbreak of forest and grassland fires in Victoria, Australia, in late January 2009.

title: Cyclone Dominic
caption: Cyclone Dominic swirled off the northwestern coast of Australia in late January 2009.

title: Dust Plume off Egypt
caption: A dust plume several hundred kilometers long blew off the north coast of Egypt and over the Mediterranean Sea in late January 2009.

title: Cyclone Fanele
caption: Madagascar was plagued by two tropical cyclones in mid-January 2009. Cyclone Eric brushed the northeast coast on January 19, killing at least one person and leaving nearly a thousand homeless, according to news reports.

title: Earthquake in Costa Rica
caption: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake in Costa Rica shook the country on January 8, 2009.  The event triggered landslides which killed at least 20 people.

title: Poor Harvest in Kenya
caption: Ten million people could face hunger in Kenya after a poor harvest.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Haze hovered over eastern China in mid-January 2009.

title: Dust Plumes over the Red Sea
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of Saudi Arabia and over the Red Sea in mid-January 2009.

title: Dust Plumes off Libya
caption: Dust plumes blew off the Libyan coast in early January 2009.

title: Fires in Ghana
caption: Agricultural fires are widespread across Ghana in the dry season. This image shows hundreds of fires in Ghana and neighboring countries on January 11, 2009.

title: Earthquake in Papua, Indonesia
caption: In the early morning hours of January 4, 2009, a pair of powerful earthquakes rattled Papua, Indonesia.

title: Floods in Australia
caption: Drenching wet-season rains led to extensive flooding throughout much of Australia between January and March 2009. The most widespread flooding was in Queensland.

title: Floods in Sumatra, Indonesia
caption: Crops, roads, and homes were all swamped when rivers burst their banks in southern Sumatra in late December 2008.

title: Coal Ash Spill, Tennessee
caption: In the early morning hours of December 22, 2008, the earthen wall of a containment pond at Tennesseeâ€™s Kingston Fossil Plant gave way. The breach released 1.3 million cubic meters (1.7 cubic yards) of sludge, infiltrating a nearby river and damaging dozens of homes.

title: Fires in Central and Western Africa
caption: Fires burned throughout central and western Africa at the end of 2008.

title: Plume from Koryaksky Volcano
caption: Koryaksky (or Koryakski) Volcano on Russiaâ€™s Kamchatka Peninsula released a plume of ash and/or steam in late December 2008.

title: Dust Plumes from the Bodele Depression
caption: Dual dust plumes blew out of the Bodele Depression in late December 2008.

title: Rare Snow in the Pacific Northwest
caption: An unusually heavy snow storm blanketed Oregonâ€™s Willamette Valley and much of the surrounding region, including the Portland metropolitan area, during December 2008. Snowfall that began December 14 continued over a week later, piling up nearly a foot of snow and approaching the all-time records for the region.

title: Cyclone Billy
caption: Tropical Cyclone Billy made landfall in Western Australia in late December 2008. The storm was expected to bring heavy rainfall and local flooding to parts of the Kimberley Coast. On December 28, 2008, the storm was downgraded to an ex-tropical cyclone and was anticipated to pose no further threat to the coastal communities of Western Australia.

title: Saharan Dust Storm
caption: Saharan dust blew through Mauritania in mid-December 2008.

title: Typhoon Dolphin
caption: In mid-December 2008, the Pacific Ocean brewed up a tropical storm that strengthened into Typhoon Dolphin on December 15.

title: Dust Storm off Alaska
caption: Plumes of dust or snow blew off the Alaskan Panhandle in mid-December 2008.

title: New England Ice Storm
caption: A winter storm coated New England states with ice on December 11-12, 2008, cutting off power to more than a million people across New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Maine, Connecticut, and New York.

title: Continuing Effects of Chaiten Volcano
caption: Chile's Chaiten Volcano remained active in early 2009, releasing plumes of ash and/or steam.

title: Low Clouds over Central China
caption: A temperature inversion most likely created this stunning view of low clouds hugging the contours of the Sichuan Basin in central China in early December 2008.

title: Plume from Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: The Klyuchevskaya Volcano on Russiaâ€™s Kamchatka Peninsula released a plume of ash in early December 2008.

title: Haze over India and the Bay of Bengal
caption: Thick haze collected south of the Himalaya in early December 2008, continuing a weeks-long pattern.

title: Dust Plume off Western Africa
caption: A plume of Saharan dust, possibly mixed with smoke, blew off the west coast of Africa on December 4, 2008.

title: Volcanic Activity at Kilauea
caption: Kilauea is Hawaii’s youngest and most active volcano. It has been erupting sporadically since the 2000s.

title: Haze in the Vale of Kashmir
caption: Lying between the Himalaya Range in the northeast and the Pir Panjal Range in the southwest, the Vale of Kashmir is an intermontane valley that houses a substantial portion of Kashmirâ€™s population.

title: First Winter Storm Slams Illinois
caption: The first big winter storm of the 2008 season arrived in Illinois and surrounding states in early December, bringing heavy snow that caused fatal car accidents and delayed air travel in Chicago and regional airports for hours.

title: Haze over the Yellow Sea
caption: A thick plume of haze blew off the coast of China, across the Yellow Sea, and toward the Korean Peninsula in early December 2008.

title: Plume from Soufriere Hills Volcano
caption: The Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat released a plume of ash and/or steam in late November 2008. The volcano remained active in the weeks that followed.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Late in 2008, widespread agricultural fires sprang up across Africa in the semi-arid grasslands known as the Sahel and in the tropical savannas to the south.

title: Floods in Santa Catarina, Brazil
caption: Several days of heavy rain caused widespread flooding in the southeastern Brazilian state of Santa Catarina at the end of November 2008.

title: Cyclone 06B over Sri Lanka and India
caption: In late November 2008, a tropical cyclone slid over Sri Lanka and headed toward southern India.

title: Dust over the Eastern Mediterranean Sea
caption: Dust plumes blew off the north coast of Africa and over the eastern Mediterranean Sea in late November 2008.

title: Locusts in Eastern Australia
caption: The Australian Plague Locust thrives when good rain brings a flush of fresh green grass to inland Australia. In November 2008, the Australian Plague Locust Commission reported that a few small swarms of locusts had started to develop in New South Wales.

title: Plume from Rabaul Volcano
caption: Rabaul Volcano, on the northeastern tip of Papua New Guineaâ€™s island of New Britain released a plume of ash and steam in late November 2008.

title: Floods in Ethiopia
caption: Heavy rains starting on November 2 pushed several rivers in southeastern Ethiopia over their banks.

title: Plankton Bloom Surrounds Chatham Islands
caption: A bloom of plankton encircled the Chatham Islands in mid-November 2008.

title: Fires in California
caption: Gusty winds drove wildfires into southern California cities in mid-November 2008.

title: Dust Plumes over the Arabian Sea
caption: Multiple dust plumes blew off the coasts of Iran and Pakistan, and over the Arabian Sea in mid-November 2008.

title: Drought in Eastern Ethiopia
caption: Poor rains were forecast for eastern Ethiopia at the end of 2008.

title: Hurricane Paloma
caption: A late-season storm, Paloma developed as a tropical depression in the Caribbean off the coast of Honduras and Nicaragua on November 5, 2008, and became a hurricane the following day.

title: Activity on the Erta Ale Range
caption: In early November 2008, a volcano erupted in the Erta Ale Range in northeastern Ethiopia.

title: Fires in Queensland
caption: In late October 2008, scattered fires burned across Queensland from Cape York Peninsula to the area around the city of Rockhampton.

title: Floods in Eastern France
caption: The rivers of eastern France swelled in early November 2008 as heavy rain fell over the region.

title: Flooding in Vietnam
caption: Torrential rains brought the worst floods in decades to northern and central Vietnam in early November 2008.

title: Dust over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Saharan dust blew across the Mediterranean Sea at the beginning of November 2008.

title: Fires in Northwest India
caption: Seasonal agricultural fires dotted the Punjab and Haryana states of northwestern India in early November 2008.

title: Flooding in Central America
caption: Landslides and floods caused extensive damage throughout Central America in the latter half of October 2008, after Tropical Depression 16 dumped heavy rain on the region.

title: Haze Along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the Himalaya in late October 2008. The haze probably resulted from a combination of agricultural fires and urban pollution, and may have contained some airborne dust.

title: Flooding in Yemen
caption: Devastating flooding swept across eastern Yemen in the wake of heavy rains from Tropical Storm Three.

title: 6.4 Magnitude Earthquake Near Quetta, Pakistan
caption:
A magnitude 6.4 earthquake hit the rural, mountainous region of southwestern Pakistan on October 29, 2008. Building collapses and landslides northeast of the city of Quetta killed at least 160 people and left at least 15,000 people homeless, according to reports from BBC news.

title: Tropical Storm Rashmi
caption: Tropical Storm Rashmi came ashore over Bangladesh on October 27, 2008, taking at least 15 lives.

title: Dust Storm off West Africa
caption: Dust plumes blew off the west coast of northern Africa in late September 2008

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Thick haze hovered over eastern China in mid-October 2008.

title: Tropical Depression Three, Gulf of Aden
caption: The third tropical cyclone of the season in the northern Indian Ocean brought rare rains to the desert regions of Yemen and Oman in the third week of October 2008.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Thick haze hovered over eastern China in mid-October 2008.

title: Fires in Madagascar
caption: Dozens of smoky fires were burning in eastern Madagascar on October 19, 2008.

title: Plume from Suwanose-jima
caption: The Suwanose-jima Volcano, part of the Ryukyu Islands in the East China Sea, released a continuous plume of ash and steam in late October 2008.

title: Dust Over Iraq
caption: A plume of dust swept over Syria, Iraq, and Saudi Arabia in mid-October 2008.

title: Hurricane Omar
caption: In mid-October 2008, Hurricane Omar appeared poised to inflict substantial damage on several Caribbean islands, but the storm instead weakened and headed out to the Atlantic.

title: Dust Over the Arabian Sea
caption: A thin plume of dust hovered over the Arabian Sea in mid-October 2008.

title: Dust Over the western Sahara Desert
caption: A massive dust storm swept through the western half of the Sahara Desert in early October 2008.

title: Fires near Los Angeles, California
caption: Driven by powerful Santa Ana winds, wildfires raged near Los Angeles, California, in mid-September 2008.

title: Floods on the Mexican Gulf Coast
caption: Rivers along Mexico's Gulf coast burst their banks after two weeks of heavy rain in late September and early October 2008.

title: Hurricane Norbert
caption: Forming in the Eastern Pacific, Hurricane Norbert became a severe hurricane. By October 11, 2008, it was situated over Baja California. By October 12, 2008, the storm had removed roofs and produced knee-high rain.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the Himalaya in early October 2008, likely the result of industrial pollution.

title: Dust Plume off Iceland
caption: A dust plume blew off the northern coast of Iceland in mid-September 2008.

title: Sub-tropical Storm Laura
caption: Laura formed as a sub-tropical storm in the northern mid-Atlantic on September 29, 2008.

title: Tropical Storm Mekkhala
caption: Tropical Storm Mekkhala was spinning in the Gulf of Tonkin on September 29, 2008.

title: Plume from Rabaul Volcano
caption: Rabaul Volcano released a plume of ash and steam in late September 2008.

title: Dust Storm off Egypt
caption: A thick plume of dust blew off the northern coast of Egypt, west of the Nile Delta, on September 25, 2008.

title: Typhoon Jangmi
caption: Typhoon Jangmi was spinning off the coast of Luzon in the Philippines on September 26, 2008.

title: Floods in Orissa, India
caption: A tropical storm and ongoing monsoon rains pushed the rivers in the east Indian state of Orissa to dangerous levels in September 2008.

title: Floods on the Rio Grande
caption: Rains in northern Mexico pushed the Rio Grande to near-record levels in mid-September 2008.

title: Typhoon Hagupit
caption: Powerful Typhoon Hagupit slammed into South China on September 24, 2008.

title: Flooding along the Gulf Coast
caption: Hurricane Ike pushed water far inland over a wide swath of the Gulf Coast when the storm came ashore on September 13, 2008.

title: Dust Storm in Iraq
caption: A massive cloud of dust hovered over Iraq in mid-September 2008.

title: Fires in Oregon and Northern California
caption: A handful of large fires were burning in Oregon and Northern California as fall approached in September 2008.

title: Dust Plumes over the Persian Gulf
caption: Dust plumes blew over the Persian Gulf in early September 2008.

title: Dust Plumes over the Middle East
caption: Dust plumes blew over Iraq and neighboring countries in early September 2008.

title: Typhoon Sinlaku
caption: Typhoon Sinlaku draped the island of Luzon in the Philippines with some of its rain clouds on September 10, 2008.

title: Hurricane Ike
caption: Between the last week of August and the first week of September 2008, the Atlantic Ocean queued up a series of tropical storms. Ike became a large storm that raked over Cuba and targeted the Texas coast.

title: Fires in Mozambique, Zimbabwe, and South Africa
caption: In late August and early September 2008, widespread fires in Mozambique, Zimbabwe, and South Africa poured smoke out of the Indian Ocean.

title: Tropical Storm Lowell
caption: Event caption to come

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: A mixture of haze and clouds hovered over eastern China in early September 2008.

title: The Brahmaputra River floods Northeast India
caption: Monsoon rains pushed the Brahmaputra River to dangerous levels in early September 2008.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan
caption: On September 5, 2008, a dust storm formed over Afghanistan, Iran, and Pakistan. The storm expanded in the next few days.

title: Tropical Storm Josephine
caption: Tropical Storm Josephine formed in the eastern Atlantic near the Cape Verde Islands on September 2, 2008.

title: Carbon Monoxide over Africa
caption: Carbon monoxide concentrations across Africa between August 25 and September 1, 2008, were elevated from widespread agricultural burning and wildfires.

title: Storm-Churned waters off Cuba
caption: Gustav may have spared the United States from the destruction that many feared, but it hit Cuba hard.

title: Tropical Storm Hanna
caption: On August 28, 2008, the eighth named storm of the 2008 Atlantic hurricane season got underway in the Caribbean Sea. Hanna made landfall on the East Coast as a tropical storm on September 6.

title: Fire in the Kalahari
caption: A large fire was burning near the western border of the Central Kalahari Game Reserve in Botswana in late August 2008.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: Hundreds of agricultural or land-clearing fires were burning in central South America on August 26, 2008.

title: Dust near Cyprus
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Turkey toward the island of Cyprus in late August 2008.

title: Hurricane Gustav
caption: Gustav formed off the coast of Hispaniola in the Caribbean Sea on August 25, 2008.

title: Tropical Storm Fay Floods Florida
caption: Tropical Storm Fay dumped heavy rain over Florida between August 19 and August 24, 2008, triggering floods throughout the state.

title: Monsoon Floods in Northeast India
caption: Monsoon rains regularly swell rivers in northern India, but in 2008, the Kosi, a tributary of the Ganges and a major river in its own right, did something different. It burst through its banks to flow into a channel it had abandoned more than 200 years ago.

title: Smoke over Libya
caption: Black smoke billowed over the Libyan landscape on August 20, 2008, likely caused by a fire at an oil refinery.

title: Fires in Idaho
caption: A handful of wildfires sprang up in Idaho in the third week of August 2008, affecting hundreds of acres in forests and wilderness areas west of the Bitterroot Range Mountains.

title: Typhoon Nuri
caption: Typhoon Nuri first formed in the Western Pacific Ocean, east of the Philippines. As it traveled westward, the storm system reached typhoon status on August 18, 2008.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Barents Sea
caption: The waters of the Barents Sea off the northeast coast of Norway were bright with a bloom of phytoplankton on August 12, 2008.

title: Tropical Storm Fay
caption: Tropical Storm Fay became the sixth named storm system of the 2008 Atlantic hurricane season after forming over the Dominican Republic on August 15. Without reaching hurricane strength, the storm still caused flooding throughout parts of Florida.

title: Bushfires in Northern Territory, Australia
caption: Numerous large bushfires were burning in the tropical savannas of Arnhem Land, in Northern Territory, Australia, in mid-August 2008.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: A dust storm blew over the Persian Gulf in mid-August 2008. The dust likely arose from the Tigris and Euphrates floodplain in Iraq.

title: Dust Storms in Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: On August 10, 2008, dual dust storms filled the skies over northern Afghanistan, Uzbekistan, and Tajikistan, as well as southern Afghanistan and Pakistan.

title: Aleutian Islands’ Kasatochi Volcano Erupts
caption: After earthquakes and other seismic activity starting on August 7, 2008, Kasatochi Volcano began erupting large plumes of ash and gases in subsequent days. Over the following week, the plume of sulfur dioxide spread across Canada and the Northeast United States.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Pakistan
caption: Unusually intense monsoon rains pounded Pakistan in late July and early August 2008, causing deadly floods.

title: Tropical Storm Kammuri
caption: Tropical Storm Kammuri formed in the South China Sea in the first week of August 2008 and drenched Guangdong Province, including the city of Hong Kong, on August 6.

title: Locusts in West Africa
caption: Though the locust situation was calm in West Africa at the beginning of August 2008, conditions were ripe for a major outbreak.

title: Tropical Storm Edouard
caption: By the afternoon of August 4, 2008, Tropical Storm Edouard was headed for the U.S. Gulf Coast.

title: Forest Fire in Southern Turkey
caption: A forest fire raged in southern Turkey in early August 2008.

title: Dust over Iraq and Saudi Arabia
caption: Dust plumes hovered over Iraq and Saudi Arabia at the beginning of August 2008.

title: Floods in Eastern Europe
caption: Heavy rain falling in the Carpathian Mountains pushed rivers in Ukraine, Romania, and Moldova over their banks on July 27-28, 2008.

caption: The first land-falling hurricane of the 2008 Atlantic season, Hurricane Dolly flooded parts of Texas and Mexico when it came ashore on July 23.

title: Forest Fire Scorches Island of Rodos
caption: Over the last weekend of July 2008, a large forest fire on the Greek island Rodos (Rhodes) forced hundreds of tourists to evacuate.
