caption: A storm that hit New Zealand in late July 2008 was the most intense sub-tropical cyclone to strike the North Island in a decade, according to local news sources.

caption: Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat released a plume of ash and steam in late July 2008. On July 28, the volcano's dome partially collapsed, sending an ash column 12 kilometers skyward.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: A thick band of haze appeared over eastern China in late July 2008.

title: Typhoon Fung-wong
caption: Typhoon Fung-Wong was lashing Taiwan and coastal China with high winds, rain, and storm surge on the morning of July 28, 2008.

title: Plume from Rabaul Volcano
caption: New Britain's Rabaul Volcano released a plume in late July 2008.

title: Tropical Storm Cristobal
caption: Tropical Storm Cristobal was the third named storm in the 2008 Atlantic storm season.

title: Hurricane Fausto
caption: Hurricane Fausto formed in the Eastern Pacific ocean off Central America on July 16, 2008.  Travelling westward over warmer waters, the storm gathered strength, reaching hurricane status by July 18.

title: Hurricane Dolly
caption: Tropical Storm Dolly formed in the Caribbean Sea between Honduras and Cuba on July 20, 2008. By July 23, it was a Category 1 hurricane in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Beijing Implements New Pollution Controls
caption: As Beijing prepared to host the Olympics August 8-24, 2008, and the Paralympics September 6-17, 2008, authorities implemented new procedures to reduce pollution.

caption: Hurricane Elida formed in the Eastern Pacific Ocean off the Central American coast on July 12, 2008.  As is the case with most storm systems that form in this region, it traveled westward, pulling away from the coast.

title: Fires in Argentina, Paraguay
caption: Hundreds of fires, probably related to land clearing or agriculture, burned in Argentina and Paraguay in mid-July 2008.

caption: Though they may look like airplane contrails, the streaky clouds shown in this image are ship tracks, bright clouds that form in a ship's wake.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi
caption: Typhoon Kalmaegi was grazing the Pacific-facing coast of Taiwan in the morning hours of July 17, 2008. Heavy rain fell in the storm's path.

caption: Weeks ahead of the 2008 Summer Olympics, Chinese authorities battled an algal bloom that threatened sailing competitions.

title: Hurricane Bertha
caption: Bertha was the first hurricane of the 2008 Atlantic storm season.

caption: A deadly forest fire in southern Turkey spread thick smoke across the Mediterranean Sea to Cyprus in early July 2008.

title: Activity on Rabaul Volcano, New Britain

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: A dust storm blew off the coast of Sudan and over the Red Sea in early July 2008.

caption: Mount Etna released plumes of ash and steam in late June and early July 2008.

title: Fires in Central Canada

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf

caption: On the calendar, Scandinavian summer starts on June 21 in 2008, but summer temperatures had already settled over much of northern Europe by early June.

caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of South Australia in mid-June 2008.

caption: Heavy rains flooded several rivers in the U.S. Midwest in early June 2008.

caption: A dust plume hovered over the Middle East in early June 2008.

The ring-shaped, rainbow-like phenomenon, known as a "glory," appears through the length of the center of this image.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq

caption: Dust storms covered much of the Taklimakan Desert in western China in early May 2008.

title: Dust Storm over the Aral Sea
caption: A large dust storm blew westward from the Aral Sea in late April 2008.

caption: With the harvest in the spring of 2008, India was set to produce a record rice and corn crop.

caption: Dust plumes blew westward across the Sahara Desert in late April 2008.

caption: Dust and clouds formed a giant swirl over eastern China in late April 2008.

caption: Fires are common in southern Mexico and northern Central America during the February-May dry season. In mid-May 2008, scores of fires were burning across the Yucatan, Guatemala, and Honduras.

caption: Four days of intense rain brought floods to parts of eastern China's Anhui province from April 19 through April 22, 2008.

caption: Dust plumes covered much of the Taklimakan Desert in late April 2008.

caption: Russian wildfires sent smoke over the Kamchatka Peninsula and Pacific Ocean in late April 2008.

caption: A massive dust plume blew out of Saudi Arabia and over the Persian Gulf in mid-April 2008.

title: Fires Spread Smoke over Buenos Aires
caption: Unusually intense agricultural fires blanketed nearby Buenos Aires, Argentina, with smoke in April 2008.

caption: The first typhoon of 2008 in the western Pacific Ocean, Typhoon Neoguri moved towards southern China during the third week of April.

caption: A hazy plume drifted over the northern end of the Caspian Sea in early April 2008.

caption: A thick plume of dust blew off the Egyptian coast and over the Mediterranean Sea in early April 2008.

caption: In early April 2008, smoke from hundreds of fires mingled with clouds over eastern India, Myanmar (Burma), and China.

caption: Extensive floods swept over the normally dry northeastern corner of Brazil in the wake of heavy rains in March and April 2008.

title: Fires in Southern Russia
caption: Dozens of fires were burning in southern Russia near the border with Mongolia and China in April 2008.

title: Fires in the Southern Plains
caption: In early April 2008, agricultural fires dotted the Southern Plains of the United States.

title: Drought in Ethiopia
caption: Drought crept over Ethiopia after the failure of rains in October and November 2007.

caption: Ferocious thunderstorms roiled across the Midwest on March 31, dropping hail and flood-inducing rain and battering the region with strong winds and tornadoes.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan
caption: Dust stirred in the Taklimakan Desert in early April 2008.

title: Spring in Kazakhstan
caption: Melting ice and an upsurge of agricultural fires revealed that spring was settling over southern Kazakhstan by March 30, 2008.

title: Dust Storm over the Aral Sea
caption: Dust plumes rose from desiccated lakebeds around the South Aral Sea on April 1, 2008.

caption: A belt of fresh snow stretched from Nebraska to Minnesota after a spring storm swept across the Upper Midwestern United States on March 31, 2008.

caption: Scattered fires punctuated the coastline of southeastern Australia in early April 2008.

title: Volcanic Ash Stain from Karymsky

title: Dust Storm off the African West Coast
caption: In late March 2008, Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa over the Atlantic Ocean. Dust plume activity continued in April.

caption: In March 2008, Saharan dust blew from Egypt all the way to the Black Sea.

title: Floods on the Yellow River

caption: On March 19, 2008, a small explosion erupted from Kilauea's summit crater. The volcano remained active in April 2008.

title: Floods in the U.S. Midwest
caption: Widespread flooding swept across the midwestern United States in the wake of a powerful early spring storm.

title: Dust Storm in Central Mexico
caption: A dust storm struck central Mexico on March 18, 2008, and winds transported the dust into southern Texas.

title: Floods in Namibia
caption: An intense rainy season triggered floods across southern Africa in early 2008. In northern Namibia, the floods started in early February and persisted through March.

title: Dust over the Persian Gulf and Saudi Arabia
caption: Dust plumes blew over the Persian Gulf and Saudi Arabia in mid-March 2008.

title: Dust Plumes over Syria and Iraq
caption: A dust storm struck the Middle East in mid-March 2008, blowing primarily through Syria and Iraq.

title: Activity on Rabaul Volcano, New Britian
caption: Rabaul Volcano released a plume on in early March 2008. It continued a pattern of intermittent activity for several days.

caption: A thick swath of smog and/or dust swept over the Sea of Japan on March 11, 2008.

caption: Persistent heavy rains in parts of South America caused deadly flooding in early 2008.

title: Activity on Anatahan
caption: Continuing its pattern of intermittent activity, Anatahan Volcano released plumes of ash and steam in early March 2008.

caption: A dust storm passed over the Beijing region and the Yellow Sea in early March 2008.

title: Dust Storms over the Middle East
caption: Dust storms struck the Middle East in late February 2008.

caption: Tropical Cyclone Jokwe had just skimmed past northern Madagascar and was moving south into the Mozambique Channel on March 7, 2008.

caption: In late February 2008, Kenya's Lake Nakuru National Park suffered a major blow when an accidental fire scorched a large section of the relatively small park.

caption: Cyclone Hondo grew to a Category 4 storm as it traveled across the southern Indian Ocean in February 2008.

caption: Anatahan Volcano in the central Mariana Islands began releasing plumes of ash and steam in early February 2008, continuing a pattern of intermittent activity from the previous December.

title: Severe Tornadoes in the Southern United States
caption:
A major wintertime tornado outbreak ripped through
Arkansas, western Tennessee, northern Mississippi, northern Alabama, and western Kentucky on February 5, 2008.

title: Rabaul Volcano, New Britain
caption: Rabaul Volcano released a plume on February 3, 2008.

title: Floods in Bolivia
caption: Floods swept across Bolivia in the wake of unusually heavy rains in December 2007 through March 2008.

title: Dust over Gulf of Oman, Arabian Sea
caption: Thick dust plumes blew over both the Gulf of Oman and the Arabian Sea in early February 2008.

title: Dust Storm in Texas
caption: A dust storm blew through Texas, not far from Lubbock, in late January 2008.

caption: Cyclone Gula formed east of Madagascar on January 27, 2008 and headed south, encountering and interacting with east-bound Cyclone Fame.

caption: A winter storm dusted snow over Greece, including the city of Athens, on January 29, 2008.

caption: Tropical Cyclone Gene crashed through the Fiji Islands and Vanuatu in the South Pacific Ocean between January 27 and January 30, 2008.

title: Ship Tracks off British Columbia

caption: Unusually heavy snow paralyzed central and eastern China in mid-January 2008.

title: Extreme Cold and Snow in Central Asia
caption: Unusually bitter cold and heavy snow plagued parts of Central Asia in January 2008.

title: Floods in Australia
caption: Unusually heavy summer rains left much of northeastern Australia flooded in January 2008.

title: Dust Storm off Western Sahara
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of northern Africa in mid-January 2008. Dust lingered over the Atlantic Ocean late in the month.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: The agricultural fire season was underway in Cambodia on January 20, 2008.

title: Dust Plumes over the Red Sea
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coast of Saudi Arabia and over the Red Sea in mid-January 2008.

title: Snow in Southwest Asia
caption: Winter settled heavily over Southwest Asia in January 2008, bringing intense cold and unusual snow.

title: Phytoplankton surround the Falkland Islands
caption: Millions of tiny ocean plants ringed the Falkland Islands in early January 2008.

title: Floods in the U.S. Midwest
caption: Unusual winter thunderstorms combined with warm temperatures led to flooding throughout Indiana, Illinois, Michigan, and Ohio in mid-January 2008.

title: Snow in Iraq
caption: Iraqis in Baghdad woke to the novelty of white flakes drifting to the ground as the city experienced its first snowfall in about 100 years on January 11, 2008.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm
caption: Intermittent dust storms continued in Chad's Bodele Depression in mid-January 2008.

title: Flooding Starts to Break Queensland Drought
caption: The east coast of Australia saw record rainfall during the first week of 2008. The rain caused floods that left many residents stranded.  Much of southeastern Australia has been in the grip of a multi-year drought, but a pattern of rainy weather has started to break it.

title: Cyclone Helen hits Northern Australia
caption: Tropical Cyclone Helen combined with the seasonal monsoon and the other weather patterns in the Pacific Ocean to produce heavy rains in Northern Australia.

title: Agricultural Fires in West Africa
caption: In the grasslands and savannas of West Africa, widespread agricultural burning was underway in the early months of 2008.

title: Snow Storm in the Sierras
caption: A winter storm walloped the Sierra Nevada Mountains of California along with much of Nevada in the first week of 2008.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: Dust plumes blew over the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman in early January 2008.

title: Severe Snow in Iran
caption: An unusual snow storm in Iran brought deep snow to Tehran, and snow in the southern deserts for the first time in living memory.

title: Dust off Africa, over Cape Verde
caption: Dust plumes blew off the west coast of Africa while a large haze of dust hung over Cape Verde in early January 2008.

title: Fires in Fitzgerald River National Park, Australia
caption: In southern Western Australia's Fitzgerald River National Park, lightning triggered half a dozen fires on January 9, 2008.

title: Llaima Volcano Eruption
caption: On January 1, 2008, Llaima Volcano in Chile erupted, releasing volcanic ash and sulfur dioxide.

title: Intense Seasonal Floods in Southern Africa
caption: By February or March during the typical southern African rainy season, the intense rain puddles on the saturated ground and pushes brimming rivers, reservoirs, and lakes over their banks. In 2008, the floods began in January and continued into February.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: A dust storm blew through southern Iraq, near the Saudi Arabian border, in early January 2008.

title: Fires in Southern China
caption: Dozens of agricultural fires were burning in southern China on January 6, 2008, contributing to thick haze over the area.

title: Haze over India, Bangladesh, and the Bay of Bengal
caption: Haze hung over India, Bangladesh, and the Bay of Bengal in early January 2008.

title: Flooding and Landslides in Indonesia
caption: Persistent heavy rains have lead to flooding and landslides throughout Indonesia, resulting in numerous fatalities and crop losses.

title: New Year’s Snowstorm in United States
caption: A series of holiday snowstorms blanketed the central and northeastern United States with heavy snow in late December 2007 and early January 2008.

title: Tropical Cyclone Melanie
caption: Tropical Cyclone Melanie had an impressive appearance on December 30, 2007, as the storm swirled off the coast of Western Australia.

title: Plume from Anatahan
caption: On December 30, 2007, Anatahan Volcano began releasing a plume.

title: Dust over the Gulf of California
caption: Dust blew southward over the Gulf of California on December 25, 2007.

title: Phytoplankton off the Coast of Argentina
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom appeared along the coast of South America in late December 2007.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm
caption: Dust-storm activity picked up in the Bodele Depression in mid-December 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Turkey, Syria, and Iraq
caption: A dust storm formed over the borders of Turkey, Syria, and Iraq on December 20, 2007.

title: Mid-December Snowstorm in United States
caption: A major snow storm slid across the United States over the weekend of December 15, 2007, laying down ice and snow across the country from the Rockies to the Great Lakes.

title: Haze over Southern California
caption: Haze lingered in California's San Joaquin Valley in mid-December 2007.

title: Haze in Eastern China
caption: Thick haze collected in eastern China, south of Beijing, in December 2007, nearly preventing the city of Beijing from reaching its 2007 goal of low-pollution days. Haze remained in the area in the new year.

title: Simpson Desert Dust Storm
caption: Another dust storm storm struck Australia's Simpson Desert in mid-December 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Olga
caption: Tropical Storm Olga, the 15th named storm of the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season, developed over the Caribbean in December. It unleashed heavy rain on Hispaniola.

title: Fires in West Africa
caption: Hundreds of agricultural fires were scattered across West Africa in mid-December 2007.

title: Oil Spill off South Korea
caption: Tons of crude oil spilled from a tanker into the Yellow Sea off the west coast of South Korea after the ship collided with another vessel on December 7, 2007.

title: Floods in the Pacific Northwest
caption: An intense December storm caused floods and landslides in Washington and Oregon.

title: Kona Low over Hawaii
caption: A persistent low pressure system, known as a Kona Low, brought several days of high winds, heavy rains and even blizzard conditions to parts of the Hawaiian Islands during the first week of December 2007.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the southern slopes of the Himalaya in early to mid-December 2007.

title: Kangaroo Island Bushfires
caption: Fires burned in and near several parks and conservation areas on South Australia's Kangaroo Island for nearly a week in mid-December 2007.

title: First Snow in US Northeast
caption: A string of storms brought the season's first snow to the eastern United States from the mid-Atlantic states to New England during the first week of December 2007.

title: Tropical Cyclone Daman
caption: Cyclone Daman tracked across the South Pacific Ocean in early December 2007, threatening Fiji with powerful winds.

title: Late Spring Floods in Australia
caption: A late spring storm left the interior desert of Australia awash with water in early December 2007.

title: Storm in the Pacific Northwest
caption: A series of powerful storms drenched the Pacific Northwest between November 28 and December 4, 2007.

title: Locusts in East Africa
caption: For the first time since 1961, locusts invaded Kenya in late 2007, taking advantage of an unusually ample food supply.

title: Dust Storm in Southwestern Iran
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Iran and over the Gulf of Oman on December 1, 2007.

title: Iraq Dust Storm
caption: Dust plumes hovered over Iraq in early December 2007.

title: Flooding in the Philippines
caption: Floods swept across the northern Philippine island of Luzon in the wake of Typhoon Mitag in late November 2007.

title: Typhoons Mitag and Hagibis
caption: Typhoons Mitag and Hagibis flanked the Philippines, each striking different parts of the island nation within a week.

title: Floods in Turkey, Greece, Bulgaria
caption: Heavy rains brought wide-spread flooding to Turkey, Greece, and Bulgaria in the final weeks of November 2007.

title: Simpson Desert Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm struck Australia's Simpson Desert on November 21, 2007.

title: Corral Fire Near Malibu, California
caption: On November 24, 2007, a fire started in Corral Canyon northwest of Malibu and was rapidly fanned into a large blaze by Santa Ana winds.

title: Plume from Jebel at Tair
caption: Jebel at Tair, a small volcanic island in the Red Sea, released a volcanic plume on November 8, 2007.

title: Haze over Southern California
caption: Dense haze collected in southern California in mid-November 2007.

title: Cyclone Sidr Floods Bangladesh
caption: Devastating flooding followed the passage of Cyclone Sidr over Bangladesh in mid-November 2007.

title: Earthquake in Chile
caption: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake struck northern Chile near mid-day on November 14, 2007.

title: Dust Plumes off Western Africa
caption: Plumes of Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa on November 9, 2007.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Namibia
caption: Brilliant shades of blue and green colored the water off Namibia where ocean plants bloomed in late October and early November 2007.

title: Dust Storm in Southwest Asia
caption: On November 14, 2007, a dust storm swept over the borders of Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, and Afghanistan. By the following day, the dust storm had spread westward into Turkmenistan.

title: Locusts in Sudan
caption: Plenty of water and unusually thick vegetation allowed potentially dangerous locust swarms to develop in Sudan in October and November 2007.

title: Plume from Soufriere Hills
caption: The Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat released a faint plume on November 9, 2007. It relased another plume one week later.

title: Severe Storm over the Sea of Azov
caption: A fierce storm struck both the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov on November 11, 2007. According to news reports, as many as 10 ships either sank or ran aground, one of them an oil tanker.

title: Dust over Cape Verde
caption: Saharan dust lingered over Cape Verde in early November 2007, after a few days of dust storm activity off the west coast of Africa.

title: Tropical Cyclone Sidr
caption: Tropical Cyclone Sidr spun north over the Bay of Bengal in mid-November 2007. It was forecast to become a Category 4 storm.

title: Tidal Surge on the North Sea
caption: Strong winds over the North Sea combined with high tide to push a bulge of water into eastern England and the Netherlands on November 9, 2007. It was the strongest such surge since 1953.

title: Haze along the Himalayan Front Range
caption: Thick haze pushed up against the Himalayan Front Range in early November 2007.

title: Fires and Haze in West Africa
caption: Widespread agricultural burning in Senegal and Mali combined with blowing dust to create hazy skies over West Africa in early November 2007.

title: Typhoon Peipah
caption: On November 3, Typhoon Peipah became the twenty-third storm of the 2007 typhoon season in the western Pacific.

title: Tropical Storm Noel Floods the Dominican Republic
caption: Tropical Storm Noel left floods and landslides in its wake after crossing Hispaniola, the island shared by the Dominican Republic and Haiti, on October 28, 2007.

title: Dust over the Red Sea
caption: A dust plume blew off the coast of Saudi Arabia and over the Red Sea on November 3, 2007.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Haze spread through eastern China in early November 2007, continuing the pattern from October.

title: Floods in Southeastern Mexico
caption: Days of heavy rains inundated southeastern Mexico in late October and early November 2007, causing floods that left much of the state of Tabasco under water.

title: Tropical Storm Noel
caption: The sixteenth tropical system of the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season, Tropical Depression 16 became Tropical Storm Noel just south of the island of Hispaniola on October 28. The storm unleashed heavy rain on Haiti, the Dominican Republic, Cuba, and the Bahamas.

title: Dust off Iran and Pakistan
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coasts of Iran and Pakistan on October 29-30, 2007.

title: Dust Plumes off Libya
caption: Two-toned dust plumes blew northward off the coast of Libya on October 26, 2007.

title: Seasonal Floods in Thailand
caption: The rivers of northern Thailand were swollen from monsoon rain in late October 2007.

title: Rain Floods New Orleans
caption: Flood-weary New Orleans found its streets filling with water once more on October 22, 2007, as heavy rain fell over the city. Apart from flooding the city, storm brought much-needed rain to drought-stricken states in the southeastern United States.

title: Dust Storm in Egypt
caption: A dust storm blew off the coast of Egypt and over the Mediterranean Sea on October 20, 2007.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: A nearly opaque plume of haze snaked through eastern China on October 20, 2007. By the following day, the haze had spread throughout much of eastern China, near Bo Hai and the Yellow Sea.

title: Fires in Southern California
caption: Driven by Santa Ana winds, several large wildfires flared across Southern California over the weekend of October 20, 2007. Before winds died down late in the week, the fires burned hundreds of thousands of acres and forced at least half a million people from their homes. Smoke caused unhealthy air quality in many areas.

title: Heavy Rain Floods Central America
caption: During the first week and a half of October 2007, frequent heavy rains spawned by a persistent trough of low pressure stretched across the northwestern Caribbean, leading to floods and mudslides in several countries.

title: Haze over India
caption: Haze collected over northern India, near the border with Nepal, on October 15, 2007.

title: Record Sea Ice Minimum
caption: Each year in mid-September, the annual sea ice pack in the Arctic Ocean reaches a minimum before temperatures turn cold and new ice begins to form. In 2007, Arctic sea ice reached a new record low.

title: Dust over the Persian Gulf
caption: Dust blew off the coast of the United Arab Emirates on October 10, 2007.

title: Haze off the U.S. East Coast
caption: Thick haze extended off the U.S. East Coast on October 8, 2007.

title: Typhoon Lekima floods Vietnam
caption: Typhoon Lekima unleashed heavy rains on central and northern Vietnam when the storm came ashore on October 3, 2007, causing floods and landslides.

title: Plume from Karymsky
caption: Continuing a pattern of intermittent activity, Karymsky Volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula released a plume on October 6, 2007.

title: Drought in Moldova
caption: Persistent hot, dry weather across southeastern Europe during the summer of 2007 left Moldova in its worst drought in living memory.

title: Dust Plume off Mauritania
caption: A thick plume of dust blew off the coast of Mauritania in western Africa on October 2, 2007.

title: Activity on Rabaul
caption: Rabaul Volcano on the island of New Britain released a plume on October 2, 2007.

title: Typhoon Krosa
caption: Typhoon Krosa initially formed over the western Pacific Ocean on October 1. The Joint Typhoon Warning Center predicted that the storm would grow into a powerful typhoon as it moved towards the China coast.

title: Jebel at Tair Eruption
caption: Jebel at Tair, a small volcanic island in the Red Sea, erupted late in the day on September 30, 2007. The volcano showed signs of continued activity more than a week later.

title: Floods in East India
caption: Late-season monsoon rain combined with a tropical depression to flood the rivers of East India in late September 2007.

title: Fires in the Amazon
caption: In late September and early October 2007, fires were burning  in the Brazilian Amazon in the states of Mato Grosso, Amazonas, and Para.

title: Bushfires in Northern Australia
caption: Severe fire weather was hampering firefighters' efforts to keep bush fires under control in Northern Territory in early October 2007.

title: Hurricane Lorenzo
caption: Hours before coming ashore over Central Mexico, Lorenzo intensified into a weak hurricane. The storm was the fourth hurricane and the thirteenth storm to form during the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Dust over the Caspian Sea
caption: Dust plumes, likely originating on the Cheleken Peninsula, blew westward across the Caspian Sea on September 26, 2007.

title: Floods in Southern Brazil
caption: Heavy rainfall in late September 2007 caused severe flooding in Brazil's southernmost state, Rio Grande do Sul.

title: Floods in Myanmar
caption: Stretching from northern Myanmar to the Andaman Sea, the Ayeyarwady River pushed over its banks along much of its extent in response to unusually heavy monsoon rains in summer and early fall 2007.

title: Fire on Alaska’s North Slope
caption: Autumn burnished the vegetation of Alaska's North Slope in September 2007, as a fire that started near the Colville River in mid-July continued to burn.

title: Fall Colors around Lake Superior
caption: The forests along the eastern shores of Lake Superior put on a brilliant display of color for the first day of autumn.

title: Seasonal Rain Floods the Sahel
caption: Africa's fertile Sahel grassland flooded in August and September 2007 in response to unusually heavy seasonal rains.

title: Fires on Sumatra
caption: Scores of fires burned across the Indonesian island of Sumatra in late September 2007.

title: Dust over the Gulf of Oman and Arabian Sea
caption: Dust plumes blew from Afghanistan southward through Pakistan and over the Arabian Sea on September 23, 2007. The same day, smaller plumes of dust blew off the coast of Iran over the Gulf of Oman.

title: Fires in Southeast Africa
caption: As the dry season matured in southeastern Africa in late September 2007, agricultural burning became widespread across Tanzania and Mozambique.

title: Plume from Chikurachki Volcano
caption: Chikurachki Volcano, in the northern Kurile Islands, released another plume of ash and/or steam on September 19, 2007, continuing a pattern of intermittent activity.

title: Floods in Chad
caption: The annual rainy season brought unusually intense rains and floods to Chad in August and September 2007.

title: Plume from Ol Doinyo Lengai
caption: In early September 2007, Tanzania's Ol Doinyo Lengai Volcano erupted, sending a cloud of ash into the atmosphere.

title: Floods in Uganda
caption: Like many other countries in western, central, and eastern Africa, Uganda faced severe flooding as a result of unusually heavy rains from July through September 2007.

title: Super Typhoon Wipha
caption: Super Typhoon Wipha was a powerful Category 4 typhoon when it approached the densely populated East China coast on September 18, 2007.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan
caption: Dust plumes lined the northern edge of the Taklimakan Desert on September 17, 2007.

title: Drought in Australia
caption: August 2007 brought little rain to relieve a multi-year drought in southern Australia.

title: Bushfires in Northern Territory, Australia
caption: In Australia's Northern Territory, dozens of large bushfires were churning out clouds of smoke in mid-September and October 2007.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm blew out of the Bodele Depression on September 17, 2007.

title: Floods in West Africa
caption: Floods swelled rivers and saturated cropland through much of West Africa under the steady onslaught of wet-season rains in August and September 2007.

title: Dust Storm off the African West Coast
caption: Dust blew off the coast of Mauritania on September 16, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Bahrain and Qatar
caption: Saudi Arabian dust blew over Bahrain, Qatar, and the Persian Gulf on September 12, 2007.

title: Butler 2 Fire, Southern California
caption: Nearly two thousand residents in the San Bernardino Mountains had to evacuate their homes over the weekend of September 15, 2007, when a fast-spreading wildfire raced through the San Bernardino National Forest.

title: Typhoon Nari
caption: Typhoon Nari formed as a tropical storm near Okinawa Island on September 12, developing to  typhoon strength the next day.

title: Flooding from Typhoon Fitow
caption: Typhoon Fitow's heavy rains flooded rivers around Tokyo when the storm came ashore on September 6, 2007.

title: Drought in the Pacific Northwest
caption: As summer headed toward fall in 2007, much of the United States was experiencing drought. Vegetation conditions in the Northwest were mostly average or below average in late August 2007.

title: Hurricane Humberto
caption: Hurricane Humberto came ashore in Texas as a Category One hurricane early on September 13, 2007.

title: Flooding in India and Bangladesh
caption: After the seasonal summer floods had already subsided, both the Ganges and the Brahmaputra rose to dangerous levels in the wake of fresh rainfall in early September 2007.

title: Plumes from Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya
caption: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes on Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula released simultaneous plumes on September 11, 2006.

title: Floods in Central America
caption: The passage of two major hurricanes pushed rivers in Central and South Mexico, Guatemala, and Nicaragua well over their banks in early September 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Gabrielle
caption: Tropical Storm Gabrielle briefly crossed land, touching ashore at North Carolina's Outer Banks on September 9, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: Dust plumes blew over Iraq on September 8, 2007. The dust appeared thickest in the northern part of the country, near the Syrian border.

title: Activity on Chikurachki
caption: Chikurachki Volcano, in the northern Kuriles off the Kamchatka Peninsula, released a plume on September 8, 2007.

title: Haze over Utah
caption: Haze clouded the skies over Utah on September 8, 2007. The haze might have resulted from smoke released by fires in California.

title: Heatwave in Southern California
caption: September 5, 2007, marked the end of a week-long heat wave that led to 31 deaths and triggered power outages across southern California.

title: Moonlight Fire, California
caption: A wildfire in Northern California that started on September 3, 2007, had grown to more than 63,000 acres by September 11. Thick smoke spread southwest over the Sacramento Valley.

title: Bushfires in Western Australia
caption: In early September 2007, large bush fires in Western Australia were churning out smoke that shrouded coastal areas from Eighty Mile Beach to Collier Bay.

title: Fires and Thick Smoke over South America
caption: Scores of fires filled the South American skies with smoke in September 2007.

title: Plume from Shiveluch Volcano
caption: On August 3, 2007, the Shiveluch (Sheveluch) Volcano on the Russian Federation’s Kamchatka Peninsula released a plume of ash and steam.

title: Hurricane Henriette
caption: Hurricane Henriette formed off the Pacific Coast of Mexico and threatened coastal resorts on the Baja California peninsula.

title: Hurricane Felix
caption: Hurricane Felix came ashore in Nicaragua on September 4, 2007, as a Category 5 storm, the strongest rating on the Saffir-Simpson scale.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Every year during the dry season, widespread agricultural fires occur in Africa. This image shows fires and smoke in late August 2007.

title: Typhoon Fitow
caption: Typhoon Fitow formed in the western Pacific and gradually built power, reaching typhoon status on August 29, 2007.

title: Northwest Passage Open
caption: During the summer of 2007, sea ice melt opened the fabled and long-sought Northwest Passage.

title: Fires in Algeria
caption: Scores of forest fires were burning in northern Algeria in late August 2007.

title: Activity at Manda Hararo
caption: In August 2007, satellite, aerial, and ground-based observations showed the volcanic complex of Manda Hararo in western Afar, Ethiopia,  coming to life.

title: Smoke from Fires in Greece
caption: Smoke from deadly fires in Greece blows across the Mediterranean Sea and pools over the Gulf of Sirte.

title: Haze over the Mid-Atlantic States
caption: Haze obscured the skies of the central U.S. East Coast region in late August 2007.

title: Fires in Greece
caption: Deadly wildfires in southern Greece wafted thick clouds of smoke over the Ionian Sea and southward to the Mediterranean in late August 2007.

title: Floods in the Midwestern United States
caption: A string of severe thunderstorms triggered deadly flooding across several upper Midwestern states in mid-August 2007.

title: Dust in the Taklimakan
caption: Dust blew eastward out of the Taklimakan Desert on August 22, 2007.

title: Deadly Fires on Sicily
caption: Brush fires burning in Sicily in August 2007 were responsible for several deaths on the island.

title: Severe Storms Across the Great Plains
caption: A line of powerful, drenching storms snaked across the upper Great Plains of the United States in the third full week of August 2007, while the remnants of Tropical Storm Erin drenched the already-sodden Southern Plains.

title: Plume from Chikurachki Volcano
caption: Chikurachki Volcano, in the northern Kuriles off the Kamchatka Peninsula, began releasing a plume of volcanic ash and steam on August 18, 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Erin Floods Texas and Oklahoma
caption: Though Tropical Storm Erin was a weak storm when it came ashore over the Texas Gulf Coast, it brought heavy rain to the region.

title: Smoke over the Dakotas
caption: Smoke from fires in western Montana and Idaho blew eastward across Montana, Wyoming, and the Dakotas on August 15, 2007.

title: Super Typhoon Sepat
caption: Super Typhoon Sepat came ashore in Taiwan on August 17, 2007, after bringing torrential rain and flooding to the Philippines the day before.

title: Hurricane Dean
caption:
After a relatively quiet period, the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season began to heat up
with the formation of Hurricane Dean during the second full week of August.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan
caption: On August 12, 2007, a dust storm formed where the borders of Iran, Afghanistan, and Pakistan meet.

title: Hurricane Flossie
caption: Hurricane Flossie grew to be a Category 4 storm in the eastern Pacific in mid-August 2007.

title: Haze in Eastern China
caption: Haze collected south of Beijing on August 13, 2007. The haze likely resulted from a combination of industrial smog and smoke from wildfires.

title: Haze off the United States East Coast
caption: Haze collected off the coasts of South Carolina, Georgia, and Florida on August 6, 2007.

title: Fires and Deforestation in the Amazon
caption: Numerous large fires burned along a north-south running road in the Brazilian Amazon in early August 2007.

title: Smoke from fires in Idaho and Montana
caption: Fires raging in Idaho and Montana combined with summer haze to pollute the skies over much of the United States in August 2007.

title: Zaca Wildfire, Southern California
caption: The Zaca Fire in Southern California began July 4, 2007, but flared up again in August, forcing hundreds to evacuate their homes. By late August, it had burned more than 220,000 acres.

title: Bloom in the Barents Sea
caption: The Barents Sea was a brilliant shade of blue, colored by a large phytoplankton bloom, in August 2007.

title: Flooding in England
caption: June and July 2007 brought drenching rain and devastating floods to England.

title: Haze over the Great Lakes
caption: Haze collected over the Great Lakes region at the end of July 2007.

title: Fires in Montana and Idaho
caption: In the northern Rocky Mountains of Idaho and Montana, dozens of large, dangerous wildfires burned hundreds of thousands of acres in later summer 2007. Images from early September show fires were still burning.

title: Floods in South Africa
caption: Days of heavy rain brought floods to South Africa's Western Cape province in late July and early August 2007.

title: Haze over Beijing
caption: Haze collected over the Beijing region in late July 2007.

title: Dust Plumes over Algeria and Niger
caption: Plumes of dust blew through Algeria and Niger on July 31, 2007.

title: Fires in South Africa
caption: Spurred by hot, dry weather, intense wildfires races across portions of eastern South Africa in July 2007.

title: Typhoon Usagi
caption: Typhoon Usagi, the fourth typhoon of 2007, churned across the northwestern Pacific Ocean heading towards Japan in late July and early August.

title: Fires in the Canary Islands
caption: Large forest fires forced thousands of evacuations on the Canary Islands in late July 2007.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide Eruption off Namibia
caption: The brilliant burst of neon blue and green that hugs the shore of Namibia in this photo-like image might be beautiful from space, but it is deadly on the ground.

title: Dust and Smoke off the West Coast of Africa
caption: Dust from the Sahara and smoke from a Canary Island fire mixed over the Atlantic on July 28, 2007.

title: Smoke over Montana
caption: Smoke sprawled over much of Montana on July 29, 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Dalila
caption: Though never a strong storm, Tropical Storm Dalila was the fourth named cyclone in the East Pacific during the 2007 season.

title: Smoke over Hudson Bay
caption: Thick smoke choked the skies over Manitoba, Ontario, and Hudson Bay on Tuesday, July 24, 2007.

title: Fires in Italy
caption: In Italy and neighboring southern European countries, extreme heat exacerbated dozens of forest fires burning across the country in July 2007.

title: Fires in Southern Europe
caption: High temperatures exacerbated scores of large forest fires in southern Europe in late July 2007. The fires continued off and on through the end of August.

title: Dust Plume off Western Africa
caption: A thick plume of dust blew off the west coast of northern Africa on July 20, 2007.

title: Dust Plume over Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: On July 21, 2007, a dust plume several hundred kilometers across swept through Afghanistan and Pakistan.

title: Fires in Manitoba
caption: Forest fires in Manitoba, Canada, in July 2007 forced hundreds of residents near Southern Indian Lake to evacuate due to thick smoke.

title: Murphy Complex Fire
caption: When two large, previously separate wildfires near the Idaho-Nevada state line merged over the July 21 weekend, fire management officials renamed the incident as the Murphy Complex Fire.

title: Haze off the U.S. East Coast
caption: Plumes of dingy gray haze collected off the east coast of the United States on July 19, 2007.

title: Dust Plume Over Iraq and Iran
caption: A dust plume blew along the Iraq-Iran border on July 18, 2007.

title: Fires in Idaho and Eastern Oregon
caption: Dry thunderstorms (lightning and winds, but no rain) ignited hundreds of fires across the U.S. West in a matter of days in mid-July 2007. Fires dotted the mountains at the border of Oregon and Idaho.

title: Fires in Nevada
caption: Fire activity ramped up across the U.S. West near the end of the third week of July 2007. Several large fires were burning in grass and sagebrush in northern Nevada.

title: Saharan Dust Plume
caption: Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over the Atlantic in mid July 2007.

title: Hurricane Cosme
caption: Hurricane Cosme was the third named storm in the 2007 Eastern Pacific hurricane season.

title: Fires in Russia’s Far East
caption: Fires in the forests of Russia's Far East are a common summer occurrence. Started by lightning and by people, fires transform the landscape and influence air quality. Numerous fires were burning in the area in mid-July 2007.

title: North African Dust Plume
caption: A dust storm crossed the border between Algeria and Mali on July 14, 2007.

title: Heatwave in the Western United States
caption: Oppressive heat gripped the western United States in early July 2007.

title: Plume from Gamkonora
caption: On July 7, 2007, the Gamkonora Volcano on Halmahera, Indonesia, began releasing plumes of ash. Two days later, it erupted.

title: Eastern Greenland, Summer Thaw
caption: Snow, glaciers, and sea ice along eastern Greenland were thawing in mid-July 2007.

title: Monsoon Floods in Myanmar
caption: Unusually heavy annual monsoon rains began to pound Myanmar (Burma) in June 2007, and by July, floods swept over the central and southern portions of the country.

title: Floods in Sudan
caption: Intense rains swept across Sudan starting on July 8, 2007, causing floods across much of the North African country throughout July, August, and September.

title: Milford Flat Fire, Utah
caption: The largest fire in Utah's recorded history burned more than 363,000 acres as of July 19, 2007. The fire raced through grass and sagebrush, driven by the wind.

title: Rare Snow in Buenos Aires, Argentina
caption: Buenos Aires, Argentina received its first major snowfall in nearly 90 years on July 9, 2007.

title: Typhoon Man-Yi
caption: Typhoon Man-yi formed as a tropical depression in the western Pacific on July 8, 2007, near the islands of Micronesia.

title: Black Pine 2 Fire, Idaho
caption: East of the Raft River in southern Idaho, the Black Pine 2 Fire had scorched more than 50,000 acres of grassland, brush, and juniper as of July 11, 2007.

title: Fires in Oregon
caption: The Egley Complex and other fires in Oregon were spreading rapidly and threatening numerous communities in mid-July 2007.

title: Floods in Central China
caption: Torrential summer rains brought widespread flooding to Central China in July 2007.

title: Fires in Angola
caption: During the southern Africa dry season, agricultural burning is common. In July 2007, burning was widespread across Angola, Democratic Republic of Congo, and Zambia.

title: Flooding in Eastern India
caption: India's annual monsoon triggered widespread flooding throughout the country in July and August 2007.

title: Saharan Dust Plume
caption: A dust plume hovered over the borders of Algeria, Mali, and Mauritania in early July 2007.

title: Plume from Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: Klyuchevskaya Volcano on Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula released another plume on July 9, 2007.

title: Dust Plume over Iraq
caption: A dust plume swept over Iraq on July 8, 2007, likely originating along the Syria-Iraq border.

title: Drought in Romania
caption: Poor winter snow and a dry spring left southern Romania in drought during the summer of 2007.

title: Fires Across Western United States
caption: Days of record heat made the western United States tinder dry in early July 2007. Numerous wildfires raced across the dry terrain during the weekend of July 7.

title: Texas Greenup
caption: The grassy plains of Texas burst to life in response to one of the wettest Junes on record in 2007.

title: Fires in U.S. Southwest
caption: In late June 2007, lightning triggered several fires in Arizona and New Mexico.

title: Floods in Pakistan
caption: A tropical cyclone and monsoon rains combined to bring extensive flooding to southwestern Pakistan at the end of June 2007.

title: Floods in Kansas and Missouri
caption: Rivers across eastern Kansas and western Missouri flowed high in July 2007 after a series of storms inundated the region with heavy rain.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: A dusty haze hung over the Arabian Peninsula, the Horn of Africa, and the Arabian Sea in late June 2007.

title: Floods in Southeastern Australia
caption: Widespread flooding swept across the Gippsland region of Victoria, Australia, during June and early July 2007, in the wake of unusually intense rain.

title: Plume from Bagana, Bougainville Island
caption: Bagana Volcano on Bougainville Island in Papua New Guinea released a wispy plume on June 28, 2007.

title: North Atlantic Bloom
caption: Millions of tiny plants bloom in the sun-lit waters of the North Atlantic Ocean every spring and summer, painting the water with brilliant swirls of blue and green.

title: Dual Plume from Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: Klyuchevskaya Volcano released a plume on July 1, 2007. One part of the plume appeared to consist primarily of water vapor, and the other of volcanic ash.

title: Dust Plumes off Iceland
caption: Plumes of dust blew off the southern coast of Iceland in late June 2007, following a period of dry weather.

title: Neola North Fire, Utah
caption: The Neola North Fire in eastern Utah only began on Friday, June 29, 2007, but had grown to more than 30,000 acres as of Monday, July 2.

title: Southern Africa Fires
caption: Smoke from fires in southern Africa spread over the Indian Ocean in late June 2007.

title: Storm Damages Crops in Montana
caption: Large hailstones pelted part of eastern Montana on June 16, 2007, flattening crops and natural vegetation.

title: Haze off the United States East Coast
caption: Plumes of haze blew off the east coast of the United States and over the Atlantic Ocean in late June 2007.

title: Dust Plume over the Persian Gulf
caption: A plume of dust blew out of Syria over Iraq, the northern tip of the Persian Gulf, and Saudi Arabia on June 26, 2007.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Haze formed an arc over eastern China in late June 2007.

title: Kenai Peninsula Fire, Alaska
caption: On June 19, 2007, a fire broke out int he Caribou Hills region of Alaska's Kenai Peninsula. Racing spruce trees killed by the spruce bark beetle, the blaze destroyed scores of cabins and outbuildings.

title: Tropical Cyclone 03B
caption: Cyclonic storms in the Arabian Sea are rare, but not unheard of.  Two tropical cyclones in the space of a month, on the other hand, is quite rare indeed.

title: Dust Plume off the Coast of Sudan
caption: On June 23, 2007, a dust storm began blowing off the coast of Sudan over the Red Sea. Dust continued blowing off the coast for the next several days.

title: Flooding on the Ob River
caption: The Ob River in Northeastern Siberia flooded with the spring thaw.

title: Angora Fire
caption: More than 200 homes were destroyed in a fast-moving wildfire south of Lake Tahoe that started over the weekend of June 23, 2007.

title: Dust Plume off Western Africa
caption: Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over Cape Verde on June 22, 2007, continuing a pattern of dust storm activity for the second consecutive day. Two days after the dust storm began, satellites tracked the plume's progress westward across the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Activity on Nyiragongo
caption: On June 19, 2007, Mount Nyiragongo released a plume that blew southward over Lake Kivu.

title: Volcanic Activity on Manam
caption: The volcanic island of Manam, off the coast of mainland Papua New Guinea, released a plume in mid-June 2007.

title: Newcastle Fire, Colorado
caption: The Newcastle Fire in Colorado was nearly contained as of June 21,2007, but it was still posing a threat to residences.  This image of the fire was captured on June 20, 2007.

title: Fires in Eastern Canada
caption: Eastern Canada's Quebec province was experiencing a more-active-than-normal fire season in late spring and early summer 2007. This image shows several large, smoky fires north of the St. Lawrence River.

title: Floods in Texas and Oklahoma
caption: Floods washed over parts of northern Texas and Oklahoma when heavy rain inundated the region in June 2007.

title: Landslide Buries Valley of the Geysers
caption: On June 3, 2007, the world lost part of a rare geyser field when a landslide buried a large part of Valley of the Geysers.

title: Dust Plume over Cape Verde
caption: Dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over Cape Verde on June 17, 2007.

title: Heat Wave in Pakistan
caption: A deadly heat wave settled over Pakistan and western India during the first half of June 2007.

title: Dust Plume over the Red Sea
caption: More dust blew off the coast of Sudan over the Red Sea on June 13, 2007.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Hundreds of agricultural fires were burning in central Africa in mid-June 2007 when the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA's Aqua satellite captured this image.

title: Flooding from Tropical Cyclone Gonu
caption: Cyclone Gonu left extensive flooding in southern Iran after it came ashore on June 6, 2007.

title: Torrential Rain in China
caption: Early summer rain pounded southeastern China during the first half of June 2007, causing widespread flooding and landslides.

title: Floods in Bangladesh
caption: Monsoon rain swelled rivers throughout Bangladesh starting in June 2007.

title: Dust Plume off the Coast of Northern Africa
caption: Dust blew off the African coast and over the Mediterranean Sea on June 9, 2007.

title: Drought in the United States
caption: By the end of May 2007, drought had set in over both the southeastern and the southwestern United States, while excess rain fell in the interior. This vegetation index image reflects plant growth in response to the drought and rain.

title: Drought in Australia
caption: May 2007 brought some relief to drought-stricken Australia in the form of rain.

title: Dust Storm over India and Pakistan
caption: Dust blew over the border between Pakistan and India on June 10, 2007.

title: Tornadoes Strike Northern Wisconsin
caption: A series of tornadoes ripped through the Upper Midwest region of the United States in the evening of June 7, 2007.

title: Fires in Northern Territory
caption: This image of the Northern Territory on June 10, 2007, was captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA's Aqua satellite. Places where MODIS detected active fires, probably strategic burns, are marked in red.

title: Dust Plume over the Red Sea
caption: Dust blew off the coasts of Sudan and Eritrea and over the Red Sea on June 7, 2007.

title: Floods in Southern China
caption: Heavy rain brought floods to southern and central China in June 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Barry
caption: Tropical Storm Barry was the second named storm of the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gonu
caption: You might expect to see a storm with near-perfect symmetry and a well-defined eye hovering over the warm waters of the Caribbean or in the South Pacific, but in June 2007, Tropical Cyclone Gonu showed up in an unusual place: the Arabian Sea.

title: Tropical Storm Barbara
caption: Tropical Storm Barbara was the second named storm of the 2007 Pacific hurricane season.

title: Flooding on the Lena River
caption: Floods spread behind ice jams along the Russia's north-flowing Lena River as winter slowly loosened its grip on the region in May 2007.

title: Lake Okeechobee Complex Fire
caption: As drought shrinks water levels in Lake Okeechobee, marshy areas along the shore are drying out and becoming flammable.

title: Dust in Northern China
caption: A late-spring dust storm skirted the China-Mongolia border on May 26, 2007.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: In Africa south of the equator, fires are ubiquitous during the annual dry season. This image shows early dry-season burning across a large swath of central Africa south of the equator on May 28, 2007.

title: Smoke Plume over Eastern Canada
caption: In late May, a massive smoke plume hundreds of kilometers across blew eastward over New Brunswick toward the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Fires and Thick Haze in Central China
caption: This photo-like image from NASA's Terra satellite shows fires and thick haze over central China in late May 2007.

title: Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: The Klyuchevskaya Volcano on Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula continued its ongoing activity through May and June 2007.

title: Dust Plume off the Coast of Egypt
caption: A dust plume blew off the coast of Egypt and over the Mediterranean Sea on May 19, 2007.

title: Dust in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: A dust storm formed in the Taklimakan Desert on May 19, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: On May 17, 2007, a dust storm swept over the Persian Gulf, forming an arc over Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Iran, and Iraq. Dust lingered over the area a day later.

title: Smog Yellows Taj Mahal
caption: By the spring of 2007, one of the world's most visited landmarks was turning yellow, and a panel of India's parliament had little trouble identifying the culprit: pollution.

title: Dust Storm over Syria, Turkey, and Iraq
caption: On May 13, 2007, a dust storm formed over the borders of Syria, Turkey, and Iraq.

title: Dust Storm near Cape Verde
caption: On May 12, 2007, a dust plume blew off the west coast of Africa near Cape Verde.

title: Fires in Honduras and Nicaragua
caption: NASA's Aqua satellite captured this image of fires in Honduras and Nicaragua on May 13, 2007.

title: Ham Lake Fire, Minnesota and Ontario
caption: The 50,000-acre Ham Lake Fire was scorching forests in Minnesota and Ontario on May 11, 2007.

title: Fire on Santa Catalina Island
caption: Off the coast of California, a large, fast-moving wildfire forced evacuations of residents and tourists on Santa Catalina Island on May 10, 2007.

title: Floods in Myanmar
caption: Floods surrounded Myanmar's capital city, Yangon, on May 8, 2007, when the Moderate Resolution Spectroradiometer captured this image.

title: Dust Storm over the Taklimakan Desert
caption: On May 10, 2007, a dust storm covered most of the Taklimakan Desert in western China.

title: Dust Plume off the West Coast of Africa
caption: A dust plume several hundred kilometers across blew off the west coast of Africa on May 9, 2007.

title: Subtropical Storm Andrea
caption: On May 9, 2007, a swirling subtropical low developed into Subtropical Storm Andrea over the warm coastal waters of the southeastern United States.

title: Dust Storm over the South Aral Sea
caption: A dust storm formed over the South Aral Sea on the border between Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan on May 9, 2007.

title: Floods in the Midwestern United States
caption: Rivers throughout the Midwestern United States rose to dangerous levels under the onslaught of heavy spring rains.

title: Heavy Rain in the US Midwest
caption: Flood-inducing rain drenched the U.S. Midwest during the first week of May 2007.

title: Dust Storm in Central Asia
caption: A massive dust storm blew through central Asia on May 7, 2007. Most of the dust originated from the dry lakebeds surrounding the retreating South Aral Sea.

title: Dust Blowing across the Eastern Mediterranean
caption: On May 6, 2007, a thin tendril of dust stretched northward across the Mediterranean Sea, from Libya to Italy and the Balkans.

title: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes
caption: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes on the Kamchatka Peninsula erupted simultaneously on April 26, 2007.

title: Volcanic Plume from Mount Semeru, Java
caption: On the Island of Java, Indonesia, Mount Semeru released a volcanic plume on May 3, 2007.

title: Eruption on Lopevi, Vanuatu
caption: Lopevi Volcano, part of the island nation of Vanuatu, released a plume on May 3, 2007.

title: Plume from Manam
caption: On April 28, 2007, Manam Volcano, just off the coast of mainland Papua New Guinea, released a plume of ash and/or steam.

title: Haze in Central China
caption: A thick pocket of haze formed over central China on May 2, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Kazakhstan
caption: A dust storm formed in northern Kazakhstan on May 2, 2007.

title: Fires in North Korea, Russia
caption: Fires were scattered along the eastern coast of Asia in late April 2007, likely the result of agricultural burning to prepare for the upcoming growing season.

title: Dust Storm in the Russian Far East
caption: A dust plume hovered over the border between Russia's Far East and China on April 30, 2007.

title: Fires in Southeast Australia
caption: In late April 2007, numerous large fires burned across southeast Australia. These images show active fire locations detected by the MODIS sensor on NASA's Aqua satellite.

title: Fires in Georgia and Florida
caption: The Bugaboo and Big Turnaround Complex Fires in southern Georgia and northern Florida scorched hundreds of thousands of acres in April and May 2007. This pair of images shows the fires and burn scars on May 30.

title: Dust Storm over Saudi Arabia and Iraq
caption: A fast-moving dust storm struck northern Saudi Arabia and Iraq on April 27, 2007, with a dust wall stretching across 450 kilometers.

title: Record Crops in Argentina
caption: Even though floods damaged crops in parts of Argentina, farmers were expecting a record harvest in April 2007.

title: Drought in Southwestern United States
caption: Much of the southwestern United States experienced moderate to severe drought in 2007.

title: Fires in South-Central Russia
caption: The MODIS sensor on the Aqua satellite captured this image of fires scattered across the Ob and Yenisey River plains in southern Russia on April 24, 2007.

title: Drought in West Africa
caption: Drought settled over Côte d'Ivoire and neighboring West African countries when wet season rains came late. The lack of rain hit the cocoa crop, driving prices up.

title: Nile Delta Dust Storm
caption: On April 17, 2007, desert winds whipped up a severe dust storm over Cairo. The dust plume blew northward over the Nile Delta and the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Dust Storm in Southern California
caption: On April 12, 2007, a dust storm blew out of the dry lakebed of Bristol Lake, southeast of Amboy, California.

title: Sweat Farm Road Fire, Georgia
caption: The Sweat Farm Road Fire in southern Georgia exploded from 1,000 acres to more than 20,000 acres in less than 24 hours between April 16 and 17, 2007. By April 30, it had grown to more than 50,000 acres.

title: Flooding in Ethiopia
caption: Sections of eastern Ethiopia flooded for the second time in less than a year when heavy rain fell in mid-April 2007.

title: Fires in Mexico and Central America
caption: Fires burned off and on throughout southern Mexico and northern Central America in April and May 2007, during the region's annual dry season. This image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite on May 22 shows fires and smoke over the area.

title: Earthquake Raises Reefs in the Solomon Islands
caption: An earthquake in the Solomon Islands lifted Ranongga Island as much as three meters, exposing reefs around the island.

title: Fires in Southeast Australia
caption: Multiple fires were burning in Victoria and New South Wales in mid-April. This image shows fires and smoke across the two states.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm
caption: On April 11, 2007, a dust storm blew out of northern Africa's Bodele Depression toward Lake Chad.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: Dust plumes blew out of the Taklimakan Desert throughout April 2007.

title: Drought in Southern Africa
caption: Southern African crops wilted under hot temperatures and dry skies in January, February, and March 2007.

title: Floods in Spain
caption: The Ebro River, which flows through eastern Spain, spilled over its banks in early April 2007 in the wake of heavy springtime rain.

title: Madagascar’s Cyclone Season
caption: Between December 2006 and April 2, 2007, as many as seven tropical cyclones had drenched the southern African island nation of Madagascar. These images show rainfall totals for the five-month period.

title: Dust and Clouds over Eastern China
caption: Dust mixed with clouds over eastern China, and the Korean Peninsula on March 31, 2007.

title: Plume at Mount Bagana, Bouganville Island
caption: Mount Bagana began releasing vapor plumes and volcanic ash in March 2007.

title: Piton de la Fournaise Volcano
caption: Piton de la Fournaise Volcano on Reunion Island east of Madagascar erupted in the spring of 2007.

title: Drought in China
caption: A warm, dry winter left much of China in extreme drought by March 2007.

title: Mount Batu Tara
caption: On April 4, 2007, the volcanic island of Batu Tara in the Lesser Sunda Islands released a volcanic plume.

title: Chikurachki Volcano
caption: Russia's Chikurachki Volcano released a plume in early April 2007.

title: Fires in the Southern Midwest
caption: On April 4, 2007, dozens of fires were burning in the southern portions of the U.S. Midwest. This image from Aqua MODIS shows Kansas, Missouri, Arkansas, and Oklahoma.

title: Springtime Aerosols over Eastern Asia
caption: A combination of dust and smoke clouded the skies over eastern Asia, the Sea of Japan, and the western Pacific Ocean in late March 2007.

title: Locust Swarms in Africa and the Arabian Peninsula
caption: Winter rains and thick vegetation allowed swarms of locusts to form along the coastal plains of the Red Sea in March 2007. By the end of May, the developing swarms had invaded Yemen.

title: Tropical Cyclone Jaya
caption: Tropical  Cyclone Jaya came ashore in Northern Madagascar in the morning of April 2, 2007 at around 11:00 am local time (08:00 UTC).

title: Gobi Desert Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm blew across the Gobi Desert on March 30, 2007, originating in Mongolia and heading toward China.

title: Fires in Democratic Republic of Congo
caption: Late dry-season fires burn across Equateur province in northwestern Democratic Republic of Congo in early April 2007.

title: Shiveluch Volcano, Kamchatka Peninsula
caption: On March 29, 2007, the Shiveluch Volcano on the Russian Federation's Kamchatka Peninsula erupted, sending an ash cloud skyward roughly 9,750 meters.

title: Dust Storm in Northern China
caption: A dust storm struck northwestern China, not far from the Mongolian border, on March 24, 2007.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kara
caption: Tropical  Cyclone Kara was poised just offshore of the Pilbara coast of Western Australia on March 27, 2007.

title: Thames River Plume in the North Sea
caption: Clouds of green and brown form the plume of the River Thames in the dark blue waters of the North Sea in this photo-like image.

title: Lahar on Mount Ruapehu, New Zealand
caption: On March 18, 2007, a lahar burst out of Mount Ruapehu's caldera and flowed down the side of the volcano on New Zealand's North Island.

title: Floods in Northern Argentina
caption: Unusually heavy late-summer rains led to extensive flooding across northern Argentina from January through April 2007.

title: Dust Storm out of Northern Africa
caption: North African dust blew out of Africa and over the Mediterranean in late March 2007.

title: Floods in Afghanistan
caption: Rain and melting snow combined to trigger floods and landslides in southwestern Afghanistan in March and April 2007.

title: Fires in Tasmania
caption: Fires triggered by lightning in February 2007 continued to burn in March. This image shows the fires on March 21.

title: Haze over China
caption: Haze mingled with clouds in the skies over eastern China in late March 2007.

title: Cyclone Indlala Floods Madagascar
caption: Cyclone Indlala's rains triggered widespread flooding in northern Madagascar starting on March 14, 2007.

title: Flooding in Honduras
caption: Heavy rains triggered floods along the Atlantic Coast of Honduras in early March 2007.

title: Emissions from Anatahan
caption: On March 17, 2007, the Anatahan Volcano, in the Northern Mariana Islands, released a plume of ash and/or steam.

title: Tornadoes in Alabama and Georgia
caption: A massive tornado tore through Enterprise, Alabama, on March 1, 2007, leaving a swath of devastation about 180 meters (200 yards) wide through the small city.

title: Cyclones Flood Western Australia
caption: Within four days, two cyclones came ashore over the northern shore of Western Australia. The storms caused flooding along the coast and in the DeGrey River basin.

title: Cyclone Indlala
caption: On March 14, 2007, storm-weary Madagascar braced for its fourth land-falling tropical cyclone in as many months.

title: Dust Storm over the Canary Islands
caption: On March 10, 2007, thick plumes of dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over the Canary Islands.

title: Cyclone Jacob
caption: Tropical  Cyclone Jacob was in the eastern Indian Ocean off the shore of Western Australia on March 10, 2007.

title: Fires in the Southern United States
caption: Numerous fires were burning across the southern United States in early March 2007. This image shows the area on March 20, 2007.

title: Stromboli Volcano
caption: On February 27, 2007, the Stromboli Volcano underwent a strong eruption. According to the BBC News, two new craters opened on the volcano's summit, producing twin lava flows.

title: Floods in Northern Australia
caption: The widespread rain and high tides accompanying Cyclone George caused flooding across Australia's Northern Territory in early March 2007.

title: Tropical Cyclone George
caption: Nearly a day after coming ashore in Western Australia, Tropical Cyclone George retained many of the visual characteristics of a cyclone. This image shows the storm inland on March 9, 2007.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm, Lake Chad Fires
caption: In early March 2007, dust blew out of the Bodele Depression while fires burned around the edges of Lake Chad.

title: Flooding in the Zambezi Valley
caption: In the wake of an early and intense rainy season, the upper Zambezi River was overflowing in March 2007.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: On March 2, 2007, a dust storm blew out of Saudi Arabia, northward over the Persian Gulf, and into Iran.

title: Fires in Myanmar
caption: Hundreds of fires were burning in Myanmar and surrounding countries in March and April 2007.

title: Dust Storm out of Western Africa
caption: Saharan dust blew off the west coast of Africa and over the Cape Verde Islands on February 28, 2007.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan Desert
caption: A dust storm struck western China on February 28, 2007.

title: Cyclone Favio Floods Mozambique
caption: Cyclone Favio came ashore over southern and central Mozambique on February 22, 2007. It's heavy rains caused flooding along several rivers, including the Buzi River.

title: Dust Storm over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: A dust storm, likely originating in the Sahara Desert, swept across the Mediterranean Sea on February 24, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Northern Texas
caption: A dust storm blew across northern Texas on February 24, 2007, turning north just before reaching Dallas.

title: Cloud Streets over the Great Lakes
caption: Like strokes from an artist's brush, the sky over Lake Superior and Lake Michigan was painted with long rows of white clouds on February 5, 2007.

title: Dust Storm over Libya
caption: Saharan dust swept northward across Libya and northwestern Egypt toward the Mediterranean on February 23, 2007.

title: Floods in Madagascar
caption: A string of tropical cyclones triggered floods on the island of Madagascar off southern Africa during the 2006-2007 cyclone season.

title: Dust Storm from the Sahara Desert
caption: On February 21, 2007, a dust storm several hundred kilometers across clogged the skies over Algeria and Mali.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gamede
caption: Tropical Cyclone Gamede churned across the Indian Ocean in mid-February 2007, and by February 25, was pushing south along the coast of Madagascar.

title: Rabaul Volcano on New Britain
caption: Rabaul Volcano on the island of New Britain released a plume on February 14, 2007.

title: Snow over the Northeast United States
caption: A late-winter storm coated the Northeast United States in snow on February 14, 2007, leaving a strip of white that stretches from Maine to Virginia in this photo-like image acquired a few days later.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: A dust storm from the Arabian Peninsula blew across the Persian Gulf toward Iran on February 17, 2007.

title: Plume from Sheveluch Volcano
caption: On February 16, 2007, the Sheveluch Volcano released a plume.

title: Java Mud Volcano Continues to Grow
caption: On the island of Java, a mud volcano has been spewing thousands of cubic meters of mud every day since late May 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Favio
caption: Tropical Cyclone Favio formed in the western Indian Ocean about 1,200 kilometers from Madagascar on February 14, 2007, and came ashore over Mozambique as a powerful cyclone on February 22.

title: Soufriere Hills on Montserrat
caption: The Soufriere Hills Volcano released plumes of ash and steam in mid to late February 2007.

title: Floods in Jakarta
caption: Torrential rains in late January and early February buried Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia, in deep flood water.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: On February 10, 2007, a dust plume lingered over the Arabian Sea. The dust likely originated in Iran and Pakistan.

title: Fire in  Porongurup National Park, Western Australia
caption: A devastating bushfire has ravaged nearly all the terrain of a small national park in the southern part of Western Australia. This image of the fire was captured by Terra MODIS on February 12, 2007.

title: Haze over Korea
caption: On February 6, 2007, thick haze blew across the Korean Peninsula toward Japan. Two weeks later, more haze hung over the region.

title: Tropical Cyclone Dora
caption: Tropical Cyclone Dora spun south over the Indian Ocean as it built and dissipated in early February 2007.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: On February 5, 2007, dust blew along the Iran-Iraq border and over the Persian Gulf.

title: Fire Near Dwellingup, Western Australia
caption: A large bushfire burned 11,000 hectares and destroyed 16 homes over the weekend of February 3, 2007.

title: Dust Storm from the Bodele Depression
caption: On January 29, 2007, a dust storm blew out of the Bodele Depression in northern Africa toward Lake Chad.

title: El Nino Rainfall Patterns over the United States
caption: January rainfall over the United States reflects a pattern usually caused by El Nino, the warming of the central Pacific Ocean.

title: Forest Fire on Maui
caption: In the last week of January 2007, a forest fire burned on the Hawaiian island of Maui, scorching several hundred acres of state park land and forest reserves before it was contained.

title: Dust Storm over Turkmenistan
caption: On January 29, 2007, a dust storm blew northward across Turkmenistan toward Uzbekistan. At least part of the storm originated in northern Iran and Afghanistan.

title: Thunderstorm over the Indian Ocean
caption: A thunderstorm created an unusual circular ring of cirrus clouds as it crossed from land to ocean off Australia's northwestern corner.

title: Haze and Sediment in Bangladesh and India
caption: Haze hugged the Himalaya Mountains in late January 2007, while thick sediment clogged the mouth of the Ganges.

title: Snow in New Mexico, Arizona, and Northern Mexico
caption: On January 21, 2007, a storm dropped snow on parts of New Mexico, Arizona, and northern Mexico.

title: Floods in Southern Africa
caption: Floods swept across southern Africa in the wake of unusually heavy rains at the end of January and into February 2007.

title: Floods in Australia
caption: The summer monsoon brought heavy rain to Australia's desert interior in January and February 2007, leaving normally empty river channels brimming with water. This event includes pre- and post-flood images from Northern Territory and Queensland.

title: Floods in the Southern and Midwestern United States
caption: A strong winter storm in late January 2007 unleashed heavy rain across the United States from Texas to Indiana, causing rivers across the region to burst their banks.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Numerous fires were scattered across Southeast Asia from January into early April 2007. These images of the fires and smoke are from Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA's Aqua satellite.

title: Dust in Iran and Turkmenistan
caption: A dust storm blew across the border between Iran and Turkmenistan on January 20, 2007.

title: Dust Blowing over the Canary Islands
caption: Saharan dust blew over the Canary Islands in mid January 2007.

title: Santa Maria Volcano
caption: On January 15, 2007, the Santa Maria Volcano in Guatemala released a faint plume that blew west toward Mexico.

title: Sheveluch (Shiveluch) Volcano
caption: On January 16, 2007, the Sheveluch (Shiveluch) Volcano released a plume. The white color of the plume suggested that it consisted primarily of water vapor.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Great Australian Bight
caption: A phytoplankton bloom colored ocean waters off the southern coast of Australia on January 11, 2007.

title: Ocean Color in the Gulf of Alaska
caption: Brilliant swirls of turquoise in the Gulf of Alaska contrast with the winter black-and-white scene presented by the frozen coastline and black ocean waters in this photo-like image captured on January 9, 2007.

title: Fires North of Concepcion, Chile
caption: Several large fires on the Chilean coast billowed smoke over the Pacific on January 13, 2007.

title: Seasonal Flooding in Malawi
caption: As seasonal rains settled into Malawi in early January 2007, the Shire River burst its dry-season banks and spread over its marshy flood plain.

title: Torrential Rain Brings Floods and Landslides to South America
caption: Torrential rain pounded Brazil, Bolivia, and Peru from December 2006 through February 2007, causing floods and landslides. Bolivia was particularly hard-hit with extensive flooding.

title: Storms in the Java Sea
caption: High wind events in the Java Sea region were linked to an air crash and a ferry capsizing incident. This image from QuikScat on January 1, 2007, reveals the large-scale weather patterns linked to the strong winds.

title: Soufriere Hills Activity
caption: The Soufriere Hills on Montserrat erupted on January 8, 2007, prompting a partial evacuation of the island.

title: Karymsky Volcano
caption: Karymsky Volcano continued its intermittent activity in December 2006, producing a thermal hotspot and steam plume.

title: Heard Island Volcano
caption: The volcano's current phase of activity began in May 2006, and it continued through December 2006.

title: Bodele Depression Dust Storm
caption: On January 2, 2007, another winter dust storm whipped dust from the Bodele Depression across Africa and over the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Fires in North-Central Africa
caption: Beneath a veil of dust, hundreds of fires were burning in the Sahel and savannas of north-central Africa on January 5, 2007.

title: Dust off Iran and Pakistan
caption: Dust plumes blew off the coasts of Iran and Pakistan on January 4, 2007.

title: Dust over Cape Verde
caption: Saharan dust clouded the skies over Cape Verde on January 1, 2007. Tiny dust plumes also blew off the islands of Sal and Boa Vista.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze clung to the southern edge of the Himalaya in early 2007, continuing a pattern from late 2006.

title: Dust Storm off West Africa
caption: Plumes of dust blew off the coasts of Western Sahara and Mauritania on January 1, 2007.

title: Tropical Storm Clovis
caption: Tropical Cyclone Clovis formed off the coast of Madagascar on December 31, 2006, becoming an organized tropical storm system as the new year began.

title: Snowstorms in Colorado
caption: Coloradans hoping for a white Christmas saw too much of a good thing in December 2006. Severe storms struck on December 20 and 21, December 28, and January 5, 2007.

title: Sheveluch (Shiveluch) Volcano
caption: Sheveluch (or Shiveluch) Volcano released a plume on December 27, 2006.

title: Fog over London
caption: Dense fog hugs the ground around London in this MODIS image from December 20, 2006. The fog dispruted travel out of London's Heathrow airport for several days.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Argentina
caption: Brilliant blues and greens color the water off the shore of Argentina in this photo-like image.

title: Tropical Cyclone Bondo
caption: On December 20, 2006, the Seychelle Islands were on alert for the very intense tropical cyclone Bondo which was predicted to strike the islands in the early hours of the next day.

title: Powerful Windstorm in the Pacific Northwest
caption: Oregon and Washington State suffered the worst windstorm in a decade on December 14, 2006.

title: Extratropical Cyclones near Iceland
caption: Although tropical storms most often come to mind, these spiraling storms can also form at mid- and high latitudes. Two such cyclones formed in tandem in November 2006.

title: East Africa Greens Up from Heavy Rains
caption: After devastating drought in 2005, eastern Africa experienced heavy rains and flooding during the 2006 "short rains" season that usually lasts from around October until December.

title: Fires in Northeastern Tasmania
caption: Several houses were destroyed by bushfires in mid-December 2006 in northeast Tasmania. This image shows a large fire south of St. Marys on December 13.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
