caption: On December 17, 2006, a plume from Saudi Arabia crossed the Red Sea toward Sudan.

title: Dust Storm from the Bodele Depression
caption: A dust storm blew out of the Bodele Depression on December 11, 2006.

title: Lake Effect Snow in the United States
caption: On December 9, 2006, the southeastern shores of the Great Lakes were lined with streamers of lake-effect snow.

title: Typhoon Utor
caption: Typhoon Utor struck the Philippines on December 9, 2006. Coming just a week after Super Typhoon Durian passed through the island chain on a parallel path to the north, Utor brought heavy rain and strong winds to sodden ground and swollen rivers.

title: Volcanic Activity on Dukono
caption: Dukono Volcano on Halmahera, Indonesia, released a plume in early December 2006.

title: Haze over Southwestern India
caption: A plume of haze descended over Mumbai from the southwest in early December 2006.

title: Eruption of Mount Nyamulagira (Nyamuragira)
caption: Mount Nyamulagira (Nyamuragira), in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, began erupting around 10 p.m. local time on November 27, 2006. Volcanic ash from the eruption threatened local wildlife, and sulfur dioxide from the eruption traveled as far as India.

title: Volcanic Activity on Pagan Island
caption: A volcano on Pagan Island released a plume of ash and/or steam in early December 2006.

title: Flooding from Typhoon Durian
caption: Typhoon Durian pounded southern Luzon Island in the Philippines on November 30, 2006. The rains caused widespread flooding and mudslides.

title: Heavy Snow in U.S. Midwest
caption: A severe winter storm hammered the Midwestern United States on December 1, 2006, icing roads, grounding flights, and leaving more than two million homes and businesses without power.

title: Fires in Victoria, Australia
caption: In Victoria, bushfires that began in early December 2006 were still burning in 2007. This image shows the burning area on January 16, 2007.

title: Shekell Fire, California
caption: The Shekell Fire began early in the morning on December 3, 2006, and had destroyed several homes and burned about 9,700 acres as of December 4. This image shows the fire and smoke on December 3.

title: Dust Storm near Brisbane, Australia
caption: A dust storm, possibly mingled with smoke from nearby fires, clouded the skies over Brisbane, Australia, in late November 2006. By December 1, the dust plume had moved northward over the Coral Sea.

title: Super Typhoon Durian
caption: Super Typhoon Durian came ashore in the Philippines on November 30, 2006.

title: Haze along the Himalaya
caption: Haze hugged the southern side of the Himalayas in late November 2006. Haze remained in the area the following month.

title: Heavy Rain Floods Panama
caption: Intense rain fell over Panama in late November, triggering deadly floods in the Rio Indio, west of the Panama Canal.

title: Plume from Karymsky Volcano
caption: The Karymsky Volcano in eastern Russia released a faint plume in late November 2006. Intermittent activity continued the following month.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: Haze clouded the skies over eastern China in late November and December 2006. Pollution levels reached the highest category in the nation's environmental monitoring index in mid-November and spiked again in December.

title: Dust off Northwestern Africa
caption: A plume of dust blew off the northwestern coast of Africa on November 21, 2006.

title: Mount Etna, Sicily
caption: Sicily's Mount Etna released a thick plume of volcanic ash on November 24, 2006, forcing the overnight closure of a nearby airport. Intermittent activity continued through early December 2006.

title: Fires in Northern Territory and Queensland
caption: Fires and large burn scars were scattered across the tropical savannas of Northern Territory and Queensland on November 27, 2006.

title: Dust off Pakistan
caption: Plumes of dust blew off the coasts of Pakistan and Iran and over the Arabian Sea in these images, taken in November and December 2006.

title: Fires in New South Wales, Australia
caption: Spurred by dry conditions and high winds, wildfires raged through several natural areas in New South Wales in November and December 2006, including the Blue Mountains and the Pilliga natural areas.

title: Northern Africa Fire Season
caption: Each year, thousands of fires dot the Sahel and savannas of northern Africa during the agricultural burning season. These satellite images captured between November 2006 and January 2007 show widespread fires across the continent.

title: Floods in Afghanistan
caption: Heavy rain brought on widespread flooding in western and northern Afghanistan in November 2006.

title: Fires in Northwest Australia
caption: Large burn scars from dozens of fires were visible across Western Australia and Northern Territory in mid-November 2006.

title: Volcanic Activity in the South Sandwich Islands
caption: In late October 2006, Mount Belinda, on Montagu Island, continued emitting ash and lava in what was now a five-year-long eruption.

title: Hurricane Sergio
caption: Sergio was the tenth hurricane in the Eastern Pacific in 2006.  When Sergio first reached Tropical Storm status on November 13, it broke a record set in 1961, the last time more than one tropical storm formed in the Eastern Pacific in November.

title: New Island and Pumice Raft, Tonga
caption: A new volcanic island emerged in the Tonga Islands in August 2006. A pumice raft appeared in the region at the same time. News reports released in November 2006 brought the volcanic activity international attention.

title: Haze over Southern China
caption: Haze collected over the Sichuan Basin and extended southward into Laos and Vietnam in mid-November 2006. The haze may have resulted from a combination of industrial and urban smog and agricultural fires.

title: Fires in Southern Queensland
caption: Several large fires were burning in southern Queensland in mid-November. These images of the fires were captured by NASA's Aqua satellite.

title: Dust Storm over the Canary Islands
caption: A Saharan dust storm blew over the Canary Islands in early November 2006.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula
caption: Numerous large fires were burning across the grasslands and savannas of Queensland's Cape York Peninsula in mid-November 2006.

title: Dust Storm in the Bodele Depression, Chad
caption: A dust storm blew out of the Bodele Depression in Chad in early November 2006.

title: Record Rain over the U.S. Northwest
caption: Record rainfall fell over parts of the northwestern United States during the first week of November 2006 as a slow-moving storm swept over the region.

title: Fires on Madagascar
caption: Fires were burning in many ecosystems on Madagscar in early November 2006. A satellite image captured fires scattered across the entire island.

title: Floods in Southern India
caption: Wide swaths of coastal southeastern India were under water on November 5, 2006, when MODIS captured this image.

title: Floods in East Africa
caption: Floods swept over formerly drought-stricken regions of Kenya and Ethiopia when unusually heavy seasonal rains began in late October and continued through December 2006.

title: Dust Storm off Alaska
caption: A dust storm blew off the Alaskan coast from the Copper River Valley in early November 2006.

title: Stormy Weather in the North Sea
caption: Powerful, hurricane-force winds roughened the North Sea on October 27, 2006, and subsequent days, causing both coastal flooding and damage to ships at sea.

title: Subtropical Storm off the Coast of Oregon
caption: A rare subtropical storm formed in the northeastern Pacific Ocean in early November 2006.

title: Floods in Portugal
caption: Portugal and western Spain were inundated with floods after several days of heavy rain at the end of October 2006.

title: Super Typhoon Cimaron
caption: Super Typhoon Cimaron struck the northernmost large island in the Philippines, Luzon, on October 29, 2006.

title: Esperanza Fire
caption: Waves of gray-brown smoke from the Esperanza Fire washed over the mountains southeast of Los Angeles and out over the Pacific on October 26, 2006.

title: Drought in Southeastern Australia
caption: Spring started warm and dry in much of Australia. In addition to high land surface temperatures in September 2006, many of the country's agricultural areas were facing 6- to 12-month rainfall deficiencies.

title: Floods in Texas and Louisiana
caption: Heavy rain triggered floods along the Neches, Sabine, and Calcasieu Rivers in late October 2006.

title: Hurricane Paul
caption: As October drew to a close, Hurricane Paul was approaching the southern tip of Mexico's Baja Peninsula.

title: Severe Thunderstorms over the Southeastern United States
caption: A long line of thunderstorms brought heavy rain, flooding and tornadoes to Texas and Lousiana on October 16, 2006.

title: Dust and Smoke over the Mediterranean
caption: Dust from Libya and Egypt and smoke from fires in the Nile Delta blew off the north coast of Africa in mid-October 2006.

title: Fires in Northwest India
caption: Each year in Northern Hemisphere fall, the fertile agricultural plains at the foothills of the Himalaya Mountains in northwest India come alive with scores of seasonal agricultural fires. This image shows fires and smoke on November 5, 2006.

title: Fires on Cape Barren Island
caption: In mid-October 2006, fires had scorched thousands of acres across Cape Barren Island, south of Australia.

title: Haze over Korea
caption: Haze hung in the air over Korea in early October 2006. Some of the haze may have resulted from fires on Borneo and Sumatra.

title: Eruption from Rabaul Volcano
caption: Rabaul Volcano, on the northeastern tip of New Britain Island, underwent a large eruption on October 7, 2006, releasing volcanic ash and steam. A day later, the volcanic plume had dissipated.

title: Sulfur Dioxide from Rabaul Volcano
caption: On October 7, 2006, a large eruption rattled New Britain Island in Papua New Guinea as the Rabaul Volcano sent a large cloud of ash, steam, and sulfur dioxide into the atmosphere.

title: Dust Storm over the Sahara
caption: A Saharan dust storm crossed the borders between Mauritania, Mali, and Algeria in early October 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Bebinca
caption: Tropical Storm Bebinca formed early in the morning on October 1, 2006, to the northeast of the Philippine Islands.  The system gradually moved north and east away from the island chain and gained enough power to become a storm and be named.

title: Fires on Borneo and Sumatra
caption: Agricultural and forest fires burning on Sumatra and Borneo since late September 2006 blanketed a wide region with smoke that interrupted air and highway travel and pushed air quality to unhealthy levels. Fires were still burning in early November.

title: Fires in Mozambique and Tanzania
caption: Scores of fires were burning on October 1, 2006, in Tanzania and Mozambique.

title: Fires on Melville Island
caption: A large fire was burning on Melville Island north of mainland Australia on October 4, 2006.

title: Typhoon Xangsane Floods Vietnam
caption: Typhoon Xangsane left extensive flooding in its wake when it slammed into the coast of Vietnam on October 1, 2006.

title: Volcanic Activity on Soufriere Hills
caption: The Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat emitted volcanic ash and steam in early October 2006. Volcanic emissions continued throughout October and into November.

title: Hurricane Isaac
caption: On September 30, Hurricane Isaac became the fifth hurricane of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Thunderstorms in the Midwestern United States
caption: Severe storms and flooding swept across parts of the southeastern and mid-western United States on September 23 and September 24, 2006.

title: Fires on Sumatra
caption: In late September and October 2006, scores of fires were burning in southeastern Sumatra. The island's largest city, Palembang, was shrouded in haze.

title: Typhoon Xangsane
caption: Typhoon Xangsane began as an area of low air pressure (tropical depression) on September 25, 2006, in the western Pacific near the coast of the Philippine Islands.  Over the next 36 hours, it grew into a typhoon.

title: Floods in the Southeastern United States
caption: Early fall thunderstorms dumped heavy rain on Arkansas, Missouri, Kentucky, and Tennessee, giving rise to floods on September 24, 2006.

title: Dust Storm in the Simpson Desert, Australia
caption: A dust storm struck the Simpson Desert in Australia's outback in late September 2006.

title: Volcanic Activity on Suwanose-jima
caption: The Suwanose-jima Volcano emitted a continuous plume of ash and steam in September 2006.

title: Typhoon Yagi
caption: Typhoon Yagi (the Japanese word for goat) formed as a tropical depression in the northwestern Pacific Ocean on September 17, 2006.

title: Haze over Eastern China
caption: A thick band of haze hung intermittently over eastern China in the fall of 2006. The haze likely resulted from urban and industrial pollution, agricultural fires, and weather patterns that trapped the pollutants in the region.

title: Hurricane Lane
caption: The 2006 Atlantic hurricane season may have had a slow start, but the Eastern Pacific season was not so quiet.  By September 14, the National Hurricane Center was already on the twelfth entry in its storm name list, Lane.

title: Hurricane Helene
caption: Hurricane Helene was the eighth named storm of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season.  Helene intensified from a tropical depression (area of low air pressure) south of the Cape Verde Islands and became a tropical storm on September 12.

title: Drought on the Great Plains
caption: Across the Great Plains of the United States and Canada, devastating drought spread across grasslands and croplands in summer 2006.

title: Hurricane Gordon
caption: Hurricane Gordon was the seventh named storm of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season.  Gordon started off the Leeward Islands in the Caribbean on September 10, and it grew in power and size steadily over the next several days.

title: Drought in Central Asia
caption: Spring rains failed to fall over northwestern Afghanistan, leaving as many as 2.5 million people in need of food aid.

title: Fires on Borneo
caption: Scores of fires created a thick haze over Borneo in September and October 2006.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan Desert
caption: A dust storm struck the Taklimakan Desert in western China in early September 2006.

title: Typhoon Shanshan
caption: Typhoon Shanshan formed on September 10, 2006, in the western Pacific well off the coast of the Philippine Islands.  Over the course of the next 36 hours, it grew from a tropical depression to a typhoon.

title: Smoke over Western Canada
caption: A thick plume of smoke clouded the skies over Alberta and the Northwest Territories in Canada in early September 2006. The smoke likely resulted from numerous wildfires in the region.

title: Day Fire in Southern California
caption: The Day Fire started in Los Padres National Forest north of Los Angeles on September 4, 2006. As of September 27, the fire had burned more than 144,000 acres.

title: Hurricane Florence
caption: The sixth storm of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season, Hurricane Florence formed on September 3, 2006. Florence weakened as it moved north, becoming an extra-tropical storm by September 15.

title: Floods in Thailand
caption: Though floods are not unusual in Thailand during the summer monsoon season, 2006 brought unusually heavy flooding.

title: Monsoon Floods in Northern India
caption: Unusually heavy monsoon rains flooded much of India during the summer of 2006.

title: Dust over the Caspian Sea
caption: Dust blew over the Caspian Sea in early September 2006.

title: Derby Fire, Montana
caption: Over the 2006 Labor Day weekend, a large fire burning in southern Montana forced hundreds of people to evacuate from their homes.

title: Hurricane John
caption: As of September 1, 2006, Hurricane John had been lashing the Mexican Pacific coast for several days.  The storm system center was remaining offshore and predications held that it would only briefly come ashore as it clipped the southern tip of Mexico's Baja California on its track up along the Pacific coast.

title: Floods in Northwestern India
caption: Unusually heavy monsoon rains throughout August 2006 triggered widespread flooding in northwestern India.

title: Oil Spill near Guimaras Island
caption: A tanker carrying more than two million liters of bunker oil sank near the Philippine Island of Guimaras, spilling oil into the ocean.

title: Hurricane Ernesto
caption: Hurricane Ernesto formed in the eastern Caribbean Sea on August 24, 2006. Ernesto built in power gradually as it moved westward and slightly north, just reaching hurricane strength as it neared Hispaniola on August 27.

title: Hurricane Ileana
caption: Hurricane Ileana started as all tropical cyclones do, as a depression -- an area of low atmospheric pressure.   After forming August 21, 2006, the depression quickly developed into a tropical storm, the threshold for earning a name.

title: Tropical Storm Debby
caption: As of August 24, 2006, Tropical Storm Debby was making its way through the central Atlantic and poses no immediate threat to any land areas.

title: Columbia Complex Fire
caption: In the southeastern corner of Washington the Columbia Complex Fire had grown to 34,000 acres as of August 24, 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Ioke
caption: Ioke started as a tropical depression on August 19, 2006, and quickly became a tropical storm. Ioke was the first tropical storm to form in the central Pacific since 2002.  It has since traveled more than halfway across the entire Pacific Ocean.

title: Fires in South America
caption: In South America, scores of fires were churning out thick smoke into the skies above Bolivia, Brazil, and Argentina in late August 2006.

title: Forest Fire in Greece
caption: A large forest fire forced thousands of people to evacuate the southern tip of the Kasandra Peninsula in Greece on August 21, 2006.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Vietnam
caption: Seasonal monsoon rains triggered widespread flooding across Vietnam in August 2006.

title: Floods in Cambodia
caption: Heavy rains pushed the Mekong River and the Tonle Sap to their seasonal highs in August and September 2006.

title: Hurricane Hector
caption: Hurricane Hector formed in the eastern Pacific on August 15, 2006.  Within a day, it had become organized enough to be classified as a tropical storm and earn its name. As of August 18, Hector was a moderately powerful Category 1 hurricane, traveling across the eastern Pacific.

title: Floods Across Africa’s Sahel
caption: The Sahel region of Africa was about halfway through the rainy season of 2006 when flooding affected people in several countries, including Ethiopia, Sudan, Niger, and Burkina Faso.

title: Charleston Fire, Northern Nevada
caption: In northeastern Nevada, a 20,000-acre fire was racing through sagebrush, grass, and juniper on August 16, 2006.

title: Oil Spill Along the Lebanese Coast
caption: Oil spilled from the Jiyyeh Power Plant in Lebanon spread northward along the Mediterranean coastline in August 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Wukong
caption: Tropical storm Wukong formed in the western Pacific on August 12, 2006, as a tropical depression.  Within a day, it had become organized enough to be classified as a tropical storm and earn its name.

title: Fires in Oregon
caption: In northern Oregon's Cascade Mountains, several fires were burning in mid-August 2006.

title: Dust Over the Gulf of Aden
caption: A dust plume blew over the Gulf of Aden in mid-August 2006. Streamers of dust trailed Socotra Island in early September.

title: Fires in Idaho
caption: Numerous wildfires were burning in Idaho in mid-August 2006.

title: Manam and Langila
caption: Manam and Langila erupted simultaneously in early August 2006.

title: Floods in Mexico, Texas, and New Mexico
caption: Heavy summer rain triggered flooding in northern Mexico, Texas, and New Mexico in July and August 2006.

title: Floods in Pakistan and India
caption: Seasonal monsoon rains falling over Pakistan and India triggered floods in July, August, and September 2006.

title: Flooding in Luzon, Philippines
caption: In mid-July, a combination of monsoon rains and downpours associated with a series of tropical storms and typhoons left the Philippine Island Luzon soggy.  Floods affected the low-lying center of the island from Manila to Dagupan.

title: Snow in Lesotho and South Africa
caption: Unusually cold temperatures and snow marked the first week of August 2006 in South Africa.

title: Saharan Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm blew from Algeria southward over Mali and Niger in early August 2006.

title: Typhoon Maria
caption: Typhoon Maria formed on August 5, building to tropical storm strength and earning a name during the next day.  By early August 7, the storm became powerful enough to be upgraded again to the status of typhoon.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Southern India
caption: Three days of torrential monsoon rain triggered floods across much of India during the first week of August 2006.

title: Fires in Spain and Portugal
caption: Hot and dry conditions settling in across the Iberian Peninsula fanned devastating wildfires in Spain and Portugal in early August 2006.

title: Typhoon Saomai
caption: Typhoon Saomai formed in the western Pacific on August 4, 2006, as a tropical depression.  The storm gathered strength and struck southeast China  as a typhoon on August 10.

title: Fires in Mozambique
caption: Scores of agricultural fires were burning in Mozambique on August 4, 2006, sending smoke eastward over the Mozambique Channel.

title: Fires in Northern Territory, Australia
caption: At the end of August 2006, late dry-season fires were burning in Arnhem Land in Australia's Northern Territory and across the Kimberley Plateau in Western Australia.

title: Haze over the Eastern United States
caption: Air quality dropped when a heat wave trapped pollution over many cities along the east coast of the United States in early August 2006.

title: Typhoon Prapiroon
caption: Typhoon Prapiroon formed in the eastern Pacific on July 31, 2006, off the coast of Luzon, the northernmost of the Philippine Islands.

title: Dust Storm near Laguna Mar Chiquita
caption: Two tendrils of dust blew northward from Laguna Mar Chiquita in Argentina on July 27, 2006. The dust likely came from lakebed sediments around the margins of the lagoon.

title: Tropical Storm Chris
caption: Tropical Storm Chris in the Western Atlantic skirted along the northern edge of the Leeward Islands on August 1, 2006.

title: Heat Wave in Western Europe
caption: July brought sweltering heat to much of Western Europe in 2006.

title: Heat Wave in North America
caption: Scorching temperatures swept across much of the United States during July 2006.

title: Fires in Northern California
caption: In August and September 2006, firefighters in northern California had their hands full with numerous blazes that threatened residences, communications infrastructure, old growth forest, wildlife habitat, and cultural resources. This image from September 26 shows the Uncles Complex and Bar Complex Fires.

title: Carbon Monoxide over Eastern Russia
caption: A wave of forest fires in Siberia filled the skies over Russia with carbon monoxide in mid-July 2006.

title: Ice in the Beaufort Sea
caption: Though ice is not uncommon along the northern shores of Alaska and Canada, the Beaufort Sea remained frozen almost to the shore by late July 2006.

title: Fires in the Western United States
caption: Since late July 2006, firefighters have been working to contain numerous wildfires in several Western states. This image from September 12, 2006, shows multiple large fires in Washington, Oregon, and Idaho.

title: Typhoon Kaemi
caption: Typhoon Kaemi tracked northwest across the Philippine Sea before striking Taiwan and China on July 24 and July 25, 2006.

title: Taklimakan Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm struck the Taklimakan Desert in western China in late July 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Emilia
caption: The fifth named storm to form in the eastern Pacific Ocean in 2006, Tropical Storm Emilia skirted the coast of Mexico as it traveled northwest during the last week of July.

title: Fires in Northern Washington
caption: In the first week of September 2006, five large fires were burning in northern Washington: the Tripod Complex, the Tatoosh Complex, the Cedar Creek Fire, the Flick Creek Fire, and the Tinpan Fire. This image from September 7 shows active fires and thick smoke over the area.

title: Dust Plume off the West Coast of Africa
caption: A dust plume blew of the west coast of Africa on July 23, 2006.

title: Sicily’s Mount Etna
caption: Sicily's Mount Etna showed signs of unrest in July and August 2006.

title: Dust Storm over the Cape Verde Islands
caption: A plume of dust blew off the western coast of Africa on July 19, 2006, and headed toward the Cape Verde Islands.

title: Hurricane Daniel
caption: Hurricane Daniel formed on July 16, 2006, off the Mexican Pacific coast.

title: Tropical Storm Beryl
caption: Tropical Storm Beryl formed in the northwestern Atlantic on July 18, 2006, roughly 200 kilometers (120 miles) southeast of the Outer Banks.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: A thin cloud of dust blew over the Arabian Sea in mid July 2006.

title: Flooding in Chile
caption: Heavy rain triggered floods and landslides across a broad swath of south-central Chile from July 11 to July 13, 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Bilis
caption: Although the center of Tropical Storm Bilis (known as Florita in the Philippines) passed well to the north of Luzon, it has been blamed for at least 14 fatalities on the island as a result of flash floods, mudslides, and wind damage.

title: Wildfires in Montana and Wyoming
caption: In southeastern Montana and northern Wyoming, the winds were whipping eastward and spreading several large wildfires in mid-July 2006. The most recent image shows fires in northern Montana.

title: Hurricane Bud
caption: Hurricane Bud formed in the eastern Pacific on July 10, 2006 off the Pacific coast of Mexico.

title: Hurricane Carlotta
caption: Hurricane Carlotta formed in the eastern Pacific on July 11, 2006 off the Pacific coast of Mexico.

title: Fires in California
caption: Several large fires were burning in California in mid-July 2006. This event contains images of the Sawtooth, Millard, and Canyon Fires.

title: Suncook River Shifts Course
caption: The Suncook River near Epsom, New Hampshire, shifted into a new channel after floods in mid-May 2006.

title: Fires North of Russia’s Lake Baikal
caption: North of Lake Baikal in south-central Russia, scores of fires were burning in the area's forests in mid-July 2006.

title: Bear Fire in New Mexico
caption: Nearly two weeks after it started, the Bear Fire had burned 51,307 acres of mixed conifer forest in western New Mexico’s Gila National Forest by July 3, 2006.

title: Carbon Monoxide from Canadian Fires
caption: Canadian fires generated carbon monoxide that lingered in the air over Canada in late June and early July 2006.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Cambodia
caption: The onset of summer brought torrential monsoon rains and floods to Cambodia in July 2006.

title: Stromboli Volcano
caption: Stromboli Volcano showed signs of activity in early July 2006.

title: Fires in Canada’s Yukon Territory
caption: Lightning triggered several fires in southeast Yukon Territory, Canada, over the first weekend of July 2006.

title: Typhoon Ewiniar
caption: Typhoon Ewiniar formed in the western Pacific on June 29, 2006, a hundred miles south of the Yap Islands in the Federated States of Micronesia.

title: Drought in Australia
caption: A dry summer and fall delayed planting in some of Australia's major winter grain regions.

title: Fires in Central Canada
caption: Numerous large and smoky fires were burning in central Canada in late June and early July 2006.

title: Heavy Rain in the Mid-Atlantic States
caption: From June 23 to June 26, heavy downpours pounded the Mid-Atlantic region of the United States, including the nation's capital, Washington, D.C.  Coastal waters were brown with sediment after the event.

title: Tungurahua Volcano in Ecuador
caption: Tungurahua Volcano in Ecuador began emitting a volcanic plume of ash and/or steam in late June 2006. The volcano erupted seriously in August, destroying three villages. This new image shows an eruption in December.

title: Phytoplankton off Vancouver Island
caption: The waters of the Pacific Ocean were colored with the picturesque swirls of a phytoplankton bloom in late June 2006.

title: Floods in Indonesia
caption: Heavy rain triggered floods and landslides on the island of Sulawesi in Central Indonesia in June 2006.

title: Bear Fire in Western New Mexico
caption: A large wildfire was burning in western New Mexico’s Gila National Forest in June 2006.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: Thick plumes of dust blew off the east coast of Sudan, over the Red Sea, in June, July, and August 2006.

title: Floods in Bangladesh
caption: Seasonal flooding swept across northeastern Bangladesh as monsoon rains pounded the country in June 2006.

title: Floods in Myanmar
caption: Monsoon rains swelled the Ayeyarwady River of Myanmar (Burma) during the summer and fall of 2006.

title: Thunderstorms in Texas
caption: Torrential rainfall in southeast Texas and southwestern Louisiana on June 19, 2006, caused extensive flooding.

title: Perkins Fire, Southern California
caption: A large wildfire was burning in brush and grass along the eastern foothills of the Sierra Madre Mountains of California on June 20, 2006.

title: Mato Vega Fire, Colorado
caption: The Mato Vega Fire was racing through the Sangre de Cristo Mountains of southern Colorado in mid-June 2006.

title: Warm Fire in Northern Arizona
caption: Between the Grand Canyon and the Utah-Arizona state line, the Warm Fire was burning in the forests of the Kaibab Plateau in mid-June 2006.

title: Brins Fire Near Sedona, AZ
caption: In mid-June 2006, the Brins Fire was burning rapidly in Coconino National Forest and threatening homes near Sedona, Arizona.

title: Ash Plume from Karymsky
caption: After a week of intermittent eruptions, Karymsky Volcano in northeast Russia emitted an ash plume on June 19, 2006.

title: Dust storm in the Indus Valley
caption: A large dust storm blew from Pakistan into India on June 12, 2006.

title: Winter Storm in New Zealand
caption: On June 12,2006, a powerful winter storm blanketed New Zealand's South Island with heavy snow.

title: Dust Storm over the Aral Sea
caption: A dust storm blew over the Aral Sea on June 13, 2006. Another dust storm struck the area on September 1, 2006.

title: Dust Storm in Chad
caption: A dust storm, likely from the Bodele Depression, blew through part of eastern Chad on June 11, 2006.

title: Navajo Mountain Fire
caption: In mid-June 2006, a fire churned out a large column of smoke on Navajo Mountain in southern Utah.

title: Fires in Eastern China
caption: Scores of active fires were burning in the southern Shandong, Anhui, and Jiangsu provinces of eastern China on June 11, 2006.

title: Fires in the U.S. Southwest
caption: Several fires were burning in the U.S. Southwest in mid-June 2006.

title: Haze off the U.S. East Coast
caption: Haze blew off the East Coast of the United States in early June 2006. The haze may have resulted from a combination of smoke and pollution.

title: Parks Highway Fire
caption: In June 2006, the Parks Highway Fire threatened the historic settlement and native Athabascan village of Nenana, Alaska.

title: Tropical Storm Alberto
caption: Tropical Storm Alberto formed as a tropical depression early in the morning on June 10, 2006, in the Yucatan Channel.

title: Heavy Rain in Southeastern China
caption: Typhoon Chanchu and monsoon rains inundated southeastern China with heavy rain throughout May and early June 2006. The rain triggered floods and mudslides.

title: Dust over the Red Sea
caption: A dust storm blew across the Red Sea on June 9, 2006.

title: Alaska’s Spring Thaw
caption: The Yukon River bulged with spring runoff as winter faded away.

title: Fires and Haze in Eastern China
caption: Thick streaks of haze clouded the skies over Eastern China on June 4, 2006.

title: Saharan Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm originating in Mali blew off the west coast of Africa and over the Atlantic.

title: Magnitude 6.3 quake in central Java
caption: A magnitude 6.3 quake struck central Java near the town of Yogyakarta on May 27, 2006.

title: Volcanic Activity on Mount Karthala
caption: Mount Karthala emitted a volcanic plume in late May 2006.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Ireland
caption: Brilliant swirls of blue and green in the Atlantic Ocean off Ireland reveal the presence of a large phytoplankton bloom.

title: Fire in Portugal
caption: A smoky fire was burning on the coast of Portugal on June 5, 2006.

title: Monsoon Floods in India
caption: The annual monsoon floods swept across India beginning in June 2006 after the summer monsoon got an early start.

title: Negeethluk River Fire
caption: Started by lightning at the end of May, the Negeethluk River Fire had grown to about 2,500 acres as of June 5, 2006.

title: Fires in Northern Territory, Australia
caption: Early dry-season fires were burning across the tropical savannas of Australia's Northern Territory in early June 2006.

title: Anatahan Island
caption: The Anatahan Volcano in the central Mariana Islands emitted a volcanic plume in late May 2006. Its activity continued in late June 2006.

title: Phytoplankton Blooms in the Black Sea
caption: These images of the Black Sea show swirling blooms of phytoplankton coloring the surface waters blue and green.

title: Fires in Central and Southern Africa
caption: Widespread fires throughout Angola and Democratic Republic of Congo from late May through July 2006 indicate that the annual burning season is underway. The most recent image shows burned areas on July 30.

title: Dust Storm over the Gobi Desert
caption: A dust storm swept over the Gobi Desert in late May 2006.

title: Tropical Storm Aletta
caption: Tropical Storm Aletta formed off the Pacific coast of southern Mexico on May 27, 2006, as a tropical depression. It gained a little strength over the next day, eventually building to tropical storm status, with sustained winds of around 62 kilometers per hour (39 miles per hour).

title: Floods in Southeast Texas
caption: Heavy rain triggered flash floods in southeastern Texas counties between Houston and the Louisiana border.

title: Volcanic Activity on Semeru
caption: Semeru Volcano on the island of Java showed signs of unrest in late May 2006, days after an earthquake struck the island. Its activity continued through the summer of 2006.

title: Fires Near Lake Baikal
caption: Dozens of fires burned in the Irkutsk region to the northwest of Russia's Lake Baikal on May 26, 2006.

title: Floods in Thailand
caption: Heavy rains triggered deadly flash floods in five provinces of northern Thailand in May 2006.

title: Volcanic Activity on Ulawun
caption: Ulawun emitted a plume on May 25, 2006. Emissions continued for several days.

title: Ash Plume from Cleveland Volcano
caption: The Cleveland Volcano in the Aleutian Islands emitted a plume of volcanic ash on May 23, 2006.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan Desert
caption: Tendrils of dust moved over the Taklimakan Desert in late May 2006.

title: Dust Plumes in Kazakstan
caption: Dust plumes moved through Kazakstan (Kazakhstan) in late May 2006.

title: Drought in Northern China
caption: A mild drought set in over the Yellow River Basin and parts of the North China Plain during the first five months of 2006.

title: Dust Storm over Pakistan
caption: A series of dust storms swept through Pakistan beginning in mid-May 2006.

title: Flooding in Northern Colombia
caption: After four months of heavy rain, Colombia was fighting widespread flooding in early May 2006.

title: Dust Blowing off the Coast of Pakistan
caption: Dust and haze blew off the coast of Pakistan in May 2006, in the wake of a severe heat wave in Pakistan and India. Another dust storm blew off the coast in early June.

title: Fires in Southern Siberia
caption: Numerous fires were burning in southern Siberia in early and mid-May 2006. Fires were scattered across the southern plains in the Tyumensk, Omsk, and Novosibirsk regions.

title: Typhoon Chanchu
caption: Tropical Storm Chanchu formed in the western Pacific on May 8, 2006, roughly 500 miles east of the Philippines.  The storm has been gradually building strength and size, and was upgraded to typhoon status late on May 10.

title: Saharan Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm swept across the Sahara Desert in early May 2006.

title: Eruption of the Bezymianny Volcano
caption: The Bezymianny Volcano experienced an explosive eruption in early May 2006, sending an ash plume toward the Aleutian Islands.

title: Manam, Papau New Guinea
caption: A plume of ash rose from the summit of the Manam Volcano in Papua New Guinea on May 9, 2006. Another plume followed in late May. The volcano acted up intermittently during the summer, releasing another plume in late August.

title: Mount Ubinas, Peru
caption: Ash and volcanic gas rose from the Ubinas Volcano in Southern Peru in late April and early May 2006, prompting evacuations. The volcano emitted more plumes in June, July, and August.

title: Flooding in Southern Siberia
caption: Rivers throughout Southern Siberia and Central Asia bulged with melting snow as the region began to thaw in early May 2006.

title: Fires in Russia and China near the Amur River
caption: Huge fires were burning north and south of the Amur River on May 30, 2006.

title: Fires in Cuba
caption: Several large fires burned in Western Cuba in early May 2006.

title: Fires in Florida
caption: A number of wildfires were burning throughout Florida in early May 2006.

title: Flooding in Eastern Africa
caption: Wet season rains triggered floods throughout Eastern Africa in April and May 2006.

title: Marcial Fire in New Mexico
caption: A large fire was burning near the Bosque del Apache National Wildlife Refuge along the Rio Grande in southwestern New Mexico on May 4, 2006.

title: Seasonal Floods in Queensland, Australia
caption: The Channel Country of southwestern Queensland, Australia becomes a web of rivers after summer rains drench the highland to the north. By early May 2006, the region was a web of water-filled rivers.

title: Fires in Guinea
caption: On May 1, 2006, scores of fires were burning in the West African country of Guinea.

title: Flooding in Northern Peru
caption: MODIS detected pools of water in the desert of Northern Peru in late April 2006 as the rainy season drew to a close.

title: Floods in Myanmar (Burma)
caption: Cyclone Mala pounded Myanmar (Burma) with heavy rain when it came ashore on April 28, 2006. The storm left widespread flooding in its wake.

title: Smoke Over Northern Europe and the Atlantic
caption: A river of smoke from fires in western Russia hung over the northern oceans and Northern Europe in early May 2006.

title: Mount Merapi
caption: Mount Merapi was gearing up for an eruption in late April 2006. It erupted in early May, sending searing gas down its slopes. The volcano followed this eruption with more emissions of steam and ash in the summer of 2006.

title: Ash Plume at the Bulusan Volcano
caption: On April 19, 2006, MODIS observed a light plume of ash trailing west from the Bulusan volcano in the Philippines.

title: Fires in Southwestern Australia
caption: Numerous fires were burning in the southwest corner of Western Australia in early May 2006.

title: Flooding in Iceland
caption: Floods on the Skafta River of southern Iceland swept a thick cloud of sediment into the ocean in late April 2006.

title: Fires in Southern Mexico
caption: In southern Mexico, numerous fires were filling the skies over the Sierra Madre del Sur range with smoke on May 14, 2006.

title: Fires in Tasmania
caption: Numerous fires were burning on Tasmania on April 26, 2006.

title: Spring Fires in Western Russia
caption: Spring fires dotted the landscape of western Russia in late April and early May 2006.

title: Cyclone Mala
caption: Tropical Cyclone Mala formed in the Bay of Bengal on April 24, 2006.

title: Large Fires in Mongolia
caption: Large fires were raging in the foothills of the mountains at the border of Russia and Mongolia in late April and early May 2006.

title: Spring Snow in the Dakotas
caption: In late April 2006, a spring snow storm hammered the northern Plains of the midwestern United States.

title: Fires in the Yucatan and Central America
caption: Numerous fires were burning across the Yucatan Peninsula and northern Central America in April and May 2006.

title: Dust over the Persian Gulf
caption: Dust blew out of Saudi Arabia and over the Persian Gulf on April 19, 2006.

title: Fires in Southeastern Australia
caption: Scores of fires were actively burning in southeastern Australia in late April 2006.

title: Fires in Victoria, Australia
caption: In the forested mountains of Victoria's Gippsland region, several fires were burning on April 19, 2006.

title: Tornadoes in the Southern United States
caption: On April 7 and 8, 2006, severe weather and tornadoes swept through southern states, with the most damage and twisters recorded in Alabama, Tennesse and Georgia.

title: Dust Over Japan
caption: Dust from the Gobi Desert blanketed Japan in mid-April 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Monica
caption: Tropical Cyclone Monica formed off the northeastern coast of Australia on April 17, 2006.  This is the same general area where Cyclone Larry formed a month earlier.

title: Fires in Arkansas’ Boston Mountains
caption: Two smoky fires were burning in northwestern Arkansas on April 13, 2006.

title: Floods in Central California
caption: Above-average rainfall drenched Central California in March and April 2006, filling rivers and reservoirs to the brim.

title: Flooding on the Zambezi River
caption: Seasonal rains in the southern tropics of Africa regularly swell the Zambezi River in Angola and Namibia.

title: Gobi Dust Storm
caption: A large dust storm whipped out of the Gobi Desert on April 10, 2006.

title: Floods in Northern Australia
caption: Monsoon rains and Cyclone Monica triggered widespread flooding in Australia's Northern Territory in  April 2006.

title: Dust Storm over Korea
caption: Dust blew over the Korean Peninisula toward the Sea of Japan in early April 2006.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: Dust from India, Pakistan, and Afghanistan mixed over the Arabian Sea in early April 2006.

title: Texas Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm struck north central Texas on April 6, 2006.

title: Magnitude 6.1 Earthquake, Silakhor, Iran
caption: Just before dawn on March 31, 2006, a strong earthquake struck near Silakhor, Iran. The magnitude 6.1 earthquake killed at least 66 people, injured at least 1280, and damaged buildings in 330 villages surrounding the epicenter.

title: Fires in Texas Panhandle
caption: On April 6, 2006, high winds drove the spread of several large wildfires across the northern panhandle of Texas, including the Cheyenne Fire at the border of Texas and Oklahoma.

title: Fires in the Great Plains
caption: In the Great Plains in mid-April 2006, numerous fires were burning when NASA's Terra satellite passed overhead.

title: Tropical Cyclone Hubert
caption: Tropical Cyclone Hubert formed off the northwestern coast of Australia on April 5, 2006.

title: Flooding on the Red River
caption: Major floods swept along the Red River of North Dakota, Minnesota, and Manitoba when spring rains and melting snow pushed the river over its banks in April 2006.

title: Barren Island Volcano
caption: The Barren Island Volcano sent a plume of volcanic ash and steam over the Andaman Sea on April 5, 2006.

title: Fires in the Yucatan and Central America
caption: Numerous fires dotted Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula and Central America in April 2006.

title: Floods in Central Europe
caption: Heavy rain and melting snow drove rivers across Central Europe over their banks in early April 2006.

title: Grassfire in Iceland
caption: In western Iceland in late March 2006, a large fire broke out in the dried grasses of a wetland area.

title: Total Solar Eclipse over Africa and the Mediterranean
caption: A total solar eclipse swept across Africa and the eastern Mediterranean Sea on March 29, 2006.

title: Hazy Skies over Southeast Asia and Southern China
caption: Dust and smoke mingled in the skies over Southeast Asia and eastern China in late March 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Glenda
caption: Tropical Cyclone Glenda formed off the northeastern coast of Australia on March 27, 2006.  The storm quickly built into a powerful and well-defined cyclone during the next day.

title: Blizzard in Wyoming
caption: A spring blizzard in Wyoming brought near-zero visibility to Interstate 80, causing a 20-car pile-up that killed six people.

title: Flooding in North Texas
caption: Heavy rain in north Texas forced some Dallas residents from their homes in late March 2006.

title: Flooding in Queensland
caption: Widespread flooding inundated parts of Queensland after Tropical Cyclone Larry brought heavy rains to the area in March 2006.

title: Ash Plume from Ulawun
caption: The Ulawun Volcano on New Britian in Papau New Guinea released a plume of volcanic ash in March 2006.

title: Snowstorm in the American Midwest
caption: The start of spring 2006 came with a taste of winter weather for the U.S. Midwest as heavy snow blanketed states from Colorado to Indiana, with accumulations as much as 60 centimeters (24 inches) in some locations.

title: Tropical Cyclone Floyd
caption: Tropical Cyclone Floyd formed in the Timor Sea between Indonesia and Australia on March 21, 2006.

title: Heavy Rains in Hawaii
caption: Persistent rains through February and March 2006 led to floods and the failure of a dam on the Hawaiian Island of Kauai.

title: Floods in Southeastern Europe
caption: Melting snow and rain combined to inundate Romania, Bulgaria, Greece, and Turkey in March 2006.

title: Fires in Western Africa
caption: In western Africa, Sierra Leone is deep into its dry season, which typically runs from December through March. Numerous agricultural fires were burning in the country on March 20, 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Wati
caption: Tropical Cyclone Wati formed northeast of New Caledonia on March 19, 2006.

title: Ash Plume from Anatahan
caption: The Anatahan Volcano sent a plume of ash westward over the Pacific in late March 2006.

title: Ash Plume from Karymsky
caption: The Karymsky Volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula continued to emit ash in March and April 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Larry
caption: Tropical Cyclone Larry struck Northeastern Queensland in Australia, causing widespread damage to buildings and crops in the area.

title: Fires in the Southeastern United States
caption: Dozens of fires were burning in the southeastern United States in March and April 2006, including fires in Georgia, Alabama, and Florida.

title: Smoke over Southern United States
caption: A thick cloud of aerosols, likely caused by smoke from fires in Texas and Oklahoma, hung over the southern United States in early March 2006.

title: Floods in Turkey
caption: Melting snow triggered floods in western Turkey in March 2006.

title: Snow in Arizona
caption: After four months without precipitation, a winter storm slammed Arizona on March 11, 2006, covering the parched land with widespread snow and record rain.

title: Drought in the Southern United States
caption: La Nina may be responsible for reduced rainfall and elevated fire hazard in the American South during the winter of 2005-06.

title: Snowstorm in Northern Europe
caption: Heavy snow fell in northern Europe in mid-March 2006.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Across several countries in southeast Asia,  hundreds, possibly thousands, of agricultural fires were burning in April 2006.

title: Dust Storm over Eastern China
caption: Numerous dust storms whipped across China in the spring of 2006. The latest image shows dust and haze over northeastern China in early May.

title: Dust Storm off West Africa
caption: Dust storms swept off the west coast of Africa in March and April 2006.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Argentina
caption: Brilliant swirls of blue and green in the waters of the Atlantic Ocean off Argentina indicate that ocean surface plants were in full bloom in early March 2006.

title: Smog and Sand over Beijing
caption: Sandstorms and smog clouded the air over eastern China in March and April 2006.

title: Fires in the Southern United States
caption: Numerous fires were burning across the Southern Plains on March 26, 2006.

title: Floods in Western Australia
caption: Cyclone Emma drenched Western Australia on March 1, 2006, leaving widespread flooding in its wake.

title: Heavy Rains in Northern California
caption: A powerful storm system brought high winds and heavy downpours to parts of central and northern California, causing localized flooding and knocking out power in the San Francisco Bay area.

title: Fires Southeast of Cape Leeuwin, Australia
caption: In late February 2006, lightning sparked fires in the far southwestern corner of Western Australia.

title: Tropical Cyclone Emma
caption: Tropical Cyclone came ashore in Western Australia on February 27, 2006, bringing substantial rain to the Pilbara region.

title: Flooding in Namibia
caption: Heavy rains triggered devastating floods in the Hardap region of Namibia on February 25, 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Carina
caption: Tropical Cyclone Carina formed in the center of the Indian Ocean on February 23, 2006.

title: Fires in South Asia
caption: Hundreds of fires were burning in northeastern India and Myanmar in late February and early March 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kate
caption: Tropical Cyclone Kate formed off Australia's Queensland coast in late February 2006.

title: Dust Storm in Northern Africa
caption: A dust storm swept over Algeria, Tunisia, Libya, and the Mediterranean in late February 2006.

title: Landslide in the Philippines
caption: Days of heavy rain triggered a devasting landslide in the southern Philippines on February 17, 2006.

title: Flooding in Southern Algeria
caption: Torrential rains flooded the western Sahara Desert in mid-February 2006.

title: February Fire in Arizona
caption: North of Payson, Arizona, an early-season fire broke out in the rugged terrain along the Mogollon Rim in the Tonto National Forest on February 6, 2006. The fire eventually burned about 4,243 acres (about 17 square kilometers).

title: Dust Storm  in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: A series of dust storms moved westward over the Taklimakan Desert between February and April 2006.

title: Dust Storm in the Tengger Desert
caption: A dust storm swept through the Tengger Desert on February 12, 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Vaianu
caption: Tropical Cyclone Vaianu brought strong winds and rains to the southern Tonga Islands in mid-February 2006.  The storm passed through the mid-Pacific before moving south beyond the islands.

title: Flooding in the Southern Philippines
caption: In mid-February, heavy rains triggered floods in Mindanao Island in the southern Philippines.

title: Tehuano Winds Stir the Pacific Ocean
caption: Powerful winds blowing as high as 40 miles per hour whipped through the mountains of southern Mexico and out over the Pacific in mid-February 2006. The winds cooled the ocean's surface and drove upwelling that let the ocean bloom.

title: Record Snow on the U.S. East Coast
caption: A classic nor'easter blew across the East Coast of the United States on February 11 and 12, 2006, dumping heavy snow from Virginia to Massachusetts.

title: Dust Storm over Syria and Iraq
caption: A dust storm moved eastward through parts of Syria and Iraq in February 2006.

title: Eruption of Soufriere Hills Volcano
caption: Light plumes of ash drifted from the Soufriere Hills Volcano on the island of Montserrat throughout early 2006. The volcano erupted again in the spring, and continued erupting during the summer.

title: Floods in Northern Iraq
caption: The Tigris River and its tributaries overflowed in early February 2006 as the annual late winter and early spring floods hit northern Iraq.

title: Snow in East China
caption: A winter storm covered most of eastern China with snow on January 6, 2006.

title: Snow in Afghanistan
caption: A severe blizzard crippled northern Afghanistan on January 31, 2006.

title: Smog over Northern India
caption: Heavy smog collected at the base of the Himalaya Mountains in February 2006.

title: Fire East of Los Angeles
caption: The Sierra Fire left a charcoal-colored burn scar across the hills and valleys of the Cleveland National Forest southeast of Los Angeles, California, on February 12, 2006.

title: Flooding in Tanzania
caption: Rain falling in drought-stricken Tanzania triggered flooding in early February 2006.

title: Ice Surge in Barrow, Alaska
caption: Driven by strong winds and ocean currents, large blocks of sea ice crashed ashore in the town of Barrow, Alaska, on January 23 and 24, 2006.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Seasonal agricultural burning was underway in Southeast Asia in early February 2006.

title: Severe Storm over the Red Sea
caption: An Egyptian ferry with 1,300 passengers sank in the Red Sea as strong storm winds were sweeping through the area in early February 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Boloetse
caption: Tropical Storm Boloetse crossed Madagascar in late January 2006, bringing substantial rain to the island.  When the storm system reached the Mozambique Channel, it stalled and built enough power to reach cyclone (hurricane) strength.

title: Rare Snow in Tokyo
caption: A rare snowstorm blanketed Tokyo with more than 3 inches of snow on January 21, 2006.

title: Rainstorms in Central Australia
caption: A persistent low-pressure system over Central Australian brought heavy rains to the area in early February 2006.

title: Smog over the Bay of Bengal
caption: Haze has built up along the Himalaya Mountains and spread out across the Bay of Bengal in the first of February 2006.

title: Fires Near Cape Town
caption: In South Africa, southeast of Cape Town, wildfires were burning out of control in several locations on February 1, 2006.

title: Dust and Clouds over Mediterranean Sea
caption: Clouds and dust swirl around a probable zone of low atmospheric pressure just off the coast of Libya on January 31, 2006.

title: Snow in Turkey
caption: An Arctic freeze brought cold weather and snow to Turkey in late January 2006.

title: Floods in Bolivia
caption: A string of powerful rainstorms brought on widespread flooding throughout Bolivia from the final week of January through April 2006.

title: Thick Smog over China
caption: A thick plume of smog hung over China and the Yellow Sea in January 2006.

title: Extreme Cold in Eurasia
caption: Extreme cold struck Eurasia in January 2006, causing casualties from exposure, and spiking electricity consumption in Russia.

title: Flooding in the Northern Philippines
caption: Tropical Storm Agaton triggered extensive flooding on Luzon, the main island in the Philippines, in late January 2006.

title: Flooding in Guyana
caption: Heavy rain triggered floods along the coast of Guyana in late January 2006.

title: Tropical Cyclone Daryl
caption: In the final week of January 2006, Tropical Cyclone Daryl glanced off the Western Australia coast in the same area hit earlier by Cyclone Clare.

title: Cloud patterns in the Bering Sea
caption: Vortex wind patterns swirling over sea ice in the Bering Sea in mid-January 2006 have created stunning cloud street patterns.

title: Snow Storm across the Upper Midwest
caption: Major snowfalls in mid-January 2006 blanketed the northern states of the Midwest, from Iowa and Wisconsin across Michigan and east.

title: Snow Storm in Colorado
caption: A major storm dropped snow throughout most of Colorado on January 19, 2006.

title: Dust Storm off Egypt
caption: A dust storm swept off the coast of Egypt and over the Mediterranean in January 2006. Another storm followed in February 2006.

title: Dust Storm over Iraq
caption: A dust storm swept over Iraq toward the Persian Gulf in January 2006.

title: Fires in Western Australia
caption: A large blaze threatened the towns of Yarloop, Waroona, and Hamel, in Western Australia at the beginning of the third week of January 2006.

title: Fires in Victoria, Australia
caption: Bushfires raged in numerous locations in Victoria, Australia, in mid-January 2006.

title: Drought  in East Africa
caption: Widespread drought in eastern Africa in 2005-06 has withered the grass and other vegetation across the region, including northern Tanzaniaâ€™s famous Serengeti Plain.

title: Flooding in Western Australia
caption: Cyclone Clare caused little damage when it came ashore in early January, 2006, but as it travelled across Western Australia, rain from the storm system triggered widespread flooding.

title: Eruption on Augustine Island, Alaska
caption: In January 2006, Augustine Volcano erupted, sending a steam and ash plume eastward over the Gulf of Alaska. Eruptive activity continued for several weeks.

title: Tropical Cyclone Clare
caption: Tropical Cyclone Clare formed on January 8, 2006, in the eastern Indian Ocean off the coast of Australia, and then came ashore on the Western Australia coast near Broome.

title: Heavy Snows in Central Asia
caption: A strong snowstorm has dropped heavy snow throughout Central Asia, causing more problems for the region devastated by the Pakistan earthquake in October 2005.

title: Northern California Floods
caption: Northern California ushered in 2006 with a series of major storms that inundated the area and left many towns awash in water, mud, and debris. Satellite imagery from early January reveals obvious flooding.

title: Dust Storm in Texas
caption: The same hot, dry, windy conditions that allowed grassfires to rage throughout parts of Oklahoma and Texas at the end of 2005 kicked up dust at the beginning of the new year.

title: Floods in Malawi and Mozambique
caption: The annual rainy season settled in over southern Malawi and northern Mozambique in late December 2005. By early January 2006, the rains had pushed the Shire River over its banks.

title: Tropical Storm Zeta
caption: December 30, 2005, saw an unexpected addition to the year's weather events: Tropical Storm Zeta.  Zeta is the 27th named storm of 2005.

title: Heavy Rains in Pacific Northwest
caption: A series of fast-moving storms brought heavy rains, flooding, and mudslides to the Pacific coast of the United States in late December 2005.

title: Smog in Northern Italy
caption: Smog collected at the base of the Alps in northern Italy in late December 2005.

title: Smog and Fog in India
caption: Pollution and fog collected at the base of the Himalaya Mountains in late December 2005, disrupting air travel.

title: Fires in Southern United States
caption: Drought, high temperatures, and strong winds created severe fire danger in parts of the southern United States in late 2005 and early 2006.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Thailand and Malaysia
caption: The heavy monsoon rains of December 2005 triggered widespread flooding along the Malay Peninsula.

title: Dust Storm in North Africa
caption: A dust storm swept off the north coast of Africa in December 2005.

title: Fires in Sudan and Neighboring Countries
caption: Hundreds of fires were burning in eastern Africa south of the Sahara Desert in mid-December 2005.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula
caption: Dozens of fires were scattered across central and southern Cape York Peninsula in northeastern Australia on December 14, 2005.

title: Smog in Tehran
caption: Thick smog choked the Iranian capital in early December 2005.

title: Mount St. Helens
caption: A year after the volcano started rumbling, Mount St. Helens continues a quiet eruption, steadily building a bulging dome in its crater.

title: Augustine Island Volcano, Alaska
caption: Augustine Volcano in Alaska released a plume of volcanic gas and steam on December 12, 2005.

title: Petrol Depot Fire in the United Kingdom
caption: An explosion at a petrol depot in southern England sent thick black clouds of smoke billowing over London on December 11, 2005.

title: Earthquake in Eastern Africa
caption: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake rattled Eastern Africa on December 5, 2005. The earthquake was centered in the Great Rift Valley between Tanzania and the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Floods in Albania
caption: Heavy rains triggered floods across Albania on December 2, 2005.

title: Food Shortages in Southeast Africa
caption: By December 2005, several southeastern African nations, including Malawi, Zambia, and Zibabwe, were facing food shortages. The shortages developed out of a drought in February 2005.

title: Range Fire in New Mexico
caption: In eastern New Mexico, a large range fire broke out on November 30, 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Epsilon
caption: The TRMM satellite captured Tropical Storm Epsilon as it formed in the Atlantic on November 29, 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Delta
caption: Delta, the 25th named storm of the 2005 hurricane season, wound across the eastern Atlantic between November 23 and November 28, 2005.

title: Tropical Cyclone Baaz Approaches India
caption: On November 29, 2005, a tropical cyclone brewed in the Bay of Bengal off the southern coast of India near the island of Sri Lanka.

title: First Blizzard of the Season in the U.S. Midwest
caption: Heavy snow halted holiday travel in the midwestern United States in late November 2005.

title: Fire Season in Northern Africa
caption: South of the Sahara, the annual fire season was underway in northern Africa in late fall 2005.

title: Dust Storm in Texas
caption: A cold front that brought snow and ice to the Midwest also brought wind and dust to Texas in November 2005.

title: Fires in Northern Mexico
caption: Strong Santa Ana winds fueled wildfires in northern Mexico in late November 2005.

title: Fire Near Ventura, California
caption: On Friday afternoon, November 18, 2005, a fire started in a remote area in the mountains surrounding Ventura, California.

title: Deadly Tornado Rips Across Indiana and Kentucky
caption: In the early morning hours of November 6, 2005, while most residents were sleeping, a large tornado tore across 66 kilometers (40 miles) of Indiana and Kentucky, killing 23. This Landsat image shows the tornado's track near Evansville, Indiana.

title: Typhoon Bolaven
caption: Typhoon Bolaven spun its way towards the Philippines between November 13 and November 19, 2005.

title: B-15A Iceberg Breaks
caption: Within a few days in late October 2005, several large pieces broke from the B-15A iceberg, the largest remnant of one of the largest icebergs ever oberved.

title: Dust Storm over the Yellow Sea
caption: A dust storm from China blew over the Yellow Sea in early November 2005.

title: Smog over Beijing, China
caption: Thick smog hung over Beijing, China, in early November 2005. Weather conditions worsened the concentration of pollutants.

title: Dust Storm off Alaska
caption: A storm of glacial silt blew off the coast of Alaska in early November 2005.

title: Smoke over the Sea of Okhotsk
caption: Smoke from fires in the Russian Far East blows across the Sea of Okhotsk on October 31, 2005.

title: Tropical Cyclone 04B-05
caption: Near the end of October 2005, Tropical Cyclone 04B-05 formed in the Indian Ocean and came ashore onto the Indian mainland, bringing heavy rains and high winds.

title: Mount Etna Erupts
caption: Mount Etna erupted in late October 2005. Siesmic aftershocks followed the eruption.

title: Floods in Southern India
caption: Heavy rains filled rivers and reservoirs across southern India in late 2005, resulting in deadly  floods.

title: Typhoon Kai-Tak
caption: Typhoon Kai-Tak formed on October 29, 2005, in the South China Sea and rapidly built strength before threatening the mainland of Indochina.

title: Hurricane Beta
caption: Hurricane Beta became the record-setting 23rd storm of the 2005 Atlantic Hurricane season when it formed as a tropical depression on October 26, 2005.

title: Santa Maria Erupts
caption: The Santa Maria Volcano in Guatemala erupted in late October 2005.

title: Hurricane Wilma Floods Florida
caption: When Hurricane Wilma cut across southern Florida on October 24, 2005, it unleashed heavy rain, causing widespread flooding.

title: Hurricane Wilma Colors the Caribbean
caption: Hurricane Wilma churned the waters off the coast of Nicaragua and Honduras, turning them a brilliant blue with sediment.

title: Tropical Storm Alpha
caption: Tropical Storm Alpha became the 22nd named storm of the 2005 hurricane season, making this the most active hurricane season ever recorded

title: Sierra Negra Erupts
caption: The Sierra Negra Volcano in the Galapagos Islands began erupting on October 22, 2005.

title: Dust Storm over Chad
caption: A dust storm formed over Chad on October 16, 2005, and persisted throughout the day.

title: Fires in the Southern United States
caption: Dozens of fires were burning across the South in mid-October 2005.

title: Mount Belinda Erupts
caption: Mount Belinda is a volcano on Montagu Island in the remote South Sandwich Islands in the South Atlantic.

title: Stressed Crops in Ukraine and Russia
caption: Drought stressed major agricultural areas in the southeastern corner of the Russian Federation and throughout Ukraine.

title: Hurricane Wilma
caption: Hurricane Wilma formed in the Carribean as a tropical depression on October 15, 2005, becoming the 21st named storm of the 2005 hurricane season, the most active on record save for 1933, which also had 21 named storms.

title: Typhoon Kirogi
caption: Typhoon Kirogi formed in the northwestern Pacific in early October 2005.

title: Heavy Rain in the Northeastern United States
caption: Heavy rain drenched the northeastern United States throughout the second week of October 2005, triggering widespread flooding.

title: Floods in Bangladesh
caption: Northwest Bangladesh flooded when rivers throughout the region burst their banks in early October 2005.

title: Dust Storm in the United Arab Emirates
caption: A dust storm surprised residents of Al Ain (Al Ayn) on October 12, 2005, with poor visibility and high temperatures.

title: Fires in Northwestern India
caption: At the base of the Himalaya Mountains in northwestern India, the annual agricultural fire season was underway in October 2005.

title: Strong Earthquake in Northern Pakistan
caption: On October 8, 2005, a powerful earthquake measuring 7.6 on the Richter Scale rattled Pakistan, India, and Afghanistan. Two months later, lakes continued to fill behind landslide-created, natural dams.

title: Eruption of Santa Ana (Ilamatepec) Volcano
caption: On October 1, 2005, the Santa Ana (also known as the Ilamatepec) Volcano erupted, producing car-sized lava rocks, a boiling flood of mud and water, and a cloud of sulfur dioxide.

title: Fires in Russia’s Far East
caption: A river of smoke flowed eastward from a cluster of fires burning in Russia's Far East in October 2005.

title: Hurricane Stan Floods Central America
caption: Hurricane Stan inundated Central America with days of heavy rain during the first week of October 2005. The rains have triggered deadly floods and landslides through several countries.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula
caption: Across the Cape York Peninsula in northern Australia, several large fires were burning in early November 2005.

title: Hurricane Stan
caption: Stan formed off the coast of the Yucatan Peninsula and crossed over into the Gulf of Mexico, rebuilding strength before coming ashore in southern Mexico.

title: Fires Flare up in Portugal and Spain
caption: Scorching temperatures and hot winds were making the job of firefighters on the Iberian Peninsula extremely difficult in early October 2005.

title: Floods in Mauritania
caption: Heavy rains in late September 2005 left the Senegal River and its tributaries running over their banks.

title: Solar Eclipse over Africa
caption: The Moon cast its shadow over the Earth on October 3, 2005, leaving parts of Africa and Europe in darkness.

title: Topanga Fire
caption: Northwest of Los Angeles, California, a brush fire exploded in late September 2005. Growing to more than 16,000 acres in around 2 days, the blaze threatened homes, natural resources, power lines, and communications equipment in the Thousand Oaks region north of the Santa Monica Mountains.

title: Fires and Burn Scars Around Ural River
caption: Rust-colored burn scars are scattered across the plains of southern Russia and northwestern Kazakhstan on September 28, 2005.

title: Typhoon Longwang
caption: Typhoon Longwang formed in the northeastern Pacific Ocean near the Mariana Islands in late September 2005. It gathered strength as it moved west, eventually striking Taiwan and China.

title: Hurricane Rita Floods U.S. Gulf Coast
caption: Much of the southwestern and central Louisiana shoreline was under water after Hurricane Rita passed on September 24, 2005.

title: Typhoon Saola
caption: In late September 2005, Typhoon Saola built up strength north of the Mariana Islands and headed toward southern Japan. On September 23, forecasters were predicting that Saola would become a powerful storm that would graze the island of Honshu before heading out to the mid-Pacific.

title: Flooding in the Philippines
caption: Monsoon rains triggered flooding throughout the island of Luzon in the Philippines in mid-September 2005.

title: Floods in Vietnam
caption: Tropical Storm Vincente brought heavy rain and floods to northern Vietnam in late September 2005.

title: Typhoon Damrey
caption: Typhoon Damrey formed northeast of the Philippines on September 20 and gathered strength to become a typhoon on its way to Hong Kong, Hainan, and northern Vietnam.  It is the 18th typhoon to strike China in 2005.

title: Hurricane Kenneth
caption: Hurricane Kenneth is one of a series of eastern Pacific hurricanes to form in mid-September.  All of the storms are all heading away from land and are unlikely to directly influence weather on the mainland.

title: Hurricane Philippe
caption: Hurricane Philippe formed off the Brazilian Coast near the Lesser Antilles on September 17, 2005, and grew from a tropical depression into a Category 1 hurricane over the course of a day.

title: Hurricane Rita
caption: Rita is the 17th named storm of the 2005 Atlantic hurricane season and the second to reach Category 5 status on the five-point Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale.

title: Dust Storm off Egypt
caption: A dust storm blew off the northern coast of Egypt, along the Libyan border, in September 2005.

title: Hurricane Katrina Erodes the U.S. Gulf Coast
caption: Hurricane Katrina's powerful storm surge, battering waves, and strong winds reshaped the barrier islands along the Gulf Coast of the United States.

title: Typhoon Khanun
caption: Typhoon Khanun formed in the northwestern Pacific and struck China’s Zhejiang Province on September 11, 2005.

title: Dust Storm off West Africa
caption: A dust storm, several hundred kilometers across, swirled off the west coast of Africa and over the Atlantic on September 4, 2005.

title: Hurricane Ophelia
caption: Hurricane Ophelia moved slowly up the East Coast of the United States in early September 2005.

title: Fires in Borneo
caption: Amid patchy clouds, NASA's Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer detected dozens of fires burning on the island of Borneo in late summer and early fall 2005.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: In central South America in September and October 2005, smoke poured from hundreds of fires burning across parts of Brazil, Bolivia, Paraguay, and Argentina.

title: Smog over China
caption: A thick plume of smog hung over the region of Beijing, China, in early September 2005.

title: Hurricane Maria
caption: Hurricane Maria is moving north over the Atlantic Ocean well away from land.

title: Hurricane Nate
caption: Tropical Storm Nate has been slowly growing over the Atlantic Ocean southwest of Bermuda. It reached hurricane strength on September 7, 2005.

title: Super Typhoon Nabi
caption: Super Typhoon Nabi formed in the western Pacific near Guam at the end of August and slowly built up strength as it veered towards southern Japan and Korea.

title: Chance Fire, Nevada
caption: Started on August 28, 2005, the Chance Fire raced rapidly across sagebrush and juniper woodlands in northeastern Nevada.

title: Typhoon Talim
caption: Typhoon Talim was building strength in the western Pacific Ocean in late August as it bore down on Taiwan and mainland China.

title: Eruption on Barren Island
caption: Barren Island Volcano erupted on August 24, 2005, sending a plume of ash eastward over the Andaman Sea.

title: Hurricane Katrina Floods the Southeastern United States
caption: Hurricane Katrina devastated parts of Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and Florida with heavy rain and a powerful storm surge in August 2005.

title: Smoke from Alaskan Fires in Northwestern Canada
caption: Smoke from Alaskan wildfires swept across Canada's Northwest Territories on August 23, 2005.

title: Hurricane Katrina
caption: Hurricane Katrina exploded into a category 5 storm on August 28, 2005, as it moved north through the Gulf of Mexico towards the United States. It was one of the most powerful storms on record for the Atlantic Basin.

title: Hurricane Hilary
caption: Hilary is a Pacific hurricane which formed off the coast of Mexico and has been gradually moving farther offshore as it gains strength.  The storm is expected to lose strength in the coming days and is not projected to make landfall.

title: Typhoon Mawar
caption: Typhoon Mawar is a strong typhoon in the northwestern Pacific. The storm was predicted to make landfall on Honshu (the main island of Japan) on August 25, with Category 4 strength winds and heavy rainfall.

title: Rainy Season Floods in the Sahel
caption: The rainy season brings both fresh water and flooding to the Sahel region of Africa.

title: Fires in South America
caption: From the Amazon Rainforest of Brazil, to the Pantanal Wetlands, to the Gran Chanco plains of Paraguay and Argentina, hundreds of fires were burning across South America in August 2005.

title: East Australian Current
caption: The East Australian Current carries a stream of warm water from the Coral Sea into the cool waters of the Tasman Sea. It is the largest ocean current around Australia.

title: Dry-season Fires in Mozambique
caption: Fires in Mozambique increase in number, size, and intensity as the dry season progresses. In September 2005, scores of fires were burning in the central part of the country.

title: Dust Storm off Morocco
caption: A dust storm swept around the coast of Morocco on August 15, 2005.

title: Fires in the Northern Rockies
caption: In the Northern Rockies in late August and early September 2005, numerous fires burned across Montana and Idaho as a severe drought parched the forests of the Bitterroot Mountains.

title: Tropical Storm Sanvu
caption: Tropical Storm Sanvu swept ashore over China on August 13, 2005.

title: Hurricane Irene
caption: Irene became the third hurricane of the 2005 Atlantic hurricane season on August 14.

title: Air Quality Emergency in Malaysia
caption: In mid-August, several locations in mainland Malaysia declared air quality emergencies as smoke from burning in Indonesia wafted across the Strait of Malacca and blanketed the country with haze.

title: Phytoplankton and Hydrogen Sulfide off the Coast of Namibia
caption: Brilliant green colors in the waters of the South Atlantic off the coast of Namibia mark out a large bloom of ocean plants and a hydrogen sulfide eruption.

title: Fires around Lake Baikal, Russia
caption: Dozens of fires were filling the skies around Lake Baikal with thick smoke in mid-August 2005.

title: Haze Over the Midwestern United States
caption: Pollutants collected over the Great Lakes region on August 8, 2005.

title: Famine in Niger and Mali
caption: Drought and a locust infestation decimated crops in 2004, making food scarce in Niger and Mali.

title: School Fire in Washington
caption: In southeastern Washington in early August 2005, the School Fire was raging through the Umatilla National Forest about 16 miles south of the town of Pomery.

title: Burning on Madagascar
caption: Humans have been using seasonal fires to manage land in Madagascar for centuries. This image shows fires across the island on August 6, 2005.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: In central South America on August 2, 2005, hundreds of active fires were detected by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA's Aqua satellite.

title: Tropical Storm Harvey
caption: Tropical Storm Harvey formed in the Atlantic Ocean well offshore from the U.S. mainland in early August 2005.  It made a grazing pass by Bermuda and was heading north and east into the mid-Atlantic.

title: Fires in Central Russia
caption: Across the lowlands of the Central Siberian Plain in central Russia, dozens of large fires were filling the skies with thick, white smoke in the first part of August 2005.

title: Typhoon Matsa
caption: Typhoon Matsa began forming in the northwestern Pacific off the Philippines and is gradually forming into a full fledged typhoon as the storm system travels north into the Yellow Sea.

title: Dust Storm Over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: A thick plume of Saharan dust swept north over the Mediterranean Sea on July 28, 2005.

title: Haze Across Eastern United States
caption: Throughout the last week of July 2005, the Environmental Protection Agency has been issuing air quality warnings for the Midwest, the Southeast, and the Mid-Atlantic. This image shows haze over the Eastern seaboard on July 26, 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Banyan
caption: Tropical Storm Banyan formed in the Northern Mariana Islands on July 21, 2005, and has gradually developed into a substantial tropical storm while moving gradually towards Japan.

title: Fires Across Alaska
caption: By mid-August 2005, 584 fires had burned more than 3 million acres in Alaska. Air quality reached "very unhealthy" to "dangerous" levels as smoke pooled in the Interior.

title: Fires in Russia’s Southern Agricultural District
caption: Fires burning in Russia's Southern Agricultural District in late July 2005 are porbably related to the harvest of winter grains.

title: Heatwave in Northern Africa and Southern Europe
caption: Summer temperatures soared as the western Mediterrean settled into a heatwave in mid-July.

title: Typhoon Haitang Floods Taiwan
caption: A full week after powerful Typhoon Haitang struck the island, floods continue to plague southern Taiwan.

title: Heatwave in the United States
caption: A deadly heatwave settled over the United States  starting in mid-July of 2005.

title: Dust Storm in Iraq
caption: A massive dust storm in early August 2005 brought daily activities in Iraq to a standstill for a day.

title: Tire Fire in Wisconsin
caption: A fire broke out at a tire recycling facility in Wisconsin on July 19, 2005. Thick plumes of black smoke spread out over a wide area.

title: Dust Storm in Kazakhstan
