caption: A dust storm swept across an arid region in southern Kazakhstan on July 20, 2005.

title: Floods on the Songhua River in Northern China
caption: Summer rains have pushed the Songhua River and its tributaries over their banks.

title: Fires in the Southeast Amazon
caption: In the southeastern Amazon, biomass burning is transforming the landscape. Fires were burning along the margins of the forest and roads in July and August 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Eugene
caption: Tropical Storm Eugene forming off the Pacific Coast of Mexico.  It is not projected to become a powerful storm nor come ashore in any heavily populated areas.

title: Flooding in Romania
caption: The spring, summer, and early fall of 2005 brought widespread flooding to Romania and Bulgaria. A series of floods caused extensive damage and evacuations across both countries.

title: Fires in Northern Spain
caption: On July 17, 2005, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA’s Terra satellite captured a view of the forest fire (marked in red) in Spain that was responsible for the death of 11 firefighters.

title: Fires in Nevada and Idaho
caption: In northern Nevada and southern Idaho, several large fires were scorching sagebrush and grassland in mid-July 2005.

title: Dust blowing off Namibia
caption: In early July, a storm blew dust off the Namibian coast.

title: Super Typhoon Haitang
caption: Super Typhoon Haitang has been gradually building up strength in the northwest Pacific Ocean and is  now bearing down on Taiwan and China.

title: Fires on Both Rims of Grand Canyon
caption: Wildfires were burning on the north and south rims of the Grand Canyon in Arizona in mid-July, 2005.

title: Florida Fire South of Tucson, Arizona
caption: Lightning triggered a wildfire in the Coronado National Forest in southern Arizona that grew to more than 11,000 acres by July 13, 2005.

title: Hurricane Emily
caption: In mid-July, Tropical Storm Emily began building strength before heading into the Caribbean Sea.

title: Fires in Portugal
caption: Forest fires that plagued Portugal in July 2005 flared up again in August 2005. By late August, a national state of emergency was in effect for the central part of the country.

title: Mason Fire in Southern Colorado
caption: The Mason Fire in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains in southern Colorado was causing considerable concern for residents and firefighters in the state in early July 2005.

title: Ricco Fire in Black Hills National Forest
caption: The Ricco Fire in the Black Hills National Forest in South Dakota was threatening subdivisions, botanical preserves, and archeological sites in July 2005.

title: Summer Bloom in the Baltic Sea
caption: Dense swirls of blue-green algae covered the Baltic Sea in early July 2005.

title: Eruption of Soufriere Hills Volcano, Montserrat
caption: The Soufriere Hills Volcano, on the island of Montserrat, has been erupting since July 2005.

title: Forest Fires Across Central Siberian Plateau
caption: Since early July 2005, forest fires have been burning across the Central Siberian Plateau to the west of the city of Yakutsk.

title: Monsoon Flooding in India
caption: Monsoon rains pounded India from June through September 2005. The rains have triggered floods throughout the country.

title: Hurricane Dennis
caption: Hurricane Dennis grew into a major hurricane as it moved north through the Caribbean Sea in July 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Cindy
caption: Tropical Storm Cindy became the first tropical storm of 2005 to make landfall over the United States when it came ashore over southern Louisiana on July 5, 2005.

title: Floods in Southern China
caption: Heavy seasonal rains drenched southern China for much of June, resulting in severe flooding.

title: Fires on Sumatra
caption: Forest fires blazed near Sumatra's eastern shores, shrouding parts of Malaysia with a veil of haze.

title: Floods in Pakistan
caption: Both monsoon rains and quickly melting snow have pushed rivers across Pakistan over their banks.

title: Fires in the Southwest
caption: The first wave of the 2005 fire season began in late June when lightning triggered dozens of fires across the Southwest. New fires continued to spring up in July.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: A dust storm swept over the Red Sea on June 21, 2005.

title: Southern Asia Heat Wave
caption: High temperatures stifled much of southern Asia during June 2005 before monsoon rains brought relief.

title: Fires in Kazakhstan
caption: In central and southern Kazakhstan, summers are long, hot, and dry. Fire danger in the region's grasslands can be extreme. Fires broke out to the west of Lake Balkhash in mid-June 2005.

title: Earthquake in Northern Chile
caption: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake rattled northern Chile on June 13, 2005, leaving 11 dead and hundreds homeless.

title: Fires in Eastern China
caption: In eastern China in mid-June 2005, fires were burning in the northern part of Jiangsu province on the coast of the Yellow Sea.

title: Eruption of Langila Volcano, New Britain
caption: The Langila Volcano on the island of New Britain in Papua New Guinea, began erupting on June 2, 2005.

title: Drought in Australia Breaks
caption: The drought that has been plaguing farmers in Australia since 2002 finally began to break with the coming of rain in June 2005.

title: Tropical Storm Arlene
caption: Tropical Storm Arlene became the first tropical cyclone of the 2005 Atlantic hurricane season on June 8, 2005. The storm grew into a tropical storm on June 9 as it moved through the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Dust Storm in Pakistan and India
caption: A massive dust storm more than 1,000 kilometers wide stretched from Pakistan to India in early June 2005.

title: Summer Floods in China
caption: The summer monsoon brings heavy rains to southern China, often resulting in deadly floods. In 2005, the floods started on May 31, when rains triggered mudslides and floods throughout the country.

title: Dust Storm in Saudi Arabia
caption: An early June dust storm stretched from Saudi Arabia to Iraq and Kuwait.

title: Ulawun Erupts
caption: The Ulawun volcano of Papua New Guinea is one of the most active volcanoes in the island nation.

title: Typhoon Nesat
caption: Typhoon Nesat formed in the North Pacific Ocean on May 30, 2005, the fourth tropical cyclone to form in the region in 2005.

title: Fire on Kamchatka Peninsula
caption: In late May and early June, a large wildfire was burning on Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula, spreading smoke hundreds of kilometers to the south.

title: Fires in Quebec
caption: At the end of May 2005, lightning triggered scores of wildfires across the Canadian province of Quebec.

title: Dust Storm Off the Coast of Algeria
caption: A dust storm sweeps off the coast of Algeria in late May, spreading across the Mediterranean Sea and heading toward Spain.

title: Floods in Bangladesh
caption: Heavy pre-monsoon rains are sending flash floods across the hills of northeast Bangladesh.

title: Blizzard in southern Chile
caption: An early winter blizzard blanketed the Andes mountains with heavy snow on May 18, 2005.

title: Fires in Northern Territory, Australia
caption: In Northern Territory, April and May are months when people conduct planned burning in order to reduce underbrush and prevent more damaging fires later in the dry season.

title: Dust Storm Off the Coast of Western Africa
caption: A dust storm sweeps off the western coast of Africa toward the Cape Verde Islands.

title: Tropical Storm Adrian
caption: Highly unusual Tropical Storm Adrian became the first tropical storm of the 2005 Pacific hurricane season on May 17. Unlike most storms that form in the Pacific, Adrian moved east and struck Central America on May 19.

title: Fires in Mexico’s Sierra Madre del Sur
caption: In May 2005, scores of fires were burning along Mexico's Pacific Coast in the Sierra Madre del Sur.

title: Thunderstorms in the Central United States
caption: Springtime thunderstorms pounded across the Southern Great Plains of the United States on May 13 and May 14, 2005.

title: Fernandina Volcano, Galapagos Islands
caption: The most active volcano in the Galapagos Islands began a fresh eruption on May 13, 2005. The eruption sent ash 7 kilometers into the atmosphere.

title: Record Hot April in Australia
caption: April 2005 was the hottest April on record for almost the entire continent of Australia.

title: Fires in Southern Russia
caption: While southern Russia's high mountains were still covered by snow, in the plains below, agricultural burning was underway in early and mid-May 2005.

title: Springtime Floods in Southern Russia
caption: As the ice and snow of winter melt away, the rivers of Southern Russia are filling with water. The annual spring floods have swelled rivers across the region.

title: Fire Season in Central and Southern Africa
caption: Southern Africa's annual agricultural burning season got underway in May 2005 and was still going strongly in July. Fires speckled the landscape across Democratic Republic of Congo, Angola, Zambia, Mozambique, and Tanzania.

title: Fires in Guinea-Bissau
caption: Like many other locations across the world, agricultural fires in Guinea-Bissau and Guinea have a daily cycle, with little activity in the morning and increasing amounts in the afternoon.

title: Dust from Southwest Asia over Arabian Sea
caption: Spring dust storms that originate in the desert basins of rugged Southwest Asia often spread dust across the Arabian Sea.

title: China Dust over the Pacific
caption: Dust blowing out of China's Gobi Desert spread across Japan and the northern Pacific Ocean in early May 2005.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom Near Japan
caption: The waters to the south of Japan were alive with millions of microscopic ocean plants. The bloom colors the waters with brilliant swirls of blue and green.

title: Spring Color in the Bay of Biscay
caption: As cool ocean water rushes to the surface, brilliant blue and green swirls of phytoplankton float on the surface of the Bay of Biscay between France and Spain.

title: Fires and Smoke in North Korea
caption: Many fires, some of which were producing thick plumes of smoke, burned across North Korea in May 2005.

title: Massive Dust Cloud over Saudi Arabia
caption: A massive dust storm was washing over Saudi Arabia in early May 2005.

title: Dust storm in Taklimakan
caption: When winds stir the sands of western China's Taklimakan Desert, dust can spread around the globe as far as the French Alps. Dust blew over the desert basin a few times in 2005.

title: Floods in Ethiopia and Somalia
caption: Two days of intense rain flooded sections of Somalia and Ethiopia, pushing several rivers over their banks.

title: Drought in Brazil
caption: Severe drought is plaguing one of the most productive crop regions in Brazil.

title: Typhoon Sonca
caption: Typhoon Sonca briefly reached Category 4 status over the Pacific Ocean before it moved north and decayed. The storm never threatened land.

title: Smoke over Central America
caption: Fires burning across Central America have blanketed the region with smoke and haze.

title: Karthala Volcano in Comoros Erupts
caption: On April 17, the Karthala volcano in the island nation of Comoros began to erupt, forcing as many as 10,000 people from their homes. It erupted again in November 2005, fouling water supplies.

title: Spring Dust Storms Scour China
caption: Springtime dust storms sweep down from Inner Mongolia to cover much of northern China with yellow haze.

title: Haze over the Philippine Sea
caption: A river of volcanic haze blankets the Philippine Sea 2,220 kilometers from the volcano.

title: Haze Over Eastern United States
caption: Hazy air hung over a large portion of the eastern United States in mid-April 2005.

title: Dust Storm Blows Across Iraq
caption: Winds lifted dust out of the Syrian Desert and pushed a bright band of dust over Iraq, Syria, and Turkey.

title: Dust over Greece
caption: Powerful winds tugged a veil of dust over Greece so thick that the ground was not visible.

title: Fires in the Great Plains
caption: At one time, spring and summer fires on the Great Plains would race across the prairies, suppressing invasion from woody plants and hastening the germination of new grass seeds. Today, springtime fires in the Great Plains are mostly agricultural fires.

title: Dust Storm in China Spreads to Sea of Japan
caption: The prevailing westerly winds in the mid-latitudes often blow dust from deserts in China and Mongolia toward Japan. These images show blowing dust in mid-April 2005.

title: Surprise Snow in Colorado
caption: A circle of white snow stretches east from the base of the Rocky Mountains after a surprise storm buried parts of Colorado, including Denver, on April 10, 2005.

title: Spring Bloom in the Gulf of Alaska
caption: Longer days provided the energy ocean plants in the Gulf of Alaska required to spring to life. The plants, growing in the surface waters of the Pacific, create fanciful swirls in satellite imagery.

title: Fire in Wilsons Promontory National Park
caption: A fire that started on April 1, 2005, in the Wilsons Promontory National Park on the southeastern tip of Victoria, Australia, had scorched around 17,000 acres by April 12, 2005.

title: Dust in Afghanistan
caption: Across a wide portion of southwestern Asia, winds were whipping across deserts, sending a froth of dust into the skies in early April 2005.

title: Floods Color US Waterways
caption: Torrential rains triggered flooding along the Susquehanna and Delaware Rivers on April 3 and April 4, 2005. By April 5, the flood water had flowed into the Chesapeake and Delaware Bays, coloring them brown with muddy run-off.

title: Spring Snow in the Northeastern United States
caption: An early spring storm covered parts of Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, and Ontario with as much as 22 inches of snow.

title: Cyclone Adeline-Juliet
caption: Tiny, but powerful Cyclone Adeline-Juliet is spinning west across the Indian Ocean. The storm has kicked up powerful waves, but is not threatening any landmass.

title: Unique weather yields record crops
caption: The summer of 2004 couldn't have been more perfect for farmers. Cool temperatures, sunny days, and plenty of rain combined to yield a record harvest in the midwestern United States.

title: Dust  Storm in Central Africa
caption: Thick dust blankets large sections of central Africa.

title: Dust and Haze Blow Across China
caption: Dust blowing out of the Gobi Desert combined with haze to clog the air over eastern China, the Yellow Sea, and the Korean Peninsula.

title: Sulfur Dioxide Leaks from the Ambrym Volcano
caption: Since at least October 2004, the Ambrym Volcano has been sending sulfur dioxide into the atmosphere. By March 2005, it was the largest point source of sulfur dioxide on the planet.

title: Spring Floods in Central Europe
caption: An unusually harsh winter followed by heavy spring rains has pushed the rivers of Central Europe higher than their typical spring levels.

title: Drought in the U.S. Pacific Northwest
caption: Looking back on the winter that just ended, the northwestern United States finds itself facing drought, again. The region has been in drought for several years, and after a light winter, the trend looks to continue in 2005.

title: Fires on Hispaniola
caption: Dense smoke poured out of fires burning in the Dominican Republic in March 2005. The fires started in the Jos del Carmen Ariza National Park in the Central Mountains.

title: Snow in New Mexico
caption: A late winter storm blanketed New Mexico with snow on March 15, 2005.

title: Ocean Blooms in the Wake of Cyclone Willy
caption: Tropical Cyclone Willy was relatively small, but it left a clear track across the southern Indian Ocean.

title: Cloudy winter in Mexico and the Southern United States
caption: Perhaps not surprising for winter weather, February was a cloudy month for much of the southern half of North America. February 2005 proved to be cloudier, and in many places, wetter, than average.

title: Drought in Africa
caption: Drought persists along much of Africa's eastern coast, leaving many countries in need of continued food aid. An important month for crop development in southern Africa, February was unusually dry.

title: Floods in Iraq
caption: Prone to springtime flooding, the Tigris River has once again spilled over its banks in central Iraq.

title: Fires in Mexico and Central America
caption: Scores of fires were burning across southern Mexico and northern Central America during the annual dry season between January and May 2005.

title: Death Valley
caption: Water fills the salt pans of Death Valley after a very wet winter. These MODIS images contrast the water-filled valleys of 2005 to more normal conditions in 2004.

title: Dust Storm Over Northern Africa
caption: When the Terra satellite passed over northern Africa on March 12, 2005, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer detected clouds of swirling dust blowing across the continent and out over the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Drought in Southeast Asia
caption: With little rain falling in late 2004 and early 2005, Southeast Asia is in severe drought.

title: Floods in Central Madagascar
caption: On the island of Madagascar, unusually heavy rains came down in the first week of March 2005, causing severe flooding across the central latitudes of the island.

title: Floods in Algeria
caption: Torrential rains filled the wadis of southeastern Algeria with raging flood waters in early March 2005. These MODIS images show the flooded Sahara Desert on March 7, 2005.

title: Drought on the Iberian Peninsula
caption: Both Spain and Portugal are suffering from their worst drought in decades after rains failed over the winter.

title: Floods in Afghanistan
caption: Heavy rains and snow melt following the country's worst winter in a decade have caused widespread flooding across Afghanistan.

title: Cyclone Ingrid
caption: It is extremely rare for a cyclone to make landfall, degrade, then re-intensify over open water, but that is exactly what Cyclone Ingrid did.

title: Ash Cloud from Shiveluch Settles on Kamchatka
caption: Shiveluch has been producing many ash plumes throughout the first few months of 2005, and evidence of a recent eruption is scattered down the western flanks of the volcano and beyond in this image from March 10, 2005.

title: Dust Storm over Libya and Egypt
caption: Starting on February 28, desert dust began to blow out of Egypt and Libya over the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Tropical Cyclone Percy
caption: On March 2, 2005, Cyclone Percy grew into a Category 5 storm with powerful 260-kilometer-per-hour winds. These QuickSCAT images show how the storm grew from March 1 to March 2.

title: Fires in Uganda
caption: On February 22, 2005, the MODIS sensor on NASA's Aqua satellite detected scores of active fires burning in Uganda and Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Dust Storm in Western Africa
caption: Thick dust hung over the Western African nations of Niger, Nigeria, Burkina Faso, and Benin on February 25, 2005. The Saharan storm completely obscured the ground from view in this MODIS image.

title: Haze Shadows Winter Crops in China
caption: Natural-color and infrared-enhanced images of eastern China on February 28, 2005, show thick haze shadowing winter crop-growing areas.

title: Snow Hammers Europe
caption: Heavy snow fell over much of Europe during the final week of February, crippling travel. This MODIS image was taken on February 28, 2005, after most of the clouds had moved out.

title: Fires and Smoke in Sumatra
caption: A prolonged dry spell across Malaysia and Sumatra was contributing to numerous fires burning across the region, which billowed thick, choking smoke out over the Indian Ocean and the Strait of Malacca on March 9, 2005.

title: Haze Blankets Southern China
caption: A thick haze settled heavily into low-lying areas in the mountainous terrain of southern China on February 24, 2005. The gray pall can be seen packed into river valleys and basins in this Terra MODIS image.

title: Floods in Greece and Turkey
caption: The river that defines the border between Greece and Turkey is at its highest level in 50 years. On February 22, 2005, the river formed a wide band of blue in this MODIS image.

title: Phytoplankton in the Arabian Sea
caption: Flooding and wind-blown dust may have contributed to the plant life blooming on the surface of the Arabian Sea. On February 22, MODIS detected high chlorophyll concentrations in most of the sea.

title: Eruption of Klyuchevskaya Volcano
caption: Eruptions at the Klyuchevskaya Volcano are becoming increasingly violent, prompting officials to raise the volcanic alert to its highest level, reserved for major explosive eruptions. (The volcano's name has many alternate spellings, including Klyuchevsky; Kluichevsky and Kluichevskaya; and Kluichevskoi.)

title: Flooding in Colombia and Venezeula
caption: February is typically the dry season in northern South America, but in 2005, unusual torrential rains triggered deadly floods in Venezuela and Colombia. Though water levels had fallen by February 26, MODIS still saw signs of flooding along the rivers southwest of Lake Maracaibo.

title: Snow in the Hindu Kush
caption: Harsh winter conditions continue to take a toll on Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, and Tajikistan as heavy snow and avalanches bury or isolate communities. These MODIS images show the extent of the snow cover in February 2005.

title: Cyclones in the Pacific
caption: This MODIS image shows Cyclones Olaf and Nancy on February 16, 2005, one day before Olaf passed over American Samoa as a Category 5 storm.

title: Heavy Rains Flood Pakistan
caption: Heavy rains continue to flood parts of coastal Pakistan through the first week of March 2005. The  Dasht and Koja Rivers along the Iran-Pakistan border continue to run high in this MODIS image.

title: Cyclone Meena strikes Cook Islands
caption: Cyclone Meena swirls across the Pacific Ocean in this MODIS image, acquired on February 6, 2005.

title: Record Rains Hit Melbourne, Australia
caption: More rain fell over Melbourne, Australia on February 2 and February 3, 2005, than any other 24-hour period since records began in 1856. This TRMM image shows rainfall totals between February 1 and February 3.

title: Cyclone Harvey Moves Over Australia
caption: On February 7, 2005, Cyclone Harvey blew ashore over Northern Territory, Australia.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan Desert
caption: On January 30, 2005, the bowl of the Taklimakan Desert in western China was filled with swirling dust.

title: Dust Storm in Australia
caption: Clouds of dust billow over the Queensland Desert in this MODIS image, acquired on February 2, 2005.  The large dust storm was connected to a powerful storm that also brought heavy rain, strong winds, and snow to Australia.

title: Snow over Northern Africa
caption: In an extremely rare event, snow fell over much of northern Algeria and Morocco on January 26 and 27, 2005. In this MODIS image, captured on January 28,  snow covers the desert tan of northern reaches of the great Sahara Desert.

title: Dust storms out of Egypt
caption: On January 29 and 30, 2005, the MODIS sensors on NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites captured images of dust storms blowing out of Egypt and across the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Earthquake in Sulawesi
caption: In the early morning hours of January 24, 2005, an earthquake rattled the Sulawesi Island of Indonesia. The fault line responsible for the quake is visible in this image, which shows the topography of the landscape around the fault.

title: Snow in Iran
caption: On January 23, 2005, heavy snow fell over the mountains of Iran, covering the northern half of the country with a blanket of white.

title: Great Lakes Start to Freeze
caption: The race is on to see which will freeze first: the northeastern offshoot of Lake Huronâ€”Georgian Bayâ€”or Lake Erie.

title: Shamal Winds Drive Middle East Dust Storm
caption: A fast-moving dust storm whipped across the Middle East between January 24 and 25, 2005. This series of MODIS images from the Aqua and Terra satellites shows the progression of the dust cloud from Syria to the Persian Gulf.

title: Floods in Southeast Sumatra
caption: Heavy rain in mid-January 2005 filled the rivers and wetlands of southern Sumatra. This MODIS image shows the water-laden region on January 22.

title: Floods in Saudi Arabia
caption: Rivers of water flow through the desert soil around Medina, Saudi Arabia, in this MODIS image, captured on January 24, 2005. The floods were triggered when a powerful storm dumped heavy rain on the desert country on January 22.

title: Guyana Flooded by Heavy Rains
caption: Located along the northeastern coast of South America, Guyana has been inundated with record rain through the month of January. The resulting floods are affecting coastal regions, particularly the nation's capital, Georgetown.

title: Record Blizzard Strikes U.S. Northeast
caption: Record snowfall fell over the northeastern United States on January 22 and 23, 2005, in one of the worst blizzards in the past century. This MODIS image shows Massachusetts on January 24.

title: Wildfires Near Perth
caption: Firefighters tentatively contained a large wildfire in the mountains east of Perth on Jan. 20, 2005. This image shows the burned areas as well as still-burning portions of the fire.

title: Winter Storms Lash the Western United States
caption: A string of storms that started on December 27, has lashed the western United States with heavy snow and rain. When the clouds cleared on January 12, much of the West was covered with white.

title: Floods in the Ohio River Valley
caption: Flood water that filled the Ohio River in January 2005 reached the lower Mississippi in early February. MODIS observed high water levels on the river in Mississippi and Louisiana near Lake Pontchartrain.

title: Persistent Rains Bring Floods, Mudslides to California
caption: Another episode of heavy rain drenched Southern California between February 18 and February 22, 2005. TRMM shows that the highest rainfall totals were in mountainous, coastal regions, prone to flooding and landslides.

title: Severe Winter Storm in Northern Europe
caption: An intense winter storm lashed Northern Europe on January 8-9, 2005.

title: Bushfires in South Australia
caption: Intense, fast-moving bushfires raced across the Eyre Peninsula in south-central Australia on January 11, 2005. This image of the burn scar was captured by the MODIS sensor on the Terra satellite on January 12, 2005.

title: Eruption of Colima Volcano
caption: A series of explosive eruptions has rained ash and rock over the Colima Volcano, Mexico's most dangerous and active volcano.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kerry
caption: Topical Cyclone Kerry formed on January 6, 2005, near Fiji, and then began drifting westward toward Australia’s  northeast coast. This image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA’s Terra satellite shows Cyclone Kerry on January 9, 2005.

title: Ash Flows from Mount Etna
caption: A light plume of ash and steam rose from Mount Etna on January 8, 2005, when MODIS captured this true-color image.

title: Eruption of Anatahan
caption: Anatahan continues to steam after its largest eruption in recorded history on April 6, 2005. This major eruption was a continuation of its third historical eruption, which began early in January 2005. Anatahan is located in the Northern Mariana Islands in the North Pacific Ocean and has been responsible for blanketing Guam and other nearby islands with volcanic haze.

title: Dust over the Persian Gulf
caption: Thick clouds of dust obscured the Persian Gulf from view on January 7, 2005.

title: Rain Hampers Tsunami Relief Efforts
caption: Even as efforts are moving forward to bring aid to the victims of the deadly tsunami around the Indian Ocean, heavy rains are making progress more difficult. This TRMM rainfall map shows rainfall totals around the Indian Ocean between December 28 and January 5.

title: Winter Storm Hits Pakistan and Afghanistan
caption: Heavy rain, snow, and unusually low temperatures swept across Pakistan and Afghanistan on January 1 and 2, 2005, leaving the countries white with snow.

title: Dust Storm off Western Sahara Coast
caption: Dust storms have been sweeping across central and western Africa on and off since early January 2005. This image shows an immense dust event on February 16, 2005.

title: Dust Storm in Sudan
caption: A dust storm was blowing over the Nubian Desert, between the Red Sea and the Nile River in Sudan, on Dec. 27, 2004. These images show natural-color and temperature observations of the area on the day of the storm.

title: Beautiful Blooms in South Atlantic Ocean
caption: Convergence of cold and warm currents off southern  South America stimulates colorful blooms of phytoplankton. This MODIS image shows one such bloom in the waters of the Atlantic near Argentina.

title: Earthquake Spawns Tsunamis
caption: A magnitude 9.0 earthquake - the largest in 40 years - struck offshore of the Indonesian island of Sumatra on December 26, 2004. These images show the damage caused by the resulting tsunami to the shores of northwestern Sumatra.

title: Winter Storm Slams North Carolina and Virginia
caption: A post-Christmas winter storm left a trail of snow across North Carolina and Virginia, which is pictured in the Terra MODIS image from Dec. 27, 2004.

title: Smoke Over Great Australian Bight
caption: Smoke from fires in southwestern Australia spread in brownish-gray streamers and swirls over the Great Australian Bight on December 22, 2004.

title: Fires in Southwestern Australia
caption: Intense flaming of fires in southwestern Australia created a bright red-orange glow in false-color imagery from the Aqua MODIS sensor captured on Dec. 21, 2004.

title: Arctic Blast Chills Eastern United States
caption: Winter settled heavily over the Eastern United States on December 20, 2004. Snow blanketed the northeast and mid-west and cold arctic wind swept out of the north.

title: Flooding in Sri Lanka
caption: The northeast monsoon is drenching Sri Lanka with heavy rains. The resulting flooding can be seen in this MODIS image, taken on December 19, 2004.

title: Dust Storm in Pakistan
caption: Thick dust blew from Pakistan over the Arabian Sea on December 19, 2004.

title: Oil Spill off Unalaska Island
caption: A shipwrecked freighter off the northwest coast of Unalaska Island spilled over 40,000 gallons of oil into the Bering Sea on December 8, 2004. This Landsat scene, acquired September 18, 2000, shows the island in relation to the shipwreck to provide perspective on the extent of the spill.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Gulf of Mexico
caption: Recent flooding along the Mississippi River and its tributaries may be linked to a large phytoplankton bloom growing in the Gulf of Mexico near the Mississippi River delta.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood Malaysia
caption: Heavy monsoon rains have triggered floods along Malaysia's east coast. These TRMM images show rainfall totats from Deceber 7 to December 13, 2004.

title: Carbon Monoxide in Africa and Asia
caption: Areas of high carbon monoxide concentrations in the atmosphere were observed by the MOPITT sensor on NASA’s Terra satellite between Dec. 2-12, 2004.

title: B-15A Iceberg
caption: After threatening the Drygalski Ice Tongue for months, the massive B-15A iceberg sideswiped the floating glacier in a collision that broke off the tip of the ice tongue.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: In March and April 2005, India, Myanmar, Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, and southern China were experiencing some of the most severe drought conditions in decades. Fires filled the skies with smoke.

title: Floods on Iranian Gulf Coast
caption: Heavy rains triggered deadly floods along Iran's Gulf coast on December 10, 2004. The flood waters were still visible on December 11, when MODIS captured this image.

title: Floods Across the Southeastern United States
caption: The rivers of Alabama, Mississippi, Tennessee, and Arkansas were much fuller than normal on December 12, 2004 after a week of heavy rain across the Southeastern United States.

title: Floods in Australia
caption: Heavy rains filled the rivers of eastern Australia on December 10, 2004, pushing some in northern New South Wales and southern Queensland over their banks.

title: Dry Spring in Eastern Australia
caption: A dry start to the growing season in eastern Australia has devastated the winter grain crop. This MODIS NDVI image shows patterns of dryness in Victoria, New South Wales, and Queensland.

title: Red Tide near Florida
caption: A large red tide bloom was detected in the Gulf of Mexico off the southwestern coast of Florida. The bloom covers 400 square miles and is being blamed for recent fish kills.

title: Fires in Para, Brazil
caption: These images from the MODIS sensor on the Terra satellite on Nov. 18 and Dec. 7, 2004, show an area of deforestation and fires where the Tapajós River joins the Amazon River in western Pará, Brazil.

title: Fires in Western Africa
caption: In western Africa on December 29, 2004, numerous fires were burning in western Africa between the Sahara Desert and the Atlantic Coast to the south.

title: Dust Storm over East China
caption: Strong winds originating out of China's Mu Us Desert generated thick plumes of dust blowing eastward over and through passes in the Luliang Mountains on Dec. 6, 2004.  The MODIS sensors aboard both the Terra and Aqua satellites captured timely images of the event.

title: Subtropical Blooms in New Zealand Waters
caption: The waters of the Pacific Ocean around New Zealand were blooming with phytoplankton on December 3, 2004.

title: Tropical Cyclone 05A
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Cyclone Agni (05A) at 09:15 UTC on November 30, 2004 in the Indian Ocean.

title: Floods in Texas
caption: Heavy rains inundated Texas throughout November 2004. By the end of November, several Texas rivers appeared to be flooded in MODIS imagery.

title: Tropical Storm Otto
caption: As if to mark the end of a spectacular hurricane season, Tropical Storm Otto developed over a remote section of the Atlantic Ocean in the final hours of the season. This SeaWiFS image shows the storm on December 1, 2004.

title: Typhoon Nanmadol
caption: The fourth tropical storm to strike the Philippines in two weeks moved ashore on December 2, 2004. The TRMM satellite captured this image of the weakening storm after it moved across Luzon.

title: Carbon Monoxide over Africa
caption: November marks the beginning of the fire season in the Sahel, where fire is used to clear land and prepare fields for planting. Biomass burning releases carbon monoxide, and high levels of carbon monoxide were detected over western and central Africa during the final week of November.

title: Ash and Steam from Nyiragongo
caption: A thick plume of ash and steam rose from Nyiragongo on November 28, 2004.

title: Snow Across the Western United States
caption: A major storm swept across a large swath of the Western United States over the weekend, putting a halt to holiday travel in many places.

title: Heavy Rains Drench Texas
caption: Intense rains fell over much of Texas between November 13 and November 22, 2004.

title: Fog Blankets Pakistan
caption: Thick fog covered parts of Pakistan on November 27, causing a number of traffic-related deaths.

title: Tropical Cyclone Bento
caption: The MODIS instrument flying aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Cyclone Bento on November 22, 2004 at 05:20 UTC.

title: Rainy Season Floods in Colombia
caption: Two months of heavy rain filled the rivers and wetlands of Colombia in October and November 2004.

title: Floods in Philippines
caption: After four tropical storms in two weeks, Luzon is reeling under severe floods. This TRMM image shows rainfall accumulated over the past two weeks.

title: Dust Storm in the Bodele Depression
caption: The Bodele Depression in Central Africa is probably the single largest source of wind-blown dust in the world. Blowing clouds of dust have risen up from the depression periodically since Novemember 2004. This image is from the Terra MODIS sensor on January 6, 2005.

title: Fires in Eastern Brazil
caption: This Aqua MODIS image shows fires burning near the mouth of the Amazon River in the late dry season on November 22, 2004.

title: Typhoon Muifa
caption: The TRMM satellite tracks the development of Typhoon Muifa in this series of images.

title: Dust Plumes Off North Africa Coast
caption: Dust streams off deserts in northern Africa and out over the Mediterranean Sea on November 14, 2004.

title: Phytoplankton in Shark Bay
caption: The Moderate Resolution Spectroradiometer detected phytoplankton in the waters of Shark Bay, Australia, on November 6, 2004.

title: Haze along the Himalaya Front Range
caption: On Dec. 17, 2004, haze and fog stretched over northern India. The fog was resposible for numerous accidental deaths in the country.

title: Fires in Central Africa and Eastern Sahel
caption: In central Africa, south of Lake Chad, hundreds of fires were burning on December 11, 2004.

title: Early Dry Season in Southeast Asia
caption: The drenching rains of the Asian monsoon ended early in Southeast Asia this year, and the early dry season could mean a reduced harvest for rice farmers. This image shows the outgoing longwave radiation anomaly for the month of October, which points to a lack of rain clouds over Southeast Asia.

title: Fires across the Southern United States
caption: Across the Deep South, numerous fires were detected by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA's Aqua satellite on November 9, 2004.

title: Grimsvotn Volcano Erupts
caption: Buried under Europe's largest glacier, the Grimsvotn Volcano started to erupt on November 2, sending a plume of ash into the atmosphere that forced official to divert air traffic.

title: Floods in California
caption: MODIS detected high water levels along the rivers of California on November 1, after two large storms dumped heavy rain and snow on the state during the final weeks of October 2004.

title: Record Snow in California
caption: An intense Alaskan storm swept down over California during the final week of October, blanketing the Sierra Nevada Mountains with record snowfall.

title: Algal Bloom off Tasmania
caption: MODIS images helped scientists detect a large algal bloom in the waters of the Tasmanian Sea south of Australia in late October. The SeaWiFS sensor confirms the presence of the bloom by showing high levels of chlorophyll along the east coast of Tasmania.

title: Continued Eruption of Manam Volcano
caption: After two months of silence, Manam erupted explosively on January 27, 2005, sending a cloud of sulfur dioxide over New Guinea. The Ozone Monitoring Instrument aboard NASA's new Earth-monitoring satellite, Aura, detected the plume as it drifted west over the island.

title: Typhoon Nock-Ten strikes Taiwan
caption: Typhoon Nock-Ten hammered Taiwan with strong winds and heavy rains on October 25. It is the 24th typhoon to develop in the western Pacific in 2004.

title: Earthquakes near Niigata, Japan
caption: A series of powerful earthquakes rattled northern Japan starting on the evening of October 23.

title: Dust Storm over Saudi Arabia
caption: Strong winds frequently blow out of the an Nafud desert in northern Saudi Arabia, and one such storm lifted clouds of sand over Saudi Arabia and Iraq on October 22, 2004.

title: Typhoon Tokage
caption: Typhoon Tokage became the record eighth typhoon to strike Japan in 2004 when it moved over the island nation on October 20. This series of images shows the storm from the perspective of the TRMM, MODIS, and SeaWiFS sensors.

title: Autumn Fires in China and Russia
caption: As autumn advances in the Northern Hemisphere, browns and golds overtake the landscape of northern China. Mixed with the color of fading vegetation are deep reddish-brown burn scars from fires that sprang up in mid-October. These MODIS images are from October 17 and 20, 2004.

title: Agricultural Fires in Northwest India
caption: A tight cluster of red dots in this Aqua MODIS image from Oct. 27, 2004, marks the location of numerous actively burning fires at the foothills of the Himalaya Mountains in northwest India.

title: Subtropical Storm Nicole
caption: The seemingly delicate spirals of subtropical storm Nicole were approaching land in the northwest Atlantic when the SeaWiFS sensor captured this image on October 12, 2004.

title: Deadly Floods Sweep Across Northeastern India
caption: A tropical depression brought several days of intense rain to northeastern India and Bangladesh, filling the region's rivers. The rains triggered deadly floods, which are visible in these MODIS images.

title: Dust blowing off West Africa
caption: Dust blowing out of West Africa

title: Tropical Storm Matthew Floods Louisiana
caption: Tropical Storm Matthew dumped up to 12 inches of rain on southeastern Louisiana when it came ashore on October 10, 2004. The resulting flooding is clearly visible in this MODIS image, acquired the next day when the storm cleared.

title: Fires in California
caption: The combined smoke from the Freds and Power Fires in northern California hung thickly in the Sacramento Valley on October 14, 2004. This image of the fires was captured by the MODIS sensor on the Aqua satellite.

title: Locusts Plague Northwest and Western Africa
caption: A wet winter and spring settled over northwestern Africa in 2004, and the dry Sahel bloomed with life. As the desert turned green, the plentiful water nourished more than vegetation. Buried in the sandy soils were the eggs of desert locusts, waiting to absorb moisture and hatch. Now, locusts swarm over up to four million hectares of northern and western Africa, consuming crops and potentially threatening a food crisis.

title: Super Typhoon Ma-On
caption: Typhoon Ma-on was the ninth typhoon to strike Japan in 2004, and the most powerful to come ashore over eastern Japan in the past 10 years. This series of TRMM images shows the storm's development from tropical depression to powerful super typhoon back to typhoon before it made landfall on October 10, 2004.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Another large dust storm blew out of Afghanistan's desiccated Hamoun Wetlands and spread southward over that country and Pakistan to the south.

title: Eruption at Ambrym Volcano
caption: The Ambrym Volcano is one of the most active in the chain of Hebrides Islands in the South Pacific Ocean. On October 4, MODIS captured an image of one of its frequent eruptions.

title: Colima's Long Eruption
caption: The first week of October saw the Colima Volcano in Central Mexico spouting lava and rock, but this was hardly a new event for the volcano, which has been erupting intermittently since 2002. This ASTER image shows the volcano in one of its quieter moments in January 2004, and is accompanied by a chart of MODIS thermal detections over the volcano from 2002 through mid-2004.

title: Dust Storm off Iceland
caption:
A low-pressure system north of the United Kingdom was
blowing dust off Iceland and sending it southward over the Atlantic Ocean on Oct. 5, 2004.  Both SeaWiFS and Aqua MODIS captured images of the event.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Arabian Sea
caption: Green swirls of phytoplankton colored the waters of the Arabian Sea on October 6, 2004.

title: Sheveluch Volcano Erupts
caption: A dark plume of ash streams from the Sheveluch volcano in Kamchatka, Russia, in this MODIS image, captured on October 20, 2004.

title: Fires in Queensland, Australia
caption: Since mid-October 2004, fires have been burning off and on across southeastern Queensland in eastern Australia. Fire bans have been in place across the territory almost since the beginning of the annual fire season on September 1.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula and New Guinea
caption: Southeasterly winds were aligning the smoke plumes from scores of fires burning on New Guinea on October 13, 2004, when this Aqua MODIS image was acquired.

title: Mount St. Helens
caption: Mount St. Helens continues to be restless five months after it started to erupt. On March 8, the volcano erupted in a location away from the growing lava dome, producing a large ash cloud and  silencing several monitoring stations.

title: Train of Hurricanes Floods Florida
caption: Four major hurricanes in six weeks have taxed the rivers and lakes of central Florida. This series of MODIS images tracks the changes between the storms.

title: Fires and Haze Along U.S. Gulf Coast
caption: Autumn agricultural burning in the southern United States creates a blanket of haze across the Gulf Coast on October 3, 2004.

title: Toxic Algal Bloom off Washington
caption: Scientists report the largest bloom of toxic algae ever observed has formed off Washington's coast.  These SeaWiFS images show the region affected.

title: Carbon Monoxide in the Southern Hemisphere
caption: Biomass burning releases carbon monoxide into the atmosphere. This image shows MOPITT measurements of carbon monoxide throughout the southern hemisphere in February and September 2004.

title: Chlorophyll Along U.S. West Coast
caption: On September 21, 2004, the SeaWIFS sensor detected high levels of chlorophyll concentrations along the Pacific Coast of the United States.

title: Late Dry Season Fires in Northern Territory
caption: September 29, 2004, numerous scattered fires were burning across the savannas of Northern Territory, Australia.

title: Typhoon Meari
caption: The MODIS instrument flying aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Meari along the eastern China coast on September 27, 2004 at 02:55 UTC.

title: Floods in Gonaives, Haiti
caption: A month after devastating floods tore across northern Haiti, an analysis of RADARSAT SAR data shows just how widespread the floods were.

title: Sediment from the Susquehanna River
caption: Heavy rainfall from the remnants of Hurricane Ivan resulted in flooding along the rivers that drain into the Chesapeake Bay. The muddy flood waters have tainted the bay brown in this MODIS image, acquired September 21, 2004.

title: Fires Near Lake Malawi, Africa
caption: West and south of southern Africa's Lake Malawi, scores of fires were burning on Sept. 25, 2004.

title: Gulf Coast after Hurricane Ivan
caption: Gulf Shores, Alabama, is covered in sand after Hurricane Ivan came ashore. This Ikonos image, taken on September 18, 2004, details the destruction Ivan left in the coastal community.

title: Flooding on the Mekong River
caption: Flooding is a way of life along the Mekong River. Every year between August and November, monsoon rains fill the rivers of Southeast Asia, and the Mekong River Delta broadens well past its dry season levels.

title: Hurricane Jeanne
caption: The MODIS instrument flying aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Storm Jeanne on September 27, 2004 at 16:05 UTC (12:05 PM EDT).

title: Dust Storm in Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Dust was blowing across the deserts of Afghanistan and Pakistan on September 16, 2004.

title: Mt. Asama on Honshu Island, Japan
caption: Ash and smoke rise from the summit of Mt. Asama, one of Japan's most active volcanoes. The volcano began erupting in early September, and has continued to exhale ash and steam in small, frequent eruptions.

title: Fires in Northern Australia
caption: Along the coast of the Gulf of Carpentaria, numerous large bushfires were burning in the tropical savannas and grasslands of northern Australia on October 22, 2004.

title: Particle Pollution in Eastern China
caption: Incomplete burning of carbon-based fuels like coal and wood leads to a build-up of haze in eastern China, where mountains and weather patterns can trap it for days at a time. This Terra MODIS image  is a comparison of a hazy day and a relatively clear day in February 2005.

title: Carbon Monoxide over South America
caption: The MOPITT sensor aboard NASA's Terra satellite observed high concentrations of carbon monoxide over much of South America in early September 2004 due to the intense and widespread biomass burning along the border between Brazil and Bolivia.

title: Hurricane Javier
caption: This QuickSCAT image provides a colorful view of the winds around Hurricane Javier on September 16, 2004.

title: Dust Storm in Southern Iraq
caption: Several plumes of dust were blowing out of Southern Iraq and over the northern expanse of the Persian Gulf on September 11.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: Fires in central South America have been intense in 2004, particularly along the border between Bolivia and Brazil. This MODIS image from October 7, 2004, shows fires and thick smoke over the region.

title: Water Turbidity in the Bahamas
caption: The waters of the Atlantic Ocean have turned a brilliant white around the Bahamas Islands in the wake of Hurricane Frances.

title: Mount Egon Erupts
caption: On September 4, 2004, Mount Egon on the Indonesian island of Flores erupted with a thick cloud of ash and smoke.

title: Hurricane Ivan
caption: When Hurricane Ivan blasted through Pensacola, Florida, it cut apart a bridge on the heavily traveled Interstate 10. The gap in the bridge is visible in this ASTER image, acquired on September 21, 2004.

title: Geysers Fire, Northern California
caption: A fast-moving wildfire sprang up in northern California on Friday, September 3, and rapidly grew to several thousand acres.

title: Duckweed on Lake Maracaibo
caption: Starting early in 2004, duckweed began to spread over large areas of Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. By September, the plants had largely disappeared, though green strands are still visible in this MODIS image.

title: Hurricane Howard
caption: Hurricane Howard churns in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Baja California.

title: Saharan Dust over the Red Sea
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA’s Aqua satellite observed a large, thick plume of dust blowing eastward over the Red Sea on September 1, 2004.

title: Typhoon Songda
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Songda on September 1, 2004 at 00:40 UTC.

title: Fire and Smoke in Angola
caption: Haze spreads out over the Atlantic from southern Africa on August 28, 2004.

title: Floods in Luzon, Philippines
caption: Unusually heavy monsoon rains enhanced by Typhoons Aere and Chuba triggered extensive flooding along rivers to the north of Manilla, Philippines.

title: Tropical Storm Gaston
caption: The SeaWiFS instrument captured this view of Tropical Storm Gaston and Tropical Depression Hermine spinning side-by-side on August 30, 2004.

title: Hurricane Frances
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Storm Frances on September 6, 2004 at 19:00 UTC (3:00 PM EDT).

title: Dust over the Canary Islands
caption: NASA's Terra satellite observed a large plume of Saharan Desert dust blowing over the Canary Islands off the northwest coast of Africa.

title: Fires Near the Volga River
caption: Scores of small fires were scattered across southern Russia on either side of the Volga River on August 23, 2004.

title: Carbon Monoxide over Indonesia
caption: Annual fires burning on Borneo and Sumatra in Indonesia have left the islands under a choking blanket of haze. As a result, the Terra MOPITT sensor observed elevated levels of carbon monoxide over the region.

title: Typhoon Aere
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Aere on August 25, 2004 at 5:20 UTC.

title: Typhoon Chaba
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Chaba on August 29 at 1:45 UTC.

title: Carbon Monoxide from Tropical Fires
caption: The Terra MOPITT sensor observed large plumes of carbon monoxide produced by biomass burning in South America and Africa in early August 2004.

title: Low Pressure System in the Gulf of Alaska
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of a large low pressure system spinning in the Gulf of Alaska on August 17, 2004 at 22:45 UTC.

title: African Dust over the Mediterranean
caption: A large plume of Saharan Desert dust is blowing northeastward today (Aug. 19) over the Mediterranean Sea toward the Olympians in Athens, Greece.

title: Pot Peak Fire in Northern Washington
caption: The Potpeak Fire smoulders on the hills surrounding Lake Chelan in northern Washingtonn on August 12, 2004.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan
caption: NASA's Terra MODIS sensor observed a large plume of dust blowing out of the Sistan Basin and fanning out over a large portion of southern Afghanistan and into northern Pakistan.

title: Typhoon Megi Traps Haze in China
caption: Trapped in place by Typhoon Megi, haze hangs over much of southeast Asia in this MODIS image, captured on August 18, 2004.

title: Landslide Lake in Tibet Floods India
caption: A year after forming behind a landslide, the lake on the Pareechu River of Tibet burst free, flooding regions downstream.

title: French Fire in Northern California
caption: A fast-moving wildfire roared through a small northern California community on August 15, 2004, destroying numerous homes and other buildings and forcing hundreds of people to evacuate.

title: Tropical Storm Earl
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Storm Earl on August 15, 2004 at 17:50 UTC.

title: Typhoon Rananim
caption: The MODIS instrument aboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Rananim on August 12 at 2:40 UTC.

title: Hurricane Charley
caption: The TRMM-based, near-real time Multi-satellite Precipitation Analysis (MPA) at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center provided these images and animations of the rainfall totals for the period 9-14 August 2004 for the Southeast U.S. and northern Caribbean.

title: Fires on Borneo and Sumatra
caption: On Sumatra and Borneo, scores of fires were billowing thick smoke across a wide area on October 13 and 14, 2004. These images of the burning are from the MODIS sensor on NASA’s Aqua satellite.

title: Tropical Storm Bonnie
caption:
The Tropical Rainfall Measuring
Mission (or TRMM) satellite has followed Bonnie's progress from a weak
tropical depression east of the Lesser Antilles to landfall as a tropical
storm along the northern coast of Florida.

title: Hurricane Alex
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra spacecraft captured this true-color image of Hurricane Alex on August 4, 2004 at 11:00 A.M. EDT.

title: Heavy Snow in South Africa
caption: Thick winter snow blankets parts of South Africa and Lesotho in this MODIS image acquired on July 29, 2004.

title: Smoke in the Pacific Northwest
caption: Smoke from intense fires burning in British Columbia blanketed the state of Washington during the final week of July.

title: Smoke from Brazilian Fires
caption: Smoke from fires burning in Mato Grosso Brazil is drifting north over the Amazon. This MOPITT image tracks the spread of carbon monoxide from the fires between July 19 and July 26, 2004.

title: Fires in British Columbia
caption: A large fire in western British Columbia was spilling smoke down over the glacier-covered slopes of the Coast Range Mountains on July 28, 2004.

title: Hurricane Darby
caption: The MODIS instument onboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this tue-color image of a rapidly intensifying Hurricane Darby in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom Near Norway
caption: Brilliant green swirls of phytoplankton colored the water of the Barents Sea north of Norway in late July 2004.

title: Fires in Spain and Portugal
caption: Fires were blazing across Portugal and Spain in late July and early August 2004.

title: Typhoon Namtheun
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Namtheun located approximately 280 nm south of Tokyo, Japan.

title: Drought in East Africa
caption: Ongoing drought plagues Eastern Africa after as many as six years of poor rainfall.

title: Algal Bloom in the Pacific Northwest
caption: Colorful blooms of phytoplankton line the coasts of Washington and British Columbia in this SeaWiFS image captured on July 23, 2004.

title: Smoke from Alaska Fires off U.S. East Coast
caption: The MODIS sensor aboard NASA's Aqua satellite observed smoke blowing over the Atlantic Ocean off the U.S. east coast on July 21, 2004.  The smoke originated from intense wildfires burning in Alaska.

title: Hurricane Celia
caption: Celia became the first hurricane of the season in the northeastern Pacific on July 22, 2004. This AIRS image shows the storm as it is strengthening to hurricane status.

title: Dust Storm off Morocco
caption: A large dust plume of Saharan Desert dust continued to blow westward off the coast of Morocco on July 25, 2004.

title: Fires in Northern Canada
caption: Smoke form fires in northern Canada, and possibly from as far away as Alaska, was spreading south and east across North America in late July 2004.

title: Heat Wave in Japan
caption: On Tuesday, July 20, 2004, the temperatures in Tokyo, Japan, hit a record-breaking 39.5 degrees Celsius (103.1 Fahrenheit), the hottest temperature ever recorded since records began in 1923.

title: Heatwaves and Cold Weather Across Europe
caption: While Southern Europe languished in intense heat in the first week of July, Northern Europe was chilled in cooler-than-normal temperatures.

title: Floods and Landslides in New Zealand
caption: Severe winter storms drenched New Zealand's North Island with heavy rain, producing floods and landslides on July 18, 2004.

title: African Dust over the Red Sea
caption: Several plumes of African desert dust were blowing over the Red Sea on July 16, 2004.

title: Smoke from Alaskan Fires over Louisiana
caption: The MODIS sensor aboard NASA's Terra satellite observed smoke blowing over the southeastern U.S. on July 19, 2004.  The smoke originated from intense fires burning in Alaska.

title: Monsoon Rains Flood East Asia
caption: Monsoon rain continues to drench eastern China bringing with it the floods that annually plague the country.

title: Tropical Storm Kompasu
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission tracked Tropical Storm Kompasu as it developed over the Pacific Ocean from July 14 until it moved ashore on July 16, 2004.

title: Tropical Depression Blas
caption: The SeaWiFS instrument onboard the OrbView-2 satellite captured this true-color image of Tropical Depression Blas churning in the Pacific waters off Baja, Mexico.

title: Cold and Snow in South America
caption: Severe cold and heavy snow caused destruction across much of South America in early July 2004, particularly in the Andean highlands of southern Peru.

title: Fires in California
caption: Several fast-moving wildfires have been nipping at the margins of Los Angeles in the third week of July 2004.

title: Flooding in Siberia
caption: The Yana River in northern Siberia pushed over its banks as it was filled with melting snow in June and July 2004.

title: Nyiragongo Volcano Erupts
caption: Clouds of ash and steam were billowing from the Nyiragongo Volcano in the Democratic Republic of the Congo on July 12, 2004.

title: Summer Heat Across Spain
caption: From June 29 to July 4, 2004, an intense heat wave swept across southern Spain, bringing air temperatures that soared above 40 degrees Celsius, and land surface temperatures near 57 degrees.

title: Fires in Rwanda's Kagera National Park
caption: In east-central Africa, numerous fires were burning on July 5, 2004. In Rwanda, fires set by poachers may have burned up to one-third of the land in the Kagera National Park.

title: Floods in India and Bangladesh
caption: Dark blue and black flood waters surround Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, in this MODIS image, taken on August 3, 2004.

title: Smoke from Alaska Fires
caption: Smoke from large forest fires in Alaska has made the rounds across several parts of the Northern Hemisphere since the fires began in mid-June 2004. In this scene, smoke is spreading southward along the western arc of the Alaska Range Mountains and the Alaska Peninsula.

title: Floods in Southern Taiwan
caption: Typhoon Mindulle brought several days of heavy rain to southern Taiwan, triggering the worst floods the country has seen in 25 years.

title: Fires in Arizona and New Mexico
caption: Smoke from Arizona wildfires billowed across the U.S. border and into northern Mexico between July 1-10, 2004. This MOPITT image shows observations of carbon monoxide in the area.

title: Fires Near Xingu River
caption: In South America’s Amazon River Basin, the annual dry season is drawing to a close, but fires are still burning over a wide area near the Xingu National Park on September 28 and 29, 2004.

title: Typhoon Tingting
caption: Typhoons Tingting and Mindulle spin side by side in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Typhoon Mindulle
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission captured this sequence of images of Typhoon Mindulle between June 23 and July 1, 2004.

title: Fires between the Caspian and Aral Seas
caption: Fires were burning in southern Kazakhstan between the Caspian and Aral Seas on June 20, 2004.

title: Bright Waters Around Iceland
caption: On the first day of summer in the Northern Hemisphere, the clouds around Iceland cleared to reveal a bright aquamarine ocean, probably colored by coccolithophores.

title: Fires In Alaska and Northern Canada
caption: In Alaska, the landscape is already changing over to its fall wardrobe, with summerâ€™s green being traded for brown and gold. Fires, some of which have been burning since before the beginning of summer, were still smoldering on September 7, 2004.

title: Super Typhoon Dianmu
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite continued to monitor Dianmu as it approached Japan.

title: Sedgwick Fire in New Mexico
caption: On June 15, 2004, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of New Mexico, showing the Sedgwick Fire in the Cibola National Forest,as well as a smaller, unnamed fire to the south.

title: Thunderstorms above the Sierra Nevada
caption: On June 14, a series of thunderstorms swept over the southern Sierra Nevada.

title: Bright Water Off France
caption: Marine life colored the water west of Great Britain and France a bright blue in this MODIS image, taken on June 13, 2004.

title: Typhooon Chanthu
caption:
The TRMM-based, near-real time Multi-
satellite Precipitation Analysis (MPA) at the NASA Goddard Space Flight
Center provided this quantitative rainfall estimate of Typhoon Chanthu and a tropical depression in the Bay of Bengal.

title: Early Dry Season Fires in Northern Australia
caption: Early dry season fires are scattered across Northern Territory, Australia, in this MODIS image from June 17, 2004. Land managers set early dry season fires to reduce the build up of flammable grasses that can become more dangerous later in the season.

title: Persistant Storms Soak North Texas
caption: Heavy rain triggered flash floods over much of northeastern Texas in early June. This TRMM image shows rainfall totals between June 3 and June 10, 2004.

title: Dust Plumes off Namibia
caption: On June 9, NASA's Terra satellite captured a striking image of many dust plumes streaming westward off Africa's southwestern coast.

title: Levee Break Floods Central California
caption: A broken levee near the San Joaquim-Sacramento River delta flooded nearly 12,000 acres of farmland in Central California on June 3, 2004.

title: Snow in Southern Africa
caption: Snow blankets the mountains and highlands of Lesotho and South Africa after the winter's first storm swept across southern Africa on June 8, 2004.

title: Low Pressure System off Iceland
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of a large low pressure system off the coast of Iceland.

title: Algae Bloom off the Coast of El Salvador
caption: An algae bloom off the coast of El Salvador is making a dark streak in the Pacific Ocean in this SeaWiFS image acquired on June 5, 2004.

title: Typhoon Conson (07W)
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite captured these images of Conson showing the storm's evolution from a tropical storm into a typhoon.

title: Southwest Asia Dust Storm
caption: A large cloud of persisted over southern Afghanistan and Pakistan, obscuring much of Pakistan's coast on June 15.

title: Dust Storm in Chad
caption: This image shows land surface temperatures to highlight the features of a large dust storm that blew across Chad on May 28, 2004.

title: Flooding in Myanmar
caption: Coastal flooding left 220 dead and over 18,000 homeless after a tropical cyclone came ashore in northern Myanmar on May 19, 2004.

title: Fires in Madagascar
caption: Scattered fires were burning across western Madagascar on June 2, 2004.

title: Unseasonal Rain Falls in Northern Australia
caption: June in Darwin, Australia, is normally dry, but this year, the first two days brought more rain than the city normally sees in the entire month.

title: Dust Over the Gulf of Sirte
caption: A thick swirl of dust hung like a tan curtain across northern Libya and the Gulf of Sirte on May 26, 2004.

title: Landslides in Cameroon
caption: Landslides are becoming a frequent problem on the slopes of Mont Bamboutos in Cameroon as the steep forested land is cleared for agriculture. This ASTER image shows this pattern of land use and points to regions that might be vulnerable to landslides in the future.

title: Congo Volcanoes erupt
caption: Mount Nyamulagira and Mount Nyiragongo were both erupting on May 25, 2004, when the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer captured this image of the area around Lake Kivu in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Severe Floods Sweep Across Haiti and the Dominican Republic
caption: Over the past week, both Haiti and the Dominican Republic, the two countries on the island of Hispaniola, have been ravaged by severe flooding after several days of heavy rain. Hundreds have perished in the two countries as a direct result of mud slides and flash flooding.

title: Severe Weather in the US Midwest
caption: A stationary front draped across the Midwest provided the focus for several days of strong springtime thunderstorms that delivered strong winds, tornadoes, and heavy rains to the region.

title: Heat Wave in Pakistan
caption: Six people died and dozens more fell ill as temperatures soared to 47 degrees Celsius (116 Fahrenheit) in central Pakistan on May 21 and 22, 2004.

title: Floods in Northern Thailand
caption: Deforestation may have intensified deadly floods and landslides brought on by early rains in Northern Thailand.

title: KP Fire in Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest
caption: Eastern Arizona’s KP Fire was burning in rugged, mountainous terrain in the Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest on May 24, 2004, but was not threatening any structures.

title: Peppin Fire on El Capitan
caption: Nearly one month old, the Peppin Fire in New Mexico continues to elude firefighters’ complete control due to rugged, inaccessible terrain, drought, high winds, and abundance of dead trees and other fuel. This image shows the fire on June 13, 2004.

title: Dust in the Indus Valley
caption: On May 23, 2004, dust and blowing sand along the Pakistan-India border stretch out in a tan plume over the Arabian Sea.

title: Tropical Storm brings Heavy Rains to Burma
caption: On May 19, a tropical storm moved ashore in western Burma (Myanmar)and southeastern Bangladesh, bringing heavy rains and strong winds. The TRMM satellite tracked the storm and rainfall totals from May 12 to May 19, 2004.

title: Fires in Sumatra
caption: Scores of fires were burning across Sumatra in early August 2004.

title: Dust Storm over the Nile, Sudan
caption: Large, twin plumes of dust blew eastward over the Nile River in northeastern Sudan on May 18, 2004.

title: Fires in Southern Africa
caption: On August 5, 2004, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on NASA’s Aqua satellite registered more than 12,000 active fire detections across south-central Africa.

title: Bay of Biscay in Bloom
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom in France's Bay of Biscay brought bright swirls of light blue and turquoise to the surface across much of the bay.

title: Fires Across West Siberian Plain
caption: On May 17, scores of fires were burning across the southern portion of the West Siberian Plain south of the Ob’ River and Irtysh Rivers.

title: Fires in South-Central Russia
caption: In the Krasnoyarsk region of south-central Russia, scores of fires burned across the taiga and steppe landscape on May 20, 2004.

title: Typhoon Nida
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Super Typhoon Nida churning through the Philippine Islands.

title: Strong Storms Dump Heavy Rains on Texas and Louisiana
caption: Strong thunderstorms brought hail and high winds to the southern United States from central Oklahoma through central Texas.  The storms also dumped heavy rains over coastal portions of Texas and Louisiana, triggering localized floods.

title: Dust Storm Over Persian Gulf
caption: On May 14, 2004, the morning overpass of the Terra satellite over the Persian Gulf captured this image of a large dust storm.

title: Heavy Rains Flood Costa Rica
caption: Over 2,000 people fled were forced from their homes when heavy rains triggered floods across the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide Eruptions Along the Coast of Namibia
caption: People living along Namibia's desert coast have long been familiar with the rotten egg smell that periodically emanates from the Atlantic Ocean whenever hydrogen sulfide erupts from the ocean. This MODIS image shows one such eruption on May 12, 2004.

title: Tropical Cyclone 01A
caption:
The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite captured several
images of Tropical Cyclone 01A as it drifted northward in the western Indian Ocean.

title: Sheveluch Volcano Erupts
caption: The Sheveluch Volcano in eastern Russia erupted explosively on May 9, 2004. The MODIS sensor recorded ash and stream rising from the volcano on subsequent days.

title: Fires in South Australia
caption: Morning-afternoon differences in fire activity in South Australia were picked up by the MODIS sensors on NASA’s Terra and Aqua satellites on May 7, 2004.

title: Fires at the Mouth of the Yangtze River
caption: Dozens of fires were burning in eastern China near the mouth of the Yangtze River on May 6, 2004.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Widespread agricultural fires throughout the month of June sent plumes of carbon monoxide across the Atlantic Ocean towards South America.

title: Fires in Western Australia
caption: In Western Australia’s southwest corner, a number of fires were burning on May 4, 2004, and a plume of smoke stretched far out over the ocean.

title: Fires Southeast of Los Angeles, California
caption: Several dangerous fires were burning southeast of Los Angeles on May 4, 2004, and are pictured in this Aqua MODIS image.

title: Cachuma Fire in California
caption: The Cachuma Fire in Santa Barbara COunty, California, is one of several large wildfires ingited during the first week of the state’s official fire season.

title: River of Dust Flows from Africa to Italy
caption: A river of Saharan dust is flowing northeastward from the deserts of northern Africa on May 4, 2004.

title: Fires in Northern Australia
caption: Fires were detected in Northern Territory and Western Australia by Aqua MODIS on April 30, 2004.

title: Thunderstorms Bring Floods to Texas
caption: Thunderstorms dumped heavy rain over Northern Texas, leading to deadly flash floods.

title: Springtime Heat Wave Bakes Southern California
caption: Record-high temperatures baked Southern California as April turned to May in the midst of a spring heat wave.

title: Dust Storm over Southern Asia
caption: A new, massive dust storm erupted out of the Sistan Basin straddling the border between Iran and Afghanistan on April 29.  The dust blew southward and spread out over a wide area, covering most of southern Afghanistan and western Pakistan.

title: Nevada Dust Storm Closes Interstate 80
caption: A fierce dust storm blew across northwestern Nevada on April 28, 2004, with winds that gusted up to 70 mph.

title: Fires in Russia and China
caption: Spring is progressing and fires are increasing across eastern China and southeastern Russia in late April 2004.

title: Ambrym Volcano Ash Plume
caption: The Ambrym Volcano on Vanuatu Island in the South Pacific Ocean continued to billow ash on May 15, 2004.

title: Flooding in Northeast Arkansas
caption: Heavy rains over much of Arkansas have triggered floods.

title: Fires in Western Russia
caption: Snow was retreating northward, ice was breaking up in Volga River (left), and springtime agricultural fires were burning in western Russia on April 24, 2004.

title: Fires in Pakistan and India
caption: Agricultural fires spread smoke across Pakistan and northwestern India on April 25, 2004.

title: Flooding in Southern Siberia
caption: Flooding along the Ob River near the Kazakstan border

title: Fires in Guinea
caption: The MODIS sensor on the Aqua satellite captured this iamge of dozens of fires burning in Guinea on April 27, 2004.

title: Mt. Ruapehu, New Zealand
caption: All around the world, people live in places where the threat of natural disaster is high. On the North Island of New Zealand, the Mount Ruapehu volcano is just such a threat. In addition to being one of New Zealand's most active volcanoes, Ruapehu also threatens to cover nearby communities with volcanic mudflows.

title: Severe Storms Trigger Floods in Bangladesh
caption: Over half a million people have been evacuated from northern Bangladesh after a series of destructive hot-season storms triggered wide-spread flooding.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide Eruptions along the Coast of Namibia
caption: Toxic hydrogen sulfide gas tints the waters along the coast of Namibia bright green in this MODIS image taken on April 18, 2004.

title: Floods in Fiji
caption: Heavy rains triggered landslides and floods on Fiji's main island, Viti Levu. On April 17, MODIS detected a large plume of sediment off the coast where the flood waters carried mud into the ocean.

title: Dust Storm over Colorado and Kansas
caption: Heavy winds in the midwestern United States kicked up a large dust storm that blew from eastern Colorado into western Kansas on April 18, limiting visibility and contributing to car accidents in the region.

title: Dust Storm over the Persian Gulf
caption: The Terra and Aqua satellites saw a thick plume of dust blowing over the Persian Gulf on April 17.

title: Fires in Mexico and Central America
caption: On May 31, 2004, numerous fires were burning in southern Mexico across a broad that spanned the Pacific to the Altantic Coast at the latitude of Lake Chapala.

title: East Fork Fire
caption: The East Fork Fire started in the Apalachicola National Forest in western Florida on April 4, 2004, and by April 18 had grown to more than 26,000 acres.

title: Fires on Korean Peninsula
caption: The MODIS sensor on the Aqua satellite captured this image of fires burning in North and South Korea on April 18, 2004.

title: Typhoon Sudal
caption: The MODIS instrument on board NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Sudal located about 95 miles east-southeast of Yap.

title: Floods along the Red River
caption: MODIS captured this view of extensive flooding along the Red River in North Dakota and Minnesota near the Canadian border.

title: Intense Rains Flood Mexico and Texas
caption: Heavy rains on April 4 and 5, 2004, triggered deadly flash floods across Texas and Northern Mexico.

title: Flooding in Western Russia
caption: The rivers of Central Russia, Belarus and the Ukraine are brimming past capacity as spring returns to the region.

title: Picnic Rock Fire, CO
caption: The Picnic Rock fire started on March 30, 2004 north of Fort Collins, Colorado. It grew to a size of 8900 acres and was mostly contained by April 7, 2004.

title: Fires in Western Australia
caption: Widespread fires were detected across Western Australia on April 2, 2004, by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite.

title: Fires on Cuba
caption: Dozens of fires were burning on Cuba on April 3, 2004, and were detected by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite.

title: Fires in Sierra Leone
caption: Over the course of the day on April 4, 2004, scores of fires sprang up across the West African country of Sierra Leone.

title: Growing-Season Fires in Central United States
caption: Aqua MODIS captured this image of agricultural burning in the south-central United States on March 31, 2004.

title: Flooding in Croatia
caption: The MODIS sensor captured this image of high waters on the Sava River in Croatia on March 29, 2004.

title: Flooding from Tropical Cyclone Fay
caption: The DeGrey River in Western Australia pushed over its banks in the wake of Tropical Cyclone Fay.

title: Fires in Southeast Australia
caption: This MODIS image from the Aqua satellite shows scattered fires across a broad region of southeast Australia on April 7, 2004.

title: Fires in Portugal
caption: On March 27, 2004, a wind-driven forest fire was burning out of control in central Portugal.

title: Saharan Dust Over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: Saharan dust is sweeping north over Libya and Tunisia to cloud the air over the Mediterranean Sea, Greece, and Sicily.

title: Dust Storm in the Taklimakan Desert
caption: A large-scale dust storm blanketed the eastern Taklimakan Desert on April 28, 2004, draping the normally orange-colored sands with a swath of tan-colored dust.

title: Sandstorms Sweep Across Northern China
caption: An intense sandstorm carried dust from the Gobi Desert across Northern China on March 27 and March 28, 2004.

title: Rare South Atlantic Tropical Cyclone
caption:
The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite is designed to
measure rainfall over the global tropics using the combination of a
microwave sensor and the first and only precipitation radar in space.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: On March 24, 2004, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite captured this image of central South America, showing fires burning in Argentina, Paraguay, and Brazil.

title: Southeast Asia Fires Spread Smoke Eastward
caption: Smoke from fires in Southeast Asia appears as a brownish-gray haze over a deck of clouds to the east on March 24, 2004.

title: Tropical Cyclone Grace
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Aqua spacecraft captured this true-color image of Tropical Cyclone Grace 500 miles east of Mackay and moving to the southeast.

title: Dust in the Bodele Depression
caption: Light-colored streams of African Desert dust blew westward out of the Bodele Depression, as the newest in an intermittent series of dust storms was born on April 22.

title: Dust from Pakistan and Iran
