caption: Winds blowing down from the Makran Coast Range in Western Pakistan and Eastern Iran were carrying dust over the Gulf of Oman and the Arabian Sea on March 23, 2004.

title: Tropical Cyclone Fay
caption:
Tropical Cyclone Fay first developed into a tropical depression on the 16th of March 2004
in the Timor Sea west of Bathurst Island off the northern coast of
Australia.  Just twelve hours after becoming a depression, Fay became a
named tropical storm with winds estimated at 35 knots (40 mph).

title: Papagayo Winds Blow Nicaraguan Dust over the Pacific
caption: The SeaWiFS sensor captured this image of the gale-force Papagayo winds blowing dust from Nicaragua over the Pacific on March 19, 2004.

title: Record Harvest in Australia
caption:
After devastating drought in 2002, Australian wheat and barley farmers 
brought in record crops in the 2003/2004 season. The contrast between the two seasons is clearly visible in this MODIS image pair.

title: Phytoplankton off the coast of California
caption: Nutrient-rich currents off the coast of California are supporting a large phytoplankton community.

title: Flooding in Madagascar
caption: Tropical Cyclone Gafilo brought intense floods to Madagascar.

title: Late Winter Fires Across India
caption: This Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) image of southern and central India was captured on March 15, 2004, and shows widepsread agricultural burning.

title: Fires Across Southern United States
caption: Late winter fires were burning across the southern United States in mid-March 2004.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan
caption: A large dust storm from the Taklimakan Desert was blowing slightly westward on March 10, 2004.

title: Severe Sandstorm in Northeast China
caption: Visibility across much of northeastern China, including downtown Beijing, was reduced to 500 meters as a severe sandstorm swept southeastward out of the Gobi desert on Wednesday.

title: Impassable One Fire Burns in Florida
caption: The Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer captured this image of the Impassable One fire as swept through 38,000 acres of timber and swamp land in the Osceola National Forest.

title: Seasonal floods along the Zambezi River
caption: Every year as the rainy season draws to a close, the Zambezi River pushes over its banks along its upper reaches in Zambia, but this year, the river is fuller than normal.

title: Central Africa Dust Storm
caption: An intense dust storm stretched across Central Africa and spread out over the Atlantic for thousands of kilometers.

title: South Korea Receives Record Snowfall
caption: More snow fell in South Korea on March 6, 2004, than ever recorded for a single day in March.

title: Ash Plume from Soufriere Hills Volcano
caption: On March 4, 2004, a large eruption of the Soufriere Hills Volcano, on the island of Montserrat, shot a large cloud of volcanic ash 20,000 feet into the air.

title: Dust over Cape Verde Islands
caption: A thick, massive plume of Saharan Desert dust swept over the Cape Verde Islands off the coast of West Africa on March 5.

title: Hydrogen Sulfide Eruption Along the Coast of Namibia
caption: A milky green cloud in the water off Namibia marks an eruption of hydrogen sulfide gas from bacteria on the ocean floor.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gafilo
caption:
The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite captured
numerous, impressive images of Cyclone Gafilo covering most of it's
life cycle as it traversed the western Indian Ocean.

title: Pollution over China
caption: During February 2004, there was considerable outflow of pollution, in the form of carbon monoxide, from China and southeast Asia.

title: Pollution from Fires across Northwest Africa
caption: Burning in the savanna south of the Sahara Desert, and in Africa's tropical rain forests released vast amounts of pollution in the form of carbon monoxide throughout February 2004.

title: Saharan Dust Across West Africa
caption: A long line of Saharan dust blew across West Africa on March 3, 2004, and then spread out over the Atlantic in a long plume on March 4.

title: Floods in Northwestern Australia
caption: Tropical Cyclone Monty flooded the Fortescue River in the northern sections of Western Australia.

title: Tropical Cyclone Monty
caption: Tropical Cyclone Monty spun up to a category 4 cyclone before weakening and moving ashore over Western Australia.

title: Tropical Cyclones Monty and Evan
caption: Two tropical cyclones made landfall in Australia just hours apart. Cyclone Monty came ashore along the northwest coast of Western Australia on the evening of 1 March 2004 (LST) while Cyclone Evan made landfall a few hours later in the early morning hours of March 2nd (LST) along the east coast of the Northern Territory.

title: Snow Blankets North Carolina
caption: A rare winter storm blanketed North Carolina with snow, giving MODIS this unusual view of a white Southeast.

title: Snowstorm in New Mexico
caption: Heavy snow crippled much of northern New Mexico on February 25, 2004.

title: Cyclone Ivy
caption:
Cyclone Ivy first formed into a tropical storm at 18Z on the 22nd of February
2004 midway between Fiji to the east and Vanuatu to the west.

title: Floods in New Zealand
caption: The flood waters had largely receded on New Zealand's North Island when the clouds cleared away on February 25, 2004, and the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer(MODIS) on the Aqua satellite captured this image.

title: Massive Sandstorm in Qatar
caption: This International Space Station shows a massive sandstorm sweeping over the Persian Gulf state of Qatar as it races southward toward southeastern Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

title: Major Dust Storm East of Bam, Iran
caption: A major dust storm swept across the Kerman Desert, just east of the city of Bam in Southeastern, Iran. A photo of the event was acquired by the crew of the International Space Station using a digital camera with a 50-mm lens.

title: Intense Heat Blankets Southern Australia
caption: Days of record-breaking temperatures plagued much of Southern Australia in February as an extended heat wave rolled across the country.

title: Ongoing Eruption of Mount Belinda
caption: When the ice-covered Mount Belinda  began to erupt in October 2001, it provided scientists a unique opportunity to study the interaction between lava and ice in extreme environments. Because of the remote location of the volcano in the southern Atlantic Ocean between Antarctica and South America, much of the study has been done with satellite imagery.

title: Dust Storm over Jordan
caption: An intense dust storm blew through the skies over Jordan and other parts of the Middle East on Feb. 22, 2004.

title: Saharan Dust over Italy
caption: On Feb. 22, a thick plume of Saharan Desert dust blew from Algeria and Tunisia across the Mediterranean Sea and over the island of Sicily, headed directly for Italy's southern mainland.

title: Thick Dust Blows in Texas
caption: Winds that gusted up to 63 miles per hour (101 kilometers per hour) pushed a thick curtain of dust across Western Texas on February 19, 2004.

title: Dust Over the Canary Islands
caption: A graceful arc of Saharan dust is streaming off the coast of northwest Africa and sweeping out over the Atlantic Ocean and the Canary Islands in this Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer image from the Aqua satellite  on February 18, 2004.

title: Dust Storm off Morocco
caption: Bright yellow streamers of dust sweep off North Africa’s Moroccan coast toward the Canary Islands in this true-color Terra MODIS image from February 17, 2004.

title: Heavy Rains Bring Flooding to Mindanao
caption:
Several days of heavy rains led to widespread flooding on the island of
Mindanao in the southern Philippines.

title: Tropical Cyclone Fritz
caption:
Tropical Cyclone Fritz first formed into a tropical cyclone on 10 February 2004 in the
Coral Sea east of Queensland, Australia.  The storm then came ashore on the
morning of the 11th (LST) as a minimal cyclone along the northeast
coastline of Queensland just north of Cape Melville.

title: Syr Darya River Overflows
caption: Ice and a lack of regional cooperation triggered winter floods along the Syr Darya River in Southern Kazakhstan.

title: Dust Storms from Africa's Bodele Depression
caption: The Bodele Depression has generated wave after wave of intense African dust storms in recent days.  These true-color Terra images show the genesis of massive dust storms just as they are forming.

title: Dust Sweeps across the Arabian Sea
caption: Strong winds swept large plumes of dust off the southern coasts of Iran and Pakistan south and eastward across the Arabian Sea on Feb. 9, 2004.

title: Dust Plumes Over the Red Sea
caption: Arcing plumes of tan-colored dust hang over the blue waters of the Red Sea in this Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS)image captured on February 8, 2004.

title: Haze Over Eastern China
caption: The air in Eastern China was clouded with thick haze as winter came to a close in early April.

title: Dust and Smoke Over West Africa
caption: The West African coastline was partially hidden beneath a thick veil of haze—likely a mixture of dust and smoke from numerous agricultural fires—on February 17, 2004.

title: Annual Floods Return to Iraq
caption: Winter rains have begun to expand the lakes and marshes in Southern and Eastern Iraq.

title: Floods in Turkey
caption: Snowmelt from a rare snowstorm fills the rivers of Western Turkey in this MODIS image acquired on February 7, 2004.

title: Floods in Madagascar
caption: Mud-rich waters gush off the northwestern shore of Madagascar in the wake of Tropical Cyclone Elita.

title: Tropical Cyclone Frank (10S)
caption: On February 2, 2004, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer captured this view of Tropical Cyclone Frank in the South Indian Ocean.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: Agricultural fires continue to spread a shroud of smoke across Southeast Asia on March 27, 2004.

title: Fires in Northern South America
caption: Across the grassy plains, known as the “Llanos,” that stretch across Venezuela and Columbia in northern South America, numerous fires were detected by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Terra satellite on February 1, 2004.

title: Saharan Dust over Canary Islands
caption: A widespread plume of Saharan Desert dust blew off the northwest coast of Africa and directly over the Canary Islands on Feb. 3.  A day later, the dust storm continues.

title: Calm before the Dust Storm
caption: On Feb. 3, 2004, a large dust storm swept westward off the coast of northwest Africa and, for the last two days has been spreading to the north and west over a large portion of the eastern Atlantic Ocean. This latest Terra image was acquired on Feb. 6.

title: Heavy Rains Bring Floods to Brazil
caption: A month of heavy rain has caused floods and mudslides in several northeastern Brazilian states. These TRMM images show rainfall totals for the last week of January 2004.

title: Monsoonal Rains Flood Malaysia
caption: Up to two feet of rain may have fallen over sections of Malaysia, flooding several villages.

title: Storms in the Eastern Mediterranean
caption: Strong winter storms brought snow and cold to much of the Eastern Mediterranean. This MODIS image shows snow in Western Turkey where the climate is typically mild.

title: Extreme Cold in Canada
caption: Arctic air swept across Canada, bringing lower-than-normal temperatures and ice-related flooding.

title: Winter Storms Across the Eastern United States
caption: Heavy snow and ice coated much of the Eastern United States between January 26 and January 28, 2004.

title: Tropical Cyclone Elita (09S)
caption: The TRMM satellite captured these images of Tropical Cyclone Elita as it was making landfall off the coast of Mahajanga, Madagascar.

title: Texas-sized Dust Storm Sweeps over Egypt
caption: A massive dust storm out of the Sahara Desert blew over Egypt yesterday and today (Jan. 23, 2004) has spread across much of the Middle East region.

title: Icebergs Near South Georgia
caption: Several large icebergs surround South Georgia Island in the South Atlantic Ocean.

title: Tungurahua Volcano Erupts in Ecuador
caption: This MODIS image captured on January 14, 2004, shows a plume of ash rising from Ecuador’s Tungurahua Volcano.

title: Heavy Rains and Floods in Australia
caption: The northern monsoon brought heavy rains and floods to Eastern Australia.

title: Floods in Iran
caption: Heavy rains caused deadly flash floods in Iran.

title: Volcanic Eruptions on the Kamchatkan Peninsula
caption: Klyuchevskaya Sopka, the largest volcano on the Russian peninsula of Kamchatka, and neighboring volcanoes, Shiveluch and Bezymianny, are becoming active again.

title: Heavy Rains in Peru
caption: Heavy rains spur floods and landslides along the Andes Mountains in Eastern Peru.

title: Dust  near Lake Chad
caption: Dust clogged the air across Western Africa.

title: Floods in the U.S. Midwest
caption: Heavy rains and snow on January 5, 2004, brought floods to the Ohio River Basin.

title: Tropical Cyclone Heta
caption: These images show Cyclone Heta as it moves through the South Pacific over Samoa and Niue.

title: Flooding in Indonesia
caption: Heavy rain inundated the Indonesian island of Sulawesi, pushing Lake Tempe and the Tondano River over their banks.

title: Blizzards in the Western United States
caption: A heavy blanket of snow covers much of the western United States after a series of blizzards swept across the region starting on December 24, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Ken
caption: Tropical Cyclone Ken off the coast of Western Australia

title: Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race
caption: Each year on Dec. 26 (Boxing Day), Australia conducts its annual Sydney to Hobart sailing yacht race.

title: Earthquake near Bam, Iran
caption: A powerful earthquake struck southeastern Iran on December 26, 2003, killing thousands and destroying much of the city of Bam.

title: Earthquake Near San Simeon, California
caption: On December 22, 2003, a magnitude 6.5 earthquake rumbled along the central California coast.

title: Haze Over the Yellow Sea
caption: The air over most of eastern China was filled with thick, gray pall of pollution on Jan. 29, 2004.

title: Heavy Rains and Floods in Costa Rica
caption:
A strong Atlantic cold front and an area of low pressure combined to
produce days of heavy rains that led to flood damage, mudslides and two
fatalities along the Caribbean coastline of Costa Rica.

title: Tropical Cyclone 03B
caption:
A tropical cyclone (03B) with winds reported of up to 75 mph hit the east
coast of India just after midnight local time on the 16th of December 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Texas
caption: Heavy winds kicked up considerable dust in parts of Texas, New Mexico and northern Mexico on Dec. 15, 2003.

title: Saharan Dust Plume over the Atlantic
caption: A sinuous river of dust snakes out over the Atlantic Ocean off the west coast of Africa in this true-color MODIS image captured on December 13, 2003.

title: Dust over Arabian Sea
caption:
A dust storm was blowing large quantities of
dust out over the Persian Gulf and Arabian Sea
on Dec. 12 and 13, 2003.

title: Dust Storm off Algeria
caption: On December 6, 2003, a wide plume of dust blew over North Africa and northwestward over the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Tropical Storm Odette
caption: A rare, late-year Atlantic tropical storm, Tropical Storm Odette struck the Dominican Republic on December 6, 2003 before dissipating. This TRMM image shows rainfall totals associated with the storm.

title: Flooding in Southern France
caption: Heavy rains caused flooding along the Rhone River and its tributaries in Southern France.

title: First Big Snow in the East
caption: A series of two storms charged out of the Mid-West and into the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast between December 4 and 7, 2003, dumping the first big snow of the season on the Eastern United States.

title: Fires in Central Africa
caption: Fire season in Africa south of the Sahara Desert has roared to life in early December 2003. Several thousand fires were detected in this MODIS image from Dec. 7.

title: Severe Thunderstorms Across Southeastern Australia
caption: This TRMM image shows rainfall totals from November 29 to December 3, 2003, when thunderstorms deluged Southeastern Australia with heavy rain, hail, and lightning strikes.

title: Haze South of the Himalaya
caption: The skies over northern India and Bangladesh were filled with a gray pall of haze.

title: Fires Near the Mouth of the Amazon
caption: Near the mouth of the Amazon River in Brazil, numerous fires burned beneath a patchwork of small clouds on Nov. 29, 2003.

title: Fires and Haze in Southeastern China
caption: A dark gray pall of haze filled the skies over much of southeastern China on Dec.3, while dozens of fires dotted the landscape.

title: Dust in Southern California
caption: Strong winds are blowing newly exposed soil and ash across Southern California into the Pacific Ocean.

title: Floods in Southern Spain
caption: Las Marismas marshlands in Southwestern Spain have filled with water in an annual flooding event.

title: Typhoon Lupit
caption: Typhoon Lupit grew into a super typhoon as it continued across the Northern Pacific.

title: Total solar eclipse over Antarctica
caption: The MODIS instrument captured these true-color images of the total solar eclipse in Antartica on November 23, 2003.

title: Dust Storm in Pakistan
caption: Thick plumes of dust blew off the shores of Pakistan on November 24, 2003.

title: Dust storm over the Red Sea
caption: Streamers of dust from the Afar Depression in northeastern Ethiopia are blowing out over the Red Sea on November 24, 2003.

title: Fires in Argentina
caption: On November 19, 2003, numerous fires were scattered across western Argentina.

title: Thunderstorms Across the Southern US
caption: A line of heavy thunderstorms rolled across the Southern United States between November 17 and November 19, 2003, causing flooding and wind damage.

title: Fires along the Southeast African coast
caption: Fires were burning along the border areas of South Africa, southern Mozambique, and Swaziland on Nov. 17, 2003.

title: Typhoon Nepartak
caption: This QuickSCAT image shows Tropical Storm Nepartak as it began to strengthen into a typhoon in the South China Sea on November 15, 2003.

title: Dust Storm on the Gulf of Oman
caption: Dust from Iran was blowing over the Gulf of Oman on November 16, 2003.

title: Cyclone Beni
caption: The TRMM satellite captured these images of Cyclone Beni in the central Indian Ocean as it developed from a tropical storm into a cyclone.

title: Fires in West Africa
caption: Fire season continues to build in the Sahel and savannas of West Africa in late 2003. This image shows fire activity on December 8, 2003.

title: Fires in Northeast Brazil
caption: Fires are scattered across northeast Brazil in this true-color image captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Terra satellite on November 10, 2003.

title: Dust off Morocco
caption: Thick plumes of tan dust were blowing off the shores of Morocco on November 4, 2003.

title: Flooding in Luzon, the Philippines
caption: Typhoon Melor brought heavy rains to Northern Luzon, the Philippines, leaving floods in its wake.

title: Dust Storm near Lake Chad
caption: Dust from the Bodele depression continues to streak across Lake Chad and the southern Sahara Desert on November 16, 2003.

title: Flooding in Southern Thailand
caption: Heavy rains inundated Southern Thailand causing the worst flooding the region has seen in 30 years.

title: Smoke Transport Across the U.S.
caption: Some of the smoke being generated by the wildfires in southern California is now spreading as far east as the U.S. Great Lakes region.

title: Dust Storm off Australia
caption: A large plume of dust was blowing off Australia's east coast and out over the Tasman Sea on Oct. 28, 2003.

title: Massive Flare Erupts on Sun
caption: A massive solar flare erupted from the surface of the Sun on October 28, 2003 and again on November 4, 2003. Associated with each flare was an ejection of a billion tons or more of gas from the Sun's tenuous outer atmosphere, or corona.

title: Fires in Southern California
caption: Multiple massive wildifres burned in southern California during the last week of October 2003. This series of images shows the fires and the damage they caused as seen from a variety of satellites.

title: Fires Across the United States
caption: A spectacular composite image of the United States on October 22, 2003, shows high concentrations of fires in four different regions.

title: Ward Hunt Ice Shelf
caption: The Arctic's largest ice shelf, the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf, is breaking apart. Between 2000 and 2002, a large fracture split the shelf in two.

title: Typhoon Parma
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites captured this bird's-eye view of Typhoon's Parma and Ketsana churning in the western Pacific Ocean.

title: Haze and Pollution over China
caption: This MODIS image shows a widespread pall of gray haze and pollution across much of the landscape and spreading eastward over the Pacific.

title: Fires in Southeast China
caption: Beneath a blanket of blue-gray smoke, several fires were detected in southeastern China on October 21, 2003.

title: Typhoon Ketsana
caption: With sustained winds of 144 mph (231 km per hour), Typhoon Ketsana in the Western Pacific now appears to be veering away from the Asian mainland and moving slowly toward Japan's southeastern coast.

title: Fires in New Guinea
caption: On November 3, 2003, fires continued to burn across southern New Guinea.

title: Sulfur Plume along Namibian Coast
caption: Along the Namibian coastline, hydrogen sulfide gas given off by bacteria at the bottom of the ocean bubbled up to the surface and formed a turquoise plume of pure sulfur.

title: Fires in Southern United States
caption: This MODIS image shows fires across the Deep South in mid-October 2003.

title: Flooding in Southern Texas
caption: The Nueces River south of San Antonio, Texas is overflowing after days of heavy rain.

title: Flooding in Northern China
caption: Heavy summer rains caused serious flooding along rivers in Northern China.

title: Agricultural Fires in Northern India
caption: A cluster of agricultural fires shrouds the foothills of the Himalayas with smoke in this image of northern India from November 6, 2003.

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: This Aqua MODIS image pictures fires in northern Bolivia and southwestern Brazil on October 14, 2003.

title: Flooding in Southern Mexico
caption: Rivers and reservoirs in Southern Mexico overflow in the wake of Tropical Storm/Tropical Depression Larry

title: Fires in Central Asian Steppes
caption: Fires are burning in the steppes of central Asia on October 14, 2003.

title: Autumn in Wisconsin and Michigan
caption: Within just a few days the trees surrounding Lake Superior and Lake Michigan have gone from a deep green to a vibrant orange as autumn steals over the region.

title: Fires in the Urals
caption: Late-season fires were burning in western Russia around the Ural Mountains and the Volga River.

title: Dust Blowing off West Africa
caption: A large plume of Saharan Desert dust has been blowing off the West African coast over the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Burn Scars in the Pacific Northwest
caption: Fires in the Pacific Northwest through the summer of 2003 have littered the landscape of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia with burn scars.

title: Hurricanes Olaf and Nora
caption: Hurricanes Olaf and Nora threaten the Pacific shores of Mexico

title: Tropical Depression Larry
caption: Tropical Storm Larry, now downgraded to a Tropical Depression, has been drenching the Mexican coastline

title: Rann of Kutch
caption: Normally a salt clay desert, the Rann of Kutch on the border between India and Pakistan becomes a seasonal salt march after monsoonal rains, as seen in this MODIS image.

title: Hurricane Kate
caption: The MODIS instrument on NASA's Aqua satellite captured this image of Hurricane Kate about 1225 miles east southeast of Bermuda on October 2, 2003 at 16:05 UTC.

title: Fires in Indonesia
caption: Smoke from numerous fires in Indonesian spreads across this MODIS image from September 30, 2003.

title: Fires in Southeast Africa and Madagascar
caption: In southeast Africa smoke from hundreds of fires hangs over Mozambique and Zimbabwe on October 3, 2003.

title: Fire in Grand Canyon National Park
caption: On the northern rim of the Grand Canyon, the Poplar Complex Fire (red outline) had grown to more than 7,500 acres as of September 30, 2003.

title: Fires in Brazilian Highlands
caption: Hundreds of fires were burning across the Brazilian Highlands in southeastern Brazil on September 24, 2003.

title: Fires in California
caption: Several early-autumn fires are burning in California and are pictured here in this true-color Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) image from September 29, 2003.

title: Agricultural Fires in Washington
caption: In early fall, scattered fires across Washington are likely stubble-clearing fires in wheat fields in the region. This MODIS image was captured on September 22, 2003.

title: Typhoon Koppu
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this true-color image of Typhoon Koppu on September 29, 2003.

title: Hurricane Juan
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this true-color image of Hurricane Juan approximately 360 miles south of Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Hurricane Force Winds in Greenland
caption: Hurricane force winds blow a streamer of snow off of Greenland's east coast in this MODIS image captured on September 20, 2003 by NASA's Terra satellite.

title: Flooding in North Carolina
caption: Heavy rains and storm surge from Hurricane Isabel have caused major flooding in areas throughout North Carolina, where the center of the storm passed.

title: Volcanic Ash over Kodiak Island, Alaska
caption: There was resuspended volcanic ash over Kodiak Island, Alaska, on Sept. 21, 2003.  Such plumes can present a serious hazard to unsuspecting airliners flying through them.

title: Fires in New Guinea
caption: Dozens of fires were burning across southern New Guinea, north of Australia, on September 18, 2003.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula  Australia
caption: Fire activity has been increasing across Australia’s Cape York Peninsula since late September 2003. This image is from November 3, 2003.

title: Fires in Mississippi Valley
caption: This image captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite on September 16, 2003, shows dozens of actively burning fires across the states east and west of the Mississippi River Plain.

title: Fires in Eastern Australia
caption: Fires were burning across a broad stretch of eastern Australia on September 15, 2003.

title: Dust and Smoke over Eastern Atlantic
caption: A large plume of Saharan Desert dust was blowing southwestward off the coast of West Africa. This MODIS image was acquired on Sept. 21, 2003.

title: Late Summer Fires in Siberia
caption: Several large fires in northeastern Russia are billowing massive smoke clouds over the East Siberia Sea. This Aqua MODIS image shows the region on September 16, 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Libya
caption: A vast plume of Saharan Desert dust was spreading off Africa's northern coast over much of the Mediterranean Sea on Oct. 3, 2003.

title: Super Typhoon Maemi
caption:
The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite has provided
some remarkable images of Super Typhoon Maemi in the western Pacific from
its organization into a minimal typhoon well east of the Philippines
to its height as a super typhoon with winds over 155 mph as it was approaching
the southern Ryuku Islands.

title: Hurricane Isabel
caption: These images, acquired by the Landsat 5 satellite, show dramatic changes Hurricane Isabel wrought on the North Carolina shoreline.

title: Smoke over Pacific Northwest
caption: The SeaWiFS sensor saw a widespread plume of smoke over much of the Pacific Northwest and Great Plains region of the U.S. on Sept. 2, 2003.

title: Fires in Northern Australia
caption: Terra MODIS detected dozens of active fires across northern Australia on November 8, 2003. This image is centered farther west than previous days’ images.

title: Flooding along the River Gash in Sudan
caption: This RADARSAT-1 image shows the aftermath of heavy flooding along the Gash River in Sudan and Eritrea, Africa.

title: Hurricane Fabian
caption: NASA satellites captured these images of Hurricane Fabian 24 hours after the storm wreaked havoc on the tiny island of Bermuda.

title: Tropical Storm Grace
caption: Heavy rains fell over the central US from Kansas to the western Gulf coast over the Labor Day weekend resulting in deadly flooding.

title: Typhoon Dujuan
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) satellite captured this image of Typhoon Dujuan just after it had brushed the southern tip of Taiwan where it caused fatalities.

title: Saharan Dust over Italy
caption: A large plume of desert dust was arcing over the Mediterranean Sea on Aug. 29, 2003, obscuring parts of Sardinia and Sicily, Italy, from Terra MODIS' perspective.

title: Fires in California
caption: Lightning-ignited fires burn in the Diablo Mountain Range northeast of San Jose, California in this Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) imaged acquired by the Aqua satellite on August 27, 2003. Called the Santa Clara Complex, the fires burned 18,457 acres and were 50 percent contained as of August 29, 2003.

title: Flooding along the Awash River in Ethiopia
caption: Swollen by heavy rains that started on Aug. 19, Ethiopia's Awash River has flooded more than 19,000 square km of land and forced thousands of people from their homes.  This MODIS false-color image of the flood was acquired on Aug. 24, 2003.

title: Fires in British Columbia
caption: An astronaut on the Internatioanl Space Station captured this digital camera image of smoke from fires in British Colmubia trapped in the valleys of the northern Rocky Mountains on August 20, 2003.

title: Fires in South-central Russia
caption: Fires dot the Central Siberia Plains and northern Kazakhstan in this Aqua MODIS image from September 8, 2003.

title: Smoke over the Midwestern U.S. and Canada
caption: A number of large fires continue to burn in the northwestern U.S. and Canada, sending a vast pall of smoke eastward over the Great Plains and Great Lakes regions.  This true-color MODIS image shows smoke over the midwest on Sept. 6, 2003.

title: Hurricane Ignacio
caption: As Hurricane Ignacio was churning in the waters near Baja, California, the TRMM and GOES satellites captured this image.

title: Typhoon Krovanh
caption: The MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra spacecraft captured this true-color image of Typhoon Krovanh as it was exiting the tropical island province of Hainan.

title: Smoke over the Maritimes
caption: A large band of smoke from forest fires burning in central and estern Canada was drifting out over the Atlantic Ocean on August 20, 2003.

title: Fires in Oregon
caption: On September 4, 2003, the Terra MODIS sensor captured this image of the B & B Complex Fire, which was very active that day.

title: Fires in Southeastern Africa
caption: The southern Africa biomass burning season is in full swing. These images show actively burning fires across the region in late August 2003.

title: Oil Smoke in Northern Iraq
caption: A black cloud of oil smoke is present in this Terra MODIS image of northern Iraq from August 17, 2003.

title: Fires in Manitoba
caption: Dozens of fires were burning in Manitoba, Canada, on September 9, 2003.

title: Mediterranean Dust Storm
caption: A dust storm was blowing over the Mediterranean Sea from Algeria on August 19, 2003.

title: Flooding in the Northern Philippines
caption: Heavy rains brought flooding to southern Luzon between August 11-18, 2003.

title: Fires in the Balkans
caption: Fires were burning across the Balkans on August 13, 2003.

title: Dust Storm in Taklimakan Desert
caption: This MODIS image shows a dust storm in the Taklimakan Desert in northwest China on Aug. 14, 2003.

title: Blackout Hits U.S. and Canadian Cities
caption: A power outage left many major American cities in the dark on August 14, 2003.  The blackout was apparent from the perspective of space in this pair of DMSP satellite images.

title: Tropical Storm Erika
caption: After plowing across southern Florida on Thursday, August 14, a tropical depression became Tropical Storm Erika in the Gulf of Mexico. The storm was approaching Texas on August 15, 2003.

title: European Heat Wave
caption: Europe is experiencing an historic heat wave that has been responsible for at 3,000 deaths in France alone. Land surface temperatures observed by MODIS in July 2003 were sizzling compared to July 2001.

title: Dust Storm Over Red Sea
caption: This Terra MODIS image shows a dust storm sweeping over the Red Sea on August 20, 2003.

title: Fires in the Northern Rockies
caption: Despite a brief break in the hot, dry weather, dozens of large fires were still burning across the Rocky Mountains in Canada, Montana, and Idaho on September 6, 2003.

title: Heavy Rains Create Major Flooding in Senegal
caption: Torrential rains fell over parts of West Africa during the second week of August as a result of the summer monsoon, causing severe flooding that resulted in damage to crops and livestock as well as several flood-related deaths.

title: Fires in Brazil and Bolivia
caption: Fires were burning across Brazil and Bolivia on September 23, 2003. Fire is commonly used to clear land for agriculture or to maintain pasture in the region.

title: Flooding along the White Nile, Sudan
caption: Heavy rains in Sudan flooded the White Nile between August 3-11, 2003, and displacing thousands of people.

title: Fires in Southern Borneo
caption: Smoke from scores of fires hangs over Borneo on August 10, 2003.

title: Typhoon Etau
caption: Typhoon Etau severely impacted the nation of Japan over the weekend of August 9-10 as the storm tracked northeastward across the island chain.

title: Fires in Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay
caption: Hundreds of fires first pictured on August 1 were still visible in this recent image of South America captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua satellite on August 20, 2003.

title: Floods in Pakistan and and India
caption: In mid-July, heavy monsoon rains caused major flooding along the Indus River in Southern Pakistan and in India’s Gujarat Province.

title: Drought in Western Cape, South Africa
caption: The current drought in South Africa’s Western Cape province is withering and stunting vegetation across this crop-producing region.

title: Fires in Western Canada
caption: Dozens of fires were filling the skies over British Columbia with smoke on August 21, 2003.

title: Smoke over Eastern Russia
caption: Fires in Eastern Russia and on Sakhalin Island have been producing a thick, widespread pall of smoke over much of northeast Asia in recent weeks.

title: Forest Fire in Southern France
caption: Forest fires swept through scenic woodlands along the French Riviera in the last week of July 2003.

title: Forest Fires in Portugal
caption: Less than a month after firefighters in Portugal contained dozens of devestating wildfires, new ones were burning on September 13, 2003, and are pictured in this Aqua MODIS image.

title: Dust Storm over Utah
caption: Entering its fifth year of drought in July 2003, Utah is the driest state in the U.S.  This recent MODIS image shows a dust storm blowing over the Great Salt Lake.

title: Saharan Dust over the Canary Islands
caption: Saharan dust is draped over the Canary Islands off West Africa on July 24, 2003.

title: Fires in Southern Italy
caption: Dozens of fires were detected across southern Italy and Sicily on July 24, 2003.

title: Fires in Montana and Alberta
caption: These high-resolution Advanced Land Imager images from July 29, 2003, show the Wedge Canyon Fire near Glacier National Park, Montana.

title: Flooding and Landslides from Heavy Rain in Japan
caption: Heavy rains fell over southern Japan over the past week, triggering mudslides that killed at least 14 people.

title: Fires in Siberia
caption: In the forests and tundra of eastern Russia, fires have been burning off and on for weeks. This image is from August 15, 2003.

title: Typhoon Koni
caption: This Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) image shows Typhoon Koni over the Gulf of Tongking and Vietnam on July 22, 2003.

title: Super Typhoon Imbudo
caption: The Tropical Rainfall Measureing Mission captured these observations of Typhoons Koni and Imbudo as they dumped heavy rains across the Phillipines, southern China, and Vietnam over the week of July 15.

title: Missouri Breaks Complex Fire
caption: In eastern Montana, the Missouri Breaks Complex Fire burned more than 100,000 acres in late July 2003. This image of the charred landscape was captured by ASTER on August 2.

title: Forest Fires in Eastern Russia
caption: Far eastern Russia is experiencing one of the most severe forest fire seasons on record. This image shows fires and smoke over the region on July 24, 2003.

title: Saharan Dust over Italy
caption: On July 22, 2003, Saharan dust continued to blow across the Mediterranean Sea toward Corsica and Italy.

title: Kinishba Fire on Fort Apache Reservation
caption: On July 13, 2003, lightning ignited a fire on the Fort Apache Reservation in eastern Arizona about two miles west of the small town of Whiteriver. These MODIS images show the storms and the fire’s development.

title: Eruption of Montserrat's Soufriere Hills Volcano
caption: Ash from the eruption of the Soufriere Hills Volcano on the island of Montserrat spread out over the coastal waters on July 15, 2003.

title: Flooding in Eastern China
caption: Weeks of rain in eastern China in mid-July flooded numerous rivers, especially the Huai River near the southeast coast.

title: Blizzard in New Zealand
caption: A blizzard that hit New Zealand over the weekend of July 5, 2003, is being reported as the worst in 50 years.

title: Fires in Utah
caption: On July 11, 2003, the Terra and Aqua MODIS sensors captured images of the Farmington and Bulldog Fires in Utah.

title: Tropical Storm Enrique
caption: On July 12, 2003, the MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Terra satellite captured this bird's-eye view of Tropical Storm Enrique in the warm Pacific waters southwest of Cabo San Lucas.

title: Fires in East Central Africa
caption: Thousands of fires were burning across east-central Africa on July 10, 2003.

title: Hurricane Claudette
caption: Claudette, the first hurricane of the 2003 Atlantic season, came ashore Tuesday morning along the central Texas coast near Port O'Connor.

title: Smoke Transport over Southern Africa
caption: On July 9, 2003, the SeaWiFS sensor saw heavy westward smoke transport from widespread biomass burning in Southern Africa.

title: Fawn Peak Complex Fire in Washington
caption: The Fawn Peak Complex Fire turned in on itself, and as of July 30 had begun burning previously unburned sections with the fire’s perimeter. This image is from Terra MODIS on July 30, 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Pakistan
caption: Afghanistan has suffered through months of the worst sandstorms in living memory. This Terra MODIS image shows a huge dust storm over southern Afghanistan and Pakistan on Sept. 23, 2003.

title: Oil and Sulfur Smoke in Iraq
caption: The ASTER sensor on the Terra satellite captured this image of a sulfur fire at an industrial facility in northern Iraq on July 14, 2003.

title: Smoke Across Sea of Okhotsk
caption: Smoke from fires in eastern Russia hangs over the Sea of Okhotsk in this SeaWiFS image from July 2, 2003.

title: Fires in Manitoba and Ontario
caption: To the southwest of Hudson Bay, multiple large fires were burning across Manitoba and Ontario on July 2, 2003.

title: Fires in Northeast Alaska and Canada
caption: Smoke from several wildfires in Alaska and Canada mixes with clouds in this image from the MODIS sensor on the Aqua satellite on July 1, 2003.

title: Fires on Madagascar
caption: This Aqua MODIS image shows scores of fires scattered across Madagascar on June 30, 2003.

title: Fires in Baja California
caption: One large and two smaller fires were detected near the US-Mexico border in the Mexican state of Baja California Norte on June 29, 2003, by the Aqua MODIS sensor.

title: Dust Storm in Northern Afghanistan
caption: Dust pools in the mountainous terrain of northeastern Afghanistan on June 26, 2003, in this Terra MODIS image.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula
caption: This Aqua MODIS image shows fires across the Cape York Peninsula in northern Queensland on June 30, 2003.

title: Fires in Eastern Russia and Sakhalin Island
caption: On July 1, 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua satellite captured this image of fires in eastern Russia.

title: Tropical Storm Bill
caption: These Topical Rainfall Measuring Mission images show the development and intensification of Tropical Storm Bill in the Gulf of Mexico between June 29-30, 2003.

title: Davis Fire in Oregon
caption: This MODIS image shows the Davis Fire in Oregon on June 30, 2003.

title: Streamers of Dust off Namibia
caption: On June 24, 2003, the Sea-viewing Wide Field-of-View Sensor and the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer captured these images of dust plumes off southern Africa.

title: Haze over the Atlantic Seaboard
caption: On June 26, 2003, SeaWiFS captured this image of Code Red Air (haze and pollution) over most of the U.S. East Coast. Terra MOPITT observations reveal high levels of carbon monoxide.

title: Dust Storm over Morocco and Algeria
caption: On June 23, 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Terra satellite captured this image of a dust storm blowing out over the Mediterranean Sea from Morocco and Algeria.

title: Fires in Alaska
caption: This MODIS image shows fires burning across Alaska on June 23, 2003.

title: Tornadoes Spawn near Deshler, Nebraska
caption: Severe storms pounded Nebraska and Kansas on June 22, 2003, with over a foot of rain, large hailstones and at least seven tornadoes.

title: Fires in Ontario
caption: Terra and Aqua MODIS images of central Canada show numerous wildfires burning across the region over the first weekend of summer, June 20-22, 2003.

title: Fires in Eastern China
caption: On June 17, 2003, smoke from fires in China combined with smoke from fires in southern Russia to produce a thick haze that stretched over eastern China.

title: Fires in Northern Australia
caption: On June 26, 2003, Terra MODIS detected scattered fires across northern Australia and turbid waters along the coast.

title: Dust Blowing over the Red Sea
caption: For more than a week, dust has been sweeping over the Red Sea from east Africa. The ongoing dust storm appears to have intensified in this Aqua MODIS image over the region on July 9, 2003.

title: Floods in India and Bangladesh
caption: This MODIS image from August 6, 2003, shows vast areas of flooding in India and Bangladesh.

title: Typhoon Soudelor
caption: NASA's TRMM spacecraft was able to capture Tropical Cyclone Souledor's total rainfall accumulation for the period June 13-20, 2003.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off France and UK
caption: Off the coast of France and the United Kingdom phytoplankton were blooming in the waters of the Atlantic Ocean on June 12, 2003, coloring the ocean blue and green.

title: Fires Along Coast of Northwest Australia
caption: On June 10, 2003, Aqua MODIS detected numerous fires burning along the northwest coast of Australia.

title: Fires Across Tanzania
caption: Numerous fires (marked with red dots) were burning across eastern Africa on June 10, 2003. The fires appear most heavily concentrated east of Lake Tanganyika in this MODIS image from the Aqua satellite.

title: Fires in Arizona and New Mexico
caption: On July 26, ASTER captured this high-resolution image of the Aspen Fire burn scar northeast of Tucson, Arizona.

title: Fires in Indonesia
caption: Numerous fires on the island of Sumatra in early June 2003 produced high levels of carbon monoxide in the lower atmosphere over the region, as measured by MOPITT aboard NASA's Terra satellite.

title: Massive Dust Storm in Pakistan
caption: The Aqua MODIS sensor captured this view of a massive dust storm blowing over Southern Afghanistan and southwestern Pakistan on June 7, 2003.

title: Fires in Turkey's Adana Region
caption: Dark burn scars are visible around fires burning in the Adana and Hatay regions of Turkey in this image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer(MODIS) on the Aqua satellite on June 18, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gina
caption: On June 8, 2003, the MODIS instrument onboard NASA's Aqua satellite captured this bird's-eye view of Tropical Cyclone Gina as it was located approximately 449 miles (718 km) northwest of Noumea, New Caledonia.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom in North Sea
caption: Clouds of phytoplankton bloom off the southwestern side of Norway in the North Sea in this true-color Terra MODIS image acquired on June 5, 2003.

title: Burning in Madagascar
caption: Scattered fires (red dots) were detected across Madagascar on June 4, 2003, by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Terra satellite.

title: The Great Sand Sea
caption: A dust storm is spilling sand out over the Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Libya on June 5, 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Persian Gulf
caption: Dust storms continue to sweep over the Persian Gulf in June 2003. This Terra MODIS image of the region is from June 14.

title: Saharan Dust off West Africa
caption: This is the season for Saharan dust storms, and this Terra MODIS image from June 4, 2003, shows a large plume of dust billowing from the West African coastline.

title: Smoke from Asian Fires over Canada
caption: The Terra and Aqua MODIS sensors captured these views of a plume of smoke passing over central and eastern Canada on May 23-25, 2003.  The smoke probably originated from the intense forest fires burning in Asia.

title: North Pacific Low-Pressure System
caption: SeaWiFS saw this large low-pressure system over the northeast Pacific Ocean on May 28, 2003.

title: Flooding in Ethiopia
caption: In early May 2003, heavy rains led to flooding in Ethiopia.

title: Flooding in Azerbaijan
caption: In early May 2003, heavy rains and snowmelt led to flooding in Azerbaijan.

title: Tropical Storm Linfa over the Philippines
caption: Tropical Storm Linfa brought heavy rains to the Philippines and the potential for flooding in some areas.  This TRMM image shows the rain accumulations there from May 24-28, 2003.

title: Smoke from Asian Fires over Europe
caption: This May 27, 2003, SeaWiFS image shows smoke from Asian fires crossing the Atlantic and spreading over northwestern Europe, having almost completely circumnavigated the globe.

title: Flooding In Argentina
caption: In early May 2003, heavy rains in Argentina led to devastating floods.

title: Flooding In Namibia
caption: In early May 2003, heavy rains in Africa led to flooding along Nambia?s Caprivi Strip.

title: First Recorded Eruption of Anatahan Volcano
caption: On May 10, 2003, the Anatahan Volcano in the Northern Mariana Islands produced its first documented eruption, spewing a huge plume of ash over a wide area of the Pacific Ocean.

title: Tornado Damage in Moore. Oklahoma
caption: On May 3, 2003, a group of intense supercell thunderstorms spawned multiple tornados that swept across Oklahoma and nearby states.

title: Smoke from Fires in Eastern Russia
caption: On May 21, 2003, smoke from fires burning in eastern Russia crossed the Pacific Ocean and spread over Alaska and western Canada.

title: Tropical Cyclone 01B
caption: On May 19, 2003, the MODIS instrument onboard the NASA's Aqua satellite captured this bird's-eye view of Tropical Cyclone 01B as it was making landfall near Ramree Island on the western coast of Myanmar.

title: U.S. Low Pressure System
caption: On May 11, 2003 a large low pressure system centered near Lake Michigan brought overcast conditions to much of the upper midwest.

title: Dust Storm over Eastern Mediterranean
caption: A large plume of Saharan Desert dust was blowing over Egypt and the Eastern Mediterranean on May 10, 2003.

title: Smoke from Yucatan Fires Reaches Gulf Coast States
caption: Intense fires burning in Central America have produced a thick pall of smoke that has spread widely to the north and east, passing over many Gulf Coast states and out over the northern Caribbean.

title: Fires in Central Asia
caption: Fires in central Asia were detected by Aqua MODIS on May 11, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Manou hits Madagascar
caption: A late-season cyclone makes landfall over Madagascar on May 7 and 8, 2003.

title: Smoke Over Japan and the Pacific Ocean
caption: On May 7, 2003, a river of smoke hundreds of miles wide was stretching over the Pacific Ocean from fires in eastern Russia.

title: Biomass Burning in Central and Southern Africa
caption: More than 10,000 active fire detections mark this MODIS image from July 11, 2003, of Angola, Democratic Republic of Congo, and Zambia.

title: Killer Storms in the southern Plains and the Southeast
caption: Between May 4-6, 2003 severe thunder storms brought heavy rainy, hail, damaging winds and tornadoes to the southern plains and the Southeast US.

title: Torrential Rains Over South America
caption: This image obtained from the TRMM-based multisatellite rainfall estimation technique shows an isolated but very intense region of rainfall centered on the Parana River in Argentina, in the Sante Fe province.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: The skies over the Gulf of Oman and the Arabian Sea were filled with dust on May 2, 2003, from a number of dust storms originating in the Arabian Peninsula and southwestern Asia.

title: Fires in Pakistan and India
caption: Numerous fires were burning in the Punjab regions of India and Pakistan on April 29, 2003. This iamge of the fires is from the Terra MODIS instrument.

title: Fires in Northwest Australia
caption: Scattered fires were burning across Northern Territory and Western Australia on April 26, 2003.

title: Fires Surrounding Xingu National Park, Brazil
caption: Fires have persisted for months across Mato Grosso state in southern Brazil. Probably linked to agriculture and slash-and-burn deforestation, the fires were detected by Terra MODIS on July 22, 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Mauritania
caption: A Saharan dust storm yellowed the skies over the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Africa on May 21, 2003.

title: Low pressure off the northern California coast
caption: Large low pressure system off the northern California coast

title: Flooding in Afghanistan
caption: Heavy rains in April 2003 led to flooding in southern Afghanistan.

title: Tropical Storm Ana
caption: Tropical Storm Ana in the Atlantic

title: Dust over the Aral Sea
caption: In late April 2003, strong winds were blowing dust over the Aral Sea.

title: Eruption of Chikurachki Volcano in Kuril Islands
caption: Since April 18, 2003, the Chikurachki Volcano in the Kuril Islands has continued to erupt, spreading plumes of ash over the Pacific Ocean. This recent image is from May 13, 2003.

title: Dust storm in Taklimakan
caption: On April 17, 2003, a dust storm was brewing over the Taklimakan Desert in western China.

title: African Dust Reaches Northern Europe
caption: On April 19, 2003, the Sea-viewing Wide Field-of-View Sensor captured this image of African dust lingering over the Atlantic Ocean west of Ireland. MODIS images are available from April 18.

title: Blowing Dust Affects Mexico and the U.S.
caption: On Wednesday, April 15, 2003, strong winds blew dust from northern Mexico up into the United States, affecting Texas and New Mexico.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kujira
caption: This Terra MODIS image from April 16, 2003, shows Super Typhoon Kujira in the Phillipine Sea.

title: Dust Storm over Kazakhstan
caption: North of the Caspian Sea in Kazakhstan, a dust storm was blowing over the arid plains on April 9, 2003.

title: Phytoplankton off South African Coast
caption: On May 1, 2003, a MODIS image shows a bloom of marine organisms still coloring the waters of Western Cape, South Africa.

title: Dust Storm over Lake Chad
caption: A bright swath of dust was blowing over Lake Chad on April 9, 2003.

title: Fires in Argentina and Paraguay
caption: On April 16, 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Aqua satellite detected dozens of fires burning in Paraguay and Argentina.

title: March Rainfall in Tasmania Sets Record
caption: In March 2003, the Australian state of Tasmania received record-setting rainfall.

title: Midwest Snow Storm
caption: Spring snow storm blankets Midwest

title: Smoke Blankets Southeast Asia
caption: On April 7, 2003, the Sea-viewing Wide Field-of-View Sensor (SeaWiFS) captured this image of smoke covering Southeast Asia and spreading eastward toward the Pacific Ocean.

title: Dust Over the Eastern Mediterranean
caption: On April 4, 2003, Aqua MODIS captured this image of a dust storm blowing over the Eastern Mediterranean Sea.

title: Glacial Collapse Threatens Huaraz, Peru
caption: A chunk of glacier is threatening to fall into an Andean lake and could cause major flooding in a Peruvian city of 60,000 residents. This high-resolution Terra ASTER image of the glacier was acquired on Nov. 5, 2001.

title: Gulf Stream in Bloom
caption: This April 3, 2003, SeaWiFS image reveals an abundance of marine plant life blooming in the Gulf Stream's myriad meanders.

title: Fires in Central U.S.
caption: Widespread fires were detected across the central U.S. on April 10, 2003, by the Aqua MODIS instrument.

title: Tropical Cyclone Inigo
caption: Packing sustained winds of 115 mph, Cyclone Inigo was bearing down on Australia's northwestern coast on April 6 and 7, 2003.

title: Smoke over Japan and Pacific Ocean
caption: Smoke from fires across Asia spreads eastward across Japan and the Pacific Ocean on April 2, 2003.

title: Fires Near the Aral Sea
caption: Numerous fires burning along rivers in central Asia were detected by Terra MODIS on April 3, 2003.

title: Torrential Rains in Indonesia
caption: Torrential rains buffet Indonesia

title: Flooding in Zambia
caption: Landsat images from August 2001 and April 2003 show the before and after of massive flooding along the Zambezi River at the border of Zambia and Namibia.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom off West Africa
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom off West Africa brought patterns of green and turquoise to the Atlantic's surface waters on March 29, 2003.

title: Fires in Panama
caption: On Mar. 28, fires in Panama were wafting smoke over the Pacific Ocean.

title: Dust Storm over Sudan
caption: A large dust storm was blowing southward over the country of Sudan on March 26, 2003.

title: Haze over Europe
caption:
During the last weeks of March 2003, unusually high and widespread aerosol pollution was detected
over Europe by a number of satellite sensors.  The Terra MISR sensor provides a new angle on the problem of particulate pollution.

title: Sea Fog Around Scandinavia
caption: Widespread low-level fog continued in the North Sea around Scandinavia on the morning of March 26, 2003.

title: Haze over the United Kingdom
caption: A large low-pressure system off the southweast coast of the United Kingdom was entraining a lot of haze from over northwestern Europe on March 23, 2003.

title: Fires in the Balkans
caption: On Wednesday, March 26, 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer(MODIS) captured this image of widespread fires across the Balkans.

title: Fires in the Southern U.S.
caption: Across the southern United States, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua satellite detected scattered fires burning on April 1, 2003.

title: Haze over Eastern Europe
caption:
Eastern Europe is largely cloud free in today's
SeaWiFS, but a band of hazy air appears to be moving eastward over the area, obscuring part of the Black Sea.

title: Fires in Northeastern Europe
caption: On March 24, 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua satellite captured this image of scattered fires in northeastern Europe.

title: Fires on Kyushu Island, Japan
caption: On Mar. 21, 2003, Aqua MODIS detected several fires on Kyushu Island.

title: Fires in Central Chile
caption: This Aqua MODIS image shows fires in Chile on March 21, 2003.

title: Blizzard Hits Colorado
caption: Parts of Colorado and Wyoming were engulfed in a record-setting blizzard between March 18-19, 2003.  The Rocky Mountains were covered by as much as 87 inches (7.25 feet) of snow in places, and Denver received about 30 inches. This false-color MODIS image shows the extent of the snowcover.

title: Oil Fires in Iraq
caption: Dust has blown in over eastern and southern Iraq on April 9, 2003.

title: Dust Storm Strips Away Australian Topsoil
caption: Strong winds blew topsoil from parched lands in southeastern Australia over the Tasman Sea toward New Zealand.  The SeaWiFS sensor captured this view of the dust plume on March 20, 2003.

title: Fires Surrounding Lake Baikal
caption: Scores of forest fires sourround Lake Baikal in southern Russia and fill the skies with  clouds of smoke on July 6, 2003.

title: Fires in Volga River Delta and Southwest Russia
caption: On March 31, 2003, MODIS detected fires burning in the Volga River Delta and southwestern Russia at the foothills of the Caucasus Mountains.

title: Early Season Fires in Northern China
caption: Terra MODIS captured this image of fires in northern China on March 28, 2003.

title: Dust and Smoke over Iraq and the Middle East
caption: On April 17, 2003, the Aqua satellite captured this image of a dust storm continuing to blow over Saudi Arabia, the Persian Gulf, and Iran.

title: High Winds and Dust in Southern Alaska
caption: An early retreat of snow cover this year exposed glacial silt depostis in south-central Alaska to the brunt of a strong northerly wind in the second week of March 2003, producing streamers of dust that reached out over the Gulf of Alaska.

title: Flooding in Northern Australia
caption: Rivers in northern Australia flooded after Cyclone Craig passed over the Northern Territory in the middle of March 2003.

title: Forest Fire in Southwest Australia
caption: A forest fire near the south coast of Western Australia is being reported as the largest in memory. This MODIS image shows the fire on March 13, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Eseta off Fiji
caption: Tropical Cyclone Eseta is southeast of Fiji in this MODIS image from March 13, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Craig Hits Northern Territory
caption: On March 11, 2003, Tropical Storm Craig was poised to cross over from the Timor Sea to the Gulf of Carpentaria in this MODIS image from the Aqua satellite.

title: Ice Covers the Great Lakes
caption: MODIS imagery from early March shows unusually widespread seasonal ice across the North American Great Lakes.

title: Ship Tracks in the Atlantic
caption: A high number of ship tracks were visible in the clouds off of the coasts of France and Spain in these true- and false-color images from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua satellite on January 27, 2003. Clouds formed from ships tracks are different from those formed natural sources.

title: Fires in Eastern India
caption: Beginning in early March 2003, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Aqua and Terra satellites have been observing biomass burning in eastern India. These recent images are from April 10 and 11.

title: Fires in Eastern Russia
caption: Aqua MODIS detected numerous fires burning near the eastern Russia-China border on April 23, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kalunde
caption: Weakening, but still packing strong winds, Tropical Cyclone Kalunde was located in the central Indian Ocean on March 12, 2003.

title: Fires in Southwest Russia
caption: As winter snow is retreating, fires are springing to life in southwestern Russia. This image from Mar.2 shows fires detected by Aqua MODIS.

title: Fires in Mexico and Central America
caption: For nearly three months, fires have been burning across southern Mexico and Central America, releasing waves of smoke that spread over the Gulf of Mexico, the Pacific Ocean, and the Caribbean Sea.

title: Tropical Cyclone Erica (22P)
caption: Tropical Cyclone Erica washes over New Caledonia in the southwestern Pacific Ocean in this MODIS image from March 13, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Harriet (21S)
caption: Tropical Cyclone 21S off Java

title: Tropical Cyclone Graham (20S)
caption: Tropical Cyclone Graham off Australia

title: Fires in Central South America
caption: On Feb. 26, 2003, the MODIS instrument on the Terra satellite captured an image of scattered fires burning across central South America.

title: Tropical Cyclone Japhet (19S)
caption: Tropical Cyclone Japhet off Madagascar

title: Deadly Earthquake, Xianjing Province, China
caption: A destructive earthquake of magnitude 6.4 rattled China?s Xinjiang province at 10:04 a.m. (local time) on February 24, 2003. More than 250 people were killed.

title: Smoke from Staten Island Refinery Fire
caption: A barge loaded with fuel exploded at a loading dock on Staten Island, NY, on the morning of Feb. 21, 2003, sending a column of thick black smoke into the air.  This true-color image of the smoke plume was taken by the SeaWiFS sensor hours after the explosion.

title: East Coast Snow Storm
caption: From the Carolinas to Canada, wave after wave of wintry weather has dumped heavy snow and rain on much of the northeastern U.S.  This true-color image from SeaWiFS shows the effect of all this precipitation on the surface waters of the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Flooding in Western Australia
caption: In early March 2003, seasonal rains led to mild flooding across western Australia.

title: Dust Storm over Gulf of Oman
caption: Strong winds lofted a thick plume of desert dust across the Gulf of Oman on Feb. 18, 2003, and stirred the waters of the Persian Gulf to the north.

title: Record Rains over Southern California
caption: Rains have fallen over Southern California in record-setting amounts in recent days.  This TRMM image shows the rainfall amounts up to Feb. 13, 2003.

title: Fires in South-central China
caption: Scores of fires were scattered across south-central China and Vietnam on Feb. 9, 2003. This Aqua MODIS image shows active fires marked with red dots.

title: Multiple Cyclones in the Indian Ocean
caption: In the southern Indian Ocean, multiple tropical cyclones are lined up east of Madagascar. This image was made by combining observations from the MODIS instruments on the Terra and Aqua satellites on Feb. 13.

title: South Atlantic Phytoplankton Bloom
caption: Off the east coast of Argentina, the South Atlantic Ocean is blooming with color. This true-color MODIS image from February 10, 2003, shows the waters off southern Argentina swirling with the blues and greens of phytoplankton in bloom.

title: Tropical Cyclone Dovi
caption: Located roughly 1300 km southeast of Samoa, on Feb. 10, 2003, Cyclone Dovi appears headed toward oblivion in the colder waters of the South Pacific.

title: Cyclone 16S off Madagascar
caption: On Feb. 10, 2003, Tropical Cyclone 16S was situated off Madagascar's northeastern coast, packing sustained winds of 84 km per hour (52 mph).

title: Flooding in Madagascar
caption: Heavy seasonal rains and the subsequent arrival of Cyclone Fari in late January 2003 led to flooding in northwestern Madagascar.

title: Tropical Cyclone Fiona
caption: On Feb. 10, 2003, Tropical Cyclone Fiona (14S), was located well south of Sumatra and was moving westward toward the open Indian Ocean.

title: Fires in Eastern Africa Near Lake Victoria
caption: Fires burning in the savannas north of Lake Victoria were detected by the Terra MODIS instrument on April 9, 2003.

title: Fires in Florida and Cuba
caption: On Feb.2, the MODIS instrument on the Aqua satellite detected scattered fires across southern Florida and Cuba.

title: Fires in Southern India
caption: Aqua MODIS detected numerous fires scattered across southern India on Jan. 31, 2003.

title: Sulfur Plume Off Namibia
caption: Off southwest Africa, hydrogen sulfide gas given off by bacteria at the bottom of the ocean bubbles up to the surface and is transformed into pure sulfur. This process was occuring off the Namibian coast in this Terra MODIS image from Jan. 9.

title: Ice in the Chesapeake Bay
caption: Aqua MODIS provided a good look at the aftermath of the winter storm that hit the greater Chesapeake Bay region on Jan. 24, 2003.  This scene reveals a number of pockets of ice forming on part of the bay.

title: Flooding in Western Australia
caption: Flooding in Western Australia

title: Saharan Dust off West Africa
caption: The massive plume of thick Saharan Desert dust continued its westward trek across the Atlantic Ocean on March 6, 2003, being held aloft and swept along by strong winds.  This true-color image combines the perspectives of both Terra and Aqua satellites in one scene.

title: Tropical Cyclone Fari
caption: Tropical Cyclone Fari (11S) off Madagascar.

title: Tropical Storm Beni
caption: Tropical Cyclone Beni (12P), South of Guadalcanal, Solomon Islands.

title: Tropical Cyclone Cilla
caption: Tropical Cyclone Cilla (13P), east of the Fiji Islands, Pacific Ocean.

title: Flooding in Tunisia
caption: Rains in northern Africa have led to wet conditions in Tunisia.

title: Fires in the Pampas and Southern Argentina
caption: Dry season fires were burning in southern Argentina and across the great grasslands known as the Pampas in mid-January 2003.

title: Flooding in Brazil
caption: Intense downpours dislodge hillside villages

title: Fires Across the Southern U.S.
caption: This MODIS image from Feb. 12 shows active fires scattered across the southern United States from Mississippi to South Carolina.

title: Flooding in southeastern Africa
caption: In January 2003 heavy rains led to floods across southeastern Africa.

title: Tropical Cyclone Ami
caption: Tropical Cyclone Ami (10P) north of Fiji, in the Pacific Ocean

title: Dust Storm off Egypt
caption: A large plume of dust from the Saharan Desert was blowing northward over Egypt and Libya and across Mediterranean Sea on Febuary 6, 2003.

title: Bushfires Raging in Southeast Australia
caption: True- and false-color images from Terra MODIS on March 6, 2003, show the huge area burned by the devestating bushfires in southeast Australia.

title: Fires in Southern China
caption: More than a dozen fires are burning in the forested hills surrounding the cities clustered around Hu Men Bay in southern China on January 10, 2003.

title: Tropical Cyclone Ebula
caption: Tropical Cyclone Ebula (09S) east of Rodrigues Island, Indian Ocean

title: Biomass Burning in Eastern Australia
caption: Australia has suffered through one of the most severe droughts in its recorded history over the past few months. This Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) image of eastern Australia shows active fires burning on January 7, 2003.

title: Santa Ana Wind Event Over California
caption: On January 6, 2002, Santa Ana winds blew dust from interior deserts and other dry areas out over California and the Pacific Ocean. This QuikScat image shows the direction and intensity of the winds.

title: Low-Pressure Storm System over Australia
caption: On January 6, 2003, a low-pressure storm system sat over northern Australia.

title: Fires in Southeast Asia
caption: The intense biomass burning in Southeast Asia, ongoing for the last several months, has released high levels of carbon monoxide into the atmosphere over the region, as measured by the Terra MOPITT sensor from April 3-13, 2003.

title: Flooding in Indonesia
caption: Heavy rains during the last week in December 2002 brought flash floods, mudslides, and numerous deaths to inhabitants of the Indonesian Islands of Java and Sulawesi.  More than 360,000 residents have been displaced from their homes.

title: Tropical Cyclone 08S
caption: Tropical Cyclone 08S formed in the Mozambique Channel today and is predicted to make landfall in  Mozambique early on Jan. 1, 2003.

title: Eruption of Stromboli Volcano, Italy
caption: Continuously active for more than 1,000 years, Stromboli Volcano continued its mild activity in January of 2010.

title: Tropical Cyclone Zoe
caption: As of December 30, 2002, Tropical Cyclone Zoe was listed as a Category 5 storm, located northeast of Vanuatu in the South Pacific Ocean.

title: Eruption of Soufriere Hills, Montserrat
caption: Ongoing eruption of the Soufriere Hills Volcano on Montserrat produces occasional ash plumes, such as the one captured in this MODIS image from March 24, 2003.

title: Cyclone Crystal Approaches Mauritius
caption: Cyclone Crystal was approaching the island of Mauritius in the western Indian Ocean on Dec. 26, 2002.

title: Snowstorm Rolls Across the U.S.
caption: The winter of 2002-03 has seen a number of severe winter storms roll across the central United States, leaving a wide swaths of snow from the southern Great Plains region all the way to the east coast.  This latest MODIS scene was acquired on Jan. 23, 2003.

title: Widely Scattered Fires across North Africa
caption: Thousands of fires burning across northwestern and central Africa since November 2002 have been sending heavy smoke as well as high concentrations of carbon monoxide westward across the Atlantic.  This Terra MOPITT scene shows CO measurements from Jan. 27 - Feb. 2, 2003.

title: Dust Storm over Morocco
caption: Strong winds swept dust from the Sahara Desert northwestward over over Morocco and toward the Atlantic Ocean on April 7, 2003.

title: Flooding in Northern California
caption: Heavy rains in mid-December 2002 triggered floods across Northern California.

title: Brown Cloud off of Australia
caption: A large brownish gray cloud sat over the Tasman Sea just off the coast of southeast Australia on December 19, 2002.

title: Nicaragua's San Cristobal Erupts
caption: A small plume of emissions from the San Cristobal Volcano in northwestern Nicaragua was detected by Terra MODIS on December 16, 2002.

title: Fires Across Northern South America
caption: Biomass burning has been particularly intense in northern South America in recent months. This new MOPITT image shows concentrations over the region as recent as March 18, 2003.

title: Low-Pressure System over Northwestern Pacific
caption: A strong low-pressure system sat over the northwestern Pacific just south of Russia?s Kamchatka Peninsula on December 12, 2002.

title: Fires in Central Mexico
caption: In central Mexico, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on the Terra satellite detected several fires in the Altiplano region northeast of the western Sierra Madre Mountains on December 4, 2002.

title: Super Typhoon Pongsona
caption: Super Typhoon Pongsona hits Guam

title: Pollution over Bangladesh and India
caption: A gray layer of pollution hovered over northeast India and Bangladesh on Feb. 14, 2003.

title: Dust over the Arabian Sea
caption: Large plumes of dust from Iran, Pakistan, and the Arabian Peninsula were being blown out over the Arabian Sea on March 2, 2003.

title: East Coast Snow Storm
caption: The season's first snowfall blankets portions of the East and South with icy precipitation and up to 10 inches snow.

title: Flooding in Morocco
caption: In November and December 2002, unusually heavy rains gave rise to floods in western Morocco.

title: Numerous Fires in Southeast Tanzania
caption: Through a patchwork of clouds, Aqua MODIS detected numerous fires (red dots) burning in Tanzania, Africa, on November 25, 2002.

title: Morning and Afternoon Views of Oregon Fires
caption: This pair of true- and false-color images from the MODIS instruments on the Terra and Aqua satellites shows a handful of fires (red dots) in Oregon in the morning and afternoon of November 25, 2002.

title: Late Dry Season Fires in Brazil
caption: In northeastern Brazil, the dry season is coming to a close with scores of fires (red dots) crackling across the tropical landscape. This true-color Aqua MODIS image was captured on November 24, 2002.

title: Late Season Fires in California
caption: On Monday afternoon, November 25, 2002, the Aqua MODIS instrument captured this true-color image of fires (red outlines) burning in California.

title: Fires Across Southern United States
caption: A mixture of prescribed fires and active wildfires were detected across several southern U.S. states by Terra MODIS on November 23, 2002.

title: Fires in the Foothills of the Caucasus Mountains
caption: In late November, fires were scattered across the plains of southwest Russia and the foothills of the Caucasus Mountains. This true-color image was captured by Aqua MODIS on November 23, 2002.

title: Pollution over China
caption: The MODIS sensor aboard NASA's Aqua satellite observed a heavy, gray pall of haze over Eastern China on Feb. 19, 2003.

title: Dense Fog in Central California
caption: A thick bank of fog nestled down into the interior valleys of California on November 20, 2002. This Terra MODIS image captured around 11 a.m. local time shows the fog as a white blanket in the San Joaquin Valley.

title: Oil Slick Along the Spanish Coast
caption: A damaged oil tanker off the northwest coast of Spain split in half on Nov. 19, 2002, leaking more than a million gallons of oil into the Atlantic—some of which is now washing ashore in Spain.

title: India Cyclone
caption: Cyclone hits India's eastern coast

title: Scattered Fires Across Eastern South Africa
caption: In early November, scattered fires burned across eastern South Africa in the Drakensberg Mountains.

title: Biomass Burning in Paraguay
caption: On November 9, 2002, scores of fires blanketed the southeast portion of Paraguay in South America.

title: Dust Storm in China
caption: On Nov. 11, 2002, NASA's Terra satellite observed a large dust storm blowing over northeastern China while there is widespread haze and pollution over southeastern China.

title: Fires and Gas Flares in Persian Gulf Countries
caption: On November 4, 2002, the Terra MODIS instrument captured this image of fires and oil well gas flares in several countries surrounding the Persian Gulf.

title: Spring Fires in  Southwest Australia
caption: The summertime dry season hasn’t even begun, but southwest Australia is already experiencing numerous large wildfires in early November 2002.

title: Late-Season Fires near Amur River
caption: Even as winter approaches, what are most likely agricultural fires still burn in early November near the Amur River at the border of China and Russia.

title: Widely Scattered Fires across Central Africa
caption: Thousands of fires continue to burn across northwestern and central Africa as of December 24, 2002.

title: Fires in West Africa
caption: On April 9, 2003, Aqua MODIS detected a high concentration of fires in Sierra Leone in West Africa.

title: Magnitude 7.9 Earthquake Strikes South-Central Alaska
caption: An extremely intense earthquake struck South-Central Alaska at 1:12 PM local time on November 3, 2002 with a magnitude of 7.9. The quake was strong enough to damag the Alaska Pipelineâ€™s supports (the pipeline itself did not break), and crack nearby roads. No injuries were reported.

title: Fires in Mozambique
caption: Numerous fires were burning along the coast of Mozambique on November 4, 2002.

title: Ash from Erupting El Reventador Blankets Quito
caption: Situated roughly 60 miles northeast of Quito, El Reventador erupted suddenly on Nov. 3, 2002, sending a cloud of ash 10 miles into the sky. Much of the ash settled onto Ecuador's capital city and the surrounding countryside, prompting the president to declare a state of emergency.

title: Floundering Oil Tanker Off Rio de Janeiro
caption: This IKONOS satellite image shows the rescue efforts underway to salvage a floundering Brazilian oil tanker located 50 miles off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.  The image was taken on Oct. 15, 2002.

title: Saharan Dust Storm in Chad
caption: In central Africa, a dust storm was blowing over the country of Chad on October 31, 2002. Events like these are likely contributing to the encroachment of dunes into the vegetation around Lake Chad, also pictured in this true-color MODIS image from the Terra satellite.

title: Dust Shrouds the Eastern Mediterranean
caption:
On October 18, 2002, a large dust plume extended across countries
bordering the eastern Mediterranean Sea. Information on the horizontal
and vertical extent of the dust are provided by these views from the
Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR).

title: Eruption of Sicily's Mt. Etna
caption: Sicily's Mt. Etna began erupting on Oct. 27, and two months later is still emitting a plume of ash and smoke.

title: Burn Scars and Late-Season Fires in Kazakhstan
caption: These images of southern Russia (top) and Kazakhstan (bottom) from  August through October 2002 reveal scattered fires burning over an already widely burned region. Fires have burned in the region on and off all summer long, leaving their dark marks across the landscape.

title: Dust Storm over Eastern Australia
caption: A large dust storm was blowing eastward toward Australia’s eastern coast on Oct. 23, 2002.  A number of smoke plumes were also visible from several large fires in eastern Australia.

title: Hurricane Kenna
caption: Hurricane Kenna, located in the northeastern Pacific Ocean, was upgraded to a category 5 hurricane on Oct. 25.  This recent image shows the storm bearing down on Mexico's west coast.

title: Fires Burn in Java?s Islands of Forest
caption: Java’s remaining forests are clustered in island patches scattered across the country. This Terra MODIS image shows fires burning in the remaining forests on October 19, 2002.

title: Dust Storm over Cyprus
caption: A large plume of desert dust filled the skies over Cyprus on Oct. 19, 2002.

title: Pollution over East China
caption: A thick pall of greyish pollution filled the skies over eastern China on Oct. 16, 2002.  Dozens of fires could also be seen burning at various locations.

title: Fires Near Indus River
caption: Active fire detections in India near the fertile lands near the Indus River probably signify seasonal agricultural burning. These images were captured in mid-October 2002 by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer.

title: Fires Across South Central U.S.
caption: The Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer on the Terra satellite detected several fires burning across parts of the south-central United States on October 16, 2002.

title: Fires in Eastern Brazil
caption: Eastern Brazil experiences scores of fires in mid-October, 2002. This MODIS image from October 14 shows fires scattered across tens of thousands of square kilometers.

title: Tropical Depression 14
