caption: Another tropical depression formed in the Caribbean Sea this week and on Oct. 14, 2002, passed over Cuba. However, the storm appears to be losing strength is not predicted to gain in intensity.

title: Tropical Storm Kyle
caption: Tropical Storm Kyle in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Fires Across Northwest Australia
caption: Dry season fires are scattered across the northern part of Australia in October 2002. This image shows Northern Territory and Western Australia.

title: Large Bushfires in Central Australia
caption: NASA?s MODIS instrument detected numerous large bushfires near the town of Alice Springs in Australia?s Northern Territory on October 9, 2002. False-color imagery shows the extent of the burned area.

title: Fires on New Guinea
caption: Numerous fires dot Pulau Dolak Peninsula on the island of New Guinea. These images were acquired by MODIS in October 2002.

title: Fire Danger Extreme in New South Wales
caption: Since early October 2002, New South Wales, Australia, has been battling a difficult fire season. This recent image shows fires burning in Kosciuszko National Park on January 10, 2003.

title: Fires on Cape York Peninsula, Australia
caption: Drought and wildfire haven’t let go of Queenland?s Cape York Peninsula  on Dec. 12, 2002. Active fires dot the landscape.

title: Hurricane Lili’s Rainfall Footprint
caption: From Oct. 3-4, 2002, Hurricane Lili dumped heavy rains across southern and central Louisiana.  These TRMM images map the rainfall accumulations across the region.

title: Hurricane Lili’s Rainfall Footprint
caption: From Oct. 3-4, 2002, Hurricane Lili dumped heavy rains across southern and central Louisiana.  These TRMM images map the rainfall accumulations across the affected region.

title: Hurricane Lili
caption: These new GOES 8 images of Hurricane Lili show the storm shortly after the eye made landfall in Louisiana.

title: Isidore Stirs Up the Gulf Coast
caption: Hurricane Isidore churned up the waters all along the Gult Coastline—both by increased wave action associated with the passing storm and increased rainwater runoff from the land.  This pair of images shows a dramatic increase in the amount sediment in the Gulf Coast waters.

title: Indonesia’s Ruang Volcano Erupts
caption: Mount Ruang, a stratovolcano in the Indonesian Sulawesi Islands, erupted on Sept. 25, sending a large plume of ash streaming westward toward Borneo and Sumatra.

title: Typhoon Higos
caption: Typhoon Higos churning in western Pacific Ocean.

title: Isidore Dumps Heavy Rains on Southeastern U.S.
caption: On Sept. 26, Tropical Storm Isidore came ashore in Louisiana and moved northward, bringing high winds and heavy rains inland, and causing flash flooding in some locations.  This TRMM image and animation shows rainfall accumulations on the ground over a 5-day period.

title: Tropical Storm Mekkhala Hits China
caption: Packing sustained winds of 55 knots and gusts of more than 70 knots, Tropical Storm Mekkhala hit China on Sept. 25, 2002.

title: Russian Kolka Glacier Collapses
caption: On Sept. 20, 2002, part of the Kolka Glacier on Mt. Kazbek collapsed, triggering a massive avalanche through the Karmadon Gorge in North Ossetia, Russia.  This comparison pair of ASTER images shows the extent of the area affected by the landslide.

title: Isidore Brings Heavy Rains to Cuba
caption: On September 23, Hurricane Isidore tracked south of Cuba and produced up to 40 inches of rain over western Cuba, the Isle of Youth, and adjacent waters before passing into the Gulf of Mexico.  This false-color TRMM image, and animation, shows rain accumulation over time.

title: Williams Fire Northeast of Los Angeles
caption: The fast-moving Williams Fire northeast of Los Angeles is affecting several thousand acres of Angeles National Forest in the San Gabriel Mountains. Dozens of homes in nearby suburbs are threatened.

title: Tropical Storm Isidore
caption: With sustained winds of 65 miles per hour and heavy rains, the remnant of Hurricane Isidore was already battering the coast of Louisiana on the evening of September 25, hours before the eye of the storm was expected to make landfall.  As much as 20 inches of rain is expected in some areas.

title: Fires and Smoke in Eastern Russia
caption: In September and October 2002, numerous fires in eastern Russia created a smoke plume that stretched eastward over the Sea of Okhotsk and southward into China. These true-color images were captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) instruments on the Terra and Aqua satellites.

title: Flooding in Southern France
caption: Torrential rains led to severe flooding in southern France that killed as many as 26 people and forced hundreds from their homes.

title: New York City
caption: New York City from Landsat 7

title: Widespread  Fires in South America
caption: In September and October 2002, numerous fires raged across central South America, choking the skies with thick smoke. These images show parts of  Bolivia, Argentina, Uruguay, and southern Brazil.

title: Tropical Storm Hagupit
caption: Tropical Storm Hagupit was closing in on Hong Kong on September 11, 2002.

title: Tropical Storm Gustav
caption: Tropical Storm Gustav brought high surf and heavy rains to the North Carolina coast before veering northeast on September 10, 2002.

title: Shrinking Lake Chad
caption: Regional climate change and human demand for fresh water in central Africa continues to threaten the future of Lake Chad.

title: Tropical Storm Fay
caption: Tropical Storm Fay formed on September 5, 2002, in the Gulf of Mexico before coming ashore in Texas.

title: Flooding in Algeria
caption: Heavy rains in Algeria over the past few weeks have led to deadly flooding.

title: Tropical Storm Dolly off the Leeward Islands
caption: Tropical Storm Dolly was near peak strength and heading northeast in the central Atlantic near the Leeward Islands on September 2, 2002.

title: Hurricane Hernan
caption: Hurricane Hernan was moving northwest in the Pacific Ocean just off the coast of Baja California on September 3, 2002.

title: Tropical Storm Edouard
caption: Tropical Storm Edouard creates a bank of clouds off the southeast Atlantic Coast on September 2, 2002.

title: Typhoon Sinlaku
caption: On September 7, 2002, Typhoon Sinlaku made landfall over eastern China.

title: Typhoon Ele
caption: Typhoon Ele was moving north in the central Pacific on September 4, 2002

title: Flooding in Indochina
caption: Seasonal rains in Indochina from August into October 2002 gave rise to deadly floods across the peninsula

title: Typhoon Rusa
caption: Typhoon Rusa was moving across southern Japan and toward Korea on August 29, 2001.

title: Mt.Zirkel Complex fire in Colorado
caption: The Mt. Zirkel fire in Colorado was burning 25 miles north of the town of Steamboat Springs on August 27, 2002. The fire has encroached onto private lands and remains a threat to ranches, crops, and outbuildings in the area.

title: Trick Fire near Williams, Arizona
caption: Drought condiitons in late August 2002 are forcing firefighters to haul in water from Grand Canyon National Park to Williams, Arizona via railroad car in order to combat the Trick Fire.

title: Hurricane Fausto
caption: Hurricane Fausto started on August 21, 2002, and grew to Cateogry 4 Hurricane status in only three days. It's westward track kept the West Coast out of danger.

title: Coccolithophores in the Barents Sea
caption: On August 21, 2002, a bloom of marine organisms called coccolithophores were coloring the waters of the Barents Sea bright blue.

title: Widlfires and Haze over Borneo
caption: Haze from fires is thick over the Indonesian island of Borneo in late summer and fall 2002. Scores of wildfires (red dots) were detected by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer instruments on the Terra and Aqua satellites.

title: Flooding along Danube River
caption: Heavy rains in Central and Eastern Europe over the past few weeks have led to some of the worst flooding the region has witnessed in over 100 years.

title: Flooding on Elbe River
caption: Heavy rains in Central Europe over the past few weeks have led to some of the worst flooding along the river in over 100 years.

title: Eruption of Pago
caption: Mount Pago on the island of New Britain, New Guinea, has been erupting since July 2002.  About 8,000 people have been evacuated from villages surrounding the volcano.

title: Typhoon Phanfone
caption: Typhoon Phanfone was moving northeast up the coast of Japan on August 18, 2002.

title: Tropical Storm Cristobal
caption: Cristobal was the third named tropical storm of the 2002 Atlantic hurricane season. It formed off the coast of Florida and steadily moved northeastward.

title: Tropical Storm Bertha in the Gulf of Mexico
caption: Tropical Storm Bertha came ashore just 20 miles south of New Orleans on August 4, 2002.

title: Smoke Blankets Moscow
caption: Thick smoke from a number of wildfires burning in southwestern Russia filled the skies over Moscow on July 30 and 31.

title: Bright Water Off Newfoundland
caption: A large coccolithophore bloom off the southern coast of Newfoundland colored the North Atlantic surface waters a bright turquoise on July 29.

title: Smoke, Clouds and Ship Tracks Off California Coast
caption: A rather large smoke plume was visible streaming westward from California and Oregon on July 29, while a number of ship tracks were visible to the west and Tropical Storm Elida approached from the south.

title: Fires in Central and Southern Africa
caption: Hundreds of fires were burning in several central and southern African countries during the annual burning season. These images show fires scattered across Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania, Angola, and Zambia from late July and into September 2002.

title: Nyamuragira Volcano Erupts
caption: Plumes of water vapor, sulfur dioxide, carbon dioxide, fluorine, and chlorine gas escape from Africa’s Nyamuragira and Nyiragongo Volcanoes.

title: Severe Snowstorm in Lesotho
caption: A severe storm dumped several feet of snow in the Drakensberg Mountains of Lesotho and Republic of South Africa over the weekend of July 20, 2002, and was resposible for the deaths of at least 20 people.

title: Hurricane Elida off Central America
caption: Hurricane Elida was moving northwest in the eastern Pacific Ocean just southwest of Baja California on July 25, 2002.

title: Hurricane Douglas South of Baja California
caption: Hurricane Douglas was moving west in the eastern Pacific Ocean just on July 24, 2002.

title: McNalley and Pines Fires in California
caption: In late July and August 2002, the McNalley Fire in Sequoia National Forest and the Pines Fire near San Diego consumed over a hundred thousand acres in California

title: Super Typhoon Fengshen
caption: Tropical Storm Fengshen was moving toward China on July 26, 2002.

title: Floods In Bangladesh and India
caption: For the first two weeks of July 2002 floods ravaged eastern India and northern Bangladesh.

title: Tropical Storm Cristina
caption: Tropical Storm Cristina was due southwest of the Baja California peninsula on July 14, 2002, moving slowly northward.

title: Fires Scorch Oregon
caption: Several large wildfires burned out of control in Oregon through most of July and into August 2002, while there was also fire activity in Washington and California.

title: Super Typhoon Halong in Western Pacific
caption: On the heels of Tropical Storm Chataan, Super Typhoon Halong sped past Taiwan and and hit southern Japan on July 15, 2002.

title: Fires and Smoke in Eastern China
caption: Widespread burning in eastern China has been impacting air quality throughout summer and into fall 2002.

title: Canadian Smoke off Norway
caption: Smoke from Canadian wildfires has crossed the Atlantic Ocean and arrived over the shores of Norway on July 12.

title: Heavy Smoke over China
caption: There was a thick layer of smog over central portions of China on July 11, while a thick pall of smoke from dozens of fires in the east obscured the Chinese coastline.

title: Dust Storm over the Red Sea
caption: A large plume of dust was blowing across the Red Sea toward the Arabian Peninsula from Northeastern Africa on July 11.

title: Typhoon Chataan off Japan
caption: Typhoon Chataan was approaching the southern coast of Japan on July 9, 2002.

title: Smoke from Canadian Fires Blankets Eastern U.S.
caption: A number of large, intense wildfires burning in eastern Canada sent a large plume of smoke southward along U.S. east coast in early July. This latest image from the MISR instrument reveals just how thick that smoke plume was.

title: Typhoon Rammasun on China Coast
caption: On July 4, 2002, Typhoon Rammasun was draped over China and Taiwan.

title: Floods Devastate Southeastern Texas
caption: A week of rains in early July 2002 brought flooding to San Antonio and other parts of southeastern Texas.

title: Fires in Quebec, Canada, Send Smoke to U.S.
caption: In early July, heavy smoke from wildfires in Quebec, Canada, south of James Bay has drifted south into the Great Lakes and Northeast regions of the United States.

title: Fires in Wyoming and South Dakota
caption: Large fires continue to break out across the West. This image from MODIS shows fires in Wyoming and South Dakota on June 30, 2002.

title: Flooding in Southern Russia
caption: Over the last two weeks of June 2002, heavy rains inundated southern Russia, giving rise to massive flooding.

title: Flooding in Central Siberia
caption: A mixture of snowmelt and ice jams in late May and June of 2002 caused flooding along the Taz River and the Yenisey River.

title: Rodeo and Chediski Fires in Arizona
caption: The Rodeo and Chediski Fires in east-central Arizona are burning within the Fort Apache Indian Reservation about 100 miles east-northeast of Phoenix.

title: Cannon Fire in California and Nevada
caption: The Cannon Fire south of Lake Tahoe has grown to more than 22,000 acres, but is coming under containment as of Monday, June 24, 2002.

title: Flooding in Northern Minnesota
caption: Heavy rains over the past few weeks have caused massive flooding across northern Minnesota and southern Canada in June 2002.

title: Flooding in Western Siberia
caption: Heavy rains, snowmelt, and ice jams in May and June 2002 caused flooding along the Ob River in Central Russia.

title: Code Red Air over Mid-Atlantic States
caption: The EPA issued a code red warning for air quality over much of the Mid-Atlantic region, including Washington, D.C., on June 11.  This true-color scene shows hazy conditions over much of the eastern United States.

title: Widespread Burning across South Central Africa
caption: The southern African fire season is underway in the summer of 2002. These images show fire locations on June 3 and September 4, 2002.

title: Fires and Smoke Across Japan
caption: There were a number of fires burning across several Japanese islands on June 3, while a pall of greyish smoke was visible blowing in from mainland Asia.

title: Widespread Smoke, Fires Across Eastern China
caption: Many fires were burning across the Henan Province in eastern China on June 7, filling the skies with a thick pall of greyish smoke as far north as Beijing.

title: Rocky Mountain Fires
caption: Numerous large wildfires are scorching the western United States in June. Firefighters in Utah, Colorado, and New Mexico are battling several large fires, including the 100,000+ acre Hayman Fire southwest of Denver, Colorado.

title: Ice Floes off Labrador
caption: With the onset of spring in the Northern Hemisphere, ice is breaking up along the coast of Labrador, Canada.  This May 28 image over the area shows floes of crushed ice flowing out into the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Dam Break in Syria
caption: On June 4, 2002, the Zeyzoun dam in northern Syria ruptured and collapsed, killing 20 people and leaving thousands more homeless.

title: Middle Ponil Complex Fire, New Mexico
caption: Several large wildfires, including the 60,000-acre Middle Ponil Complex Fire, were detected by MODIS on June 3, 2002.

title: Wolf and Copper Fires Near Los Angeles
caption: The Wolf and Copper Fires northwest and north of Los Angeles, California, started on June 1, 2002, and has spread rapidly in the hot, dry conditions.

title: Flooding in Siberia
caption: Ice jams at the mouth of the Lena River have caused flooding throughout Siberia in late May and early June 2002.

title: Fires and Deforestation in Brazil
caption: Scores of fires were burning in central Brazil from mid-May well into fall 2002.

title: Flooding in Central China
caption: Heavy, frequent rains in central China during the summer of 2002 gave rise to heavy flooding throughout the country.

title: Bullock Fire
caption: Fifteen miles northeast of Tucson, Arizona, over a thousand firefighters and fire management personnel are working to contain a large wildfire that has already scorched nearly 21,000 acres in the mountainous area. The Bullock Fire started on May 21, 2002, and has been difficult to control due to rugged terrain and extremely dry fuels such as grasses and chaparral.

title: Borrego Fire in Northern New Mexico
caption: For the past week, the Borrego Fire in northern New Mexico has consumed over 12,000 acres of land in and around the Sante Fe National Forest.

title: Hurricane Alma in the Eastern Pacific Ocean
caption: The eastern pacific Ocean is experiencing its first named storm of the 2002 season, Hurricane Alma.

title: Fires in Eastern Russia and Sakhalin Island
caption: Fires burning in eastern Russia and on Sakhalin Island are blanketing the area with smoke in late May.

title: Fires along Lena River near Yakutsk
caption: In eastern Siberia, fires ahve been burning around the Russian city of Yakutsk on the Lena River off and on from May through August 2002.

title: Fires and Heavy Smoke in Alaska
caption: Unusually hot and dry conditions in Alaska gave an early May start to the annual fire season, and wildfires continue to blaze across the state in August 2002.

title: Fires in Canada's Prairie Provinces
caption: Numerous fires were burning in Canada in the the prairies of Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba from late May well into June 2002.

title: Black Sea Becomes Turquoise
caption: From the unique vantage point of space, the Black Sea’s surface waters appeared bright turquoise on May 14. The striking coloration there is due to a large phytoplankton bloom.

title: Phytoplankton in the Gulf of Alaska
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom colored the surface waters of the Gulf of Alaska various shades of green on May 20.

title: Flooding in Eastern Africa
caption: During the first two weeks of May 2002, heavy, incessant rains pelted east Africa, giving rise to floods and mudslides in Tanzania.

title: Smoke from Eastern Russia
caption: Extensive fires in Eastern Russia have been sending a large volume of smoke eastward over the Sea of Okhotsk and toward the Pacific. These images are from May 17 and 18, 2002.

title: The Beginnings of Typhoon Hagibis
caption: In mid-May Typhoon Hagibis was just getting started in the western Pacific Ocean north of New Guinea.

title: Flooding on the Ohio and Mississippi Rivers
caption: In mid-May 2002, heavy rains gave rise to floods all across the midwestern United States, killing 8 people and forcing many more from their homes.

title: Blackjack Bay Fire in Okefenokee Refuge
caption: A lightning strike on April 30, 2002, started a complex of fires in Okefenokee Wildlife Refuge in southeast Georgia that has burned almost one-fourth of the refuge's 400,000 acres.

title: Scores of Wildfires in Russia's Krasnoyarsk Region
caption: On May 4, southern Siberia was experiencing hundreds of wildfires. These images are from the Krasnoyarsk region in south-central Russia.

title: Fire and Ice in Northeast Asia
caption: Smoke from forest fires in eastern Russia obscured parts of the Sea of Okhotsk on May 10, 2002.

title: North Atlantic in Bloom
caption: There was a large phytoplankton bloom in the North Atlantic off the coast of North America on May 11.

title: Fires in Southeastern Russia
caption: Fires burning across southeastern Russia in  May are filling the air with smoke that reaches for miles.

title: Fires in Central and Southern Africa
caption: Many fires were burning throughout the Democratic Republic of Congo, Angola, and Zambia through May and well into June 2002.

title: Fires Near Lake Baikal, Russia
caption: Dozens of fires were burning near Russia's Lake Baikal in late April and early May of 2002.

title: Dust Storm over Libya
caption: A large plume of Saharan Desert dust was blowing over Libya and northward across the Mediterranean Sea on May 6.

title: Whiting of Lake Erie
caption: The surface waters of Lake Erie were colored a bright turquoise on May 4, probably by elevated levels of calcium carbonate sediment.

title: Fires in South Central Russia
caption: Over a hundred fires were burning in south-central Russia on April 28, 2002.

title: Tropical Cyclone Kesiny
caption: Cyclone Kesiny was moving southwest in the Indian Ocean towards northern Madagascar at 6:45 UTC on May 6, 2002.

title: Fires in Pacific Northwest
caption: Scattered fires were burning in Washington and Oregon on April 24, 2002.

title: Floods in Uruguay
caption: Flooding was evident in a number of rivers in Argentina and Uruguay on April 28, including along parts of the Parana and Uruguay Rivers.

title: Dark Water near Rio de la Plata
caption: On April 28 there was very bright, sediment-laden water being discharged from the Rio de la Plata of South America into the Atlantic Ocean.  Along the coast to the northwest, however, there was a large, very dark patch of water.

title: Tornado Hits La Plata, Maryland
caption: Powerful thunderstorms swept through the mid-Atlantic states on April 28, spawning an F4 intensity tornado that ripped through La Plata, Maryland, destroying much of its historic downtown and claiming at least three lives.

title: Fires Along the Volga River
caption: There were many fires burning in Southern Russia along the Volga River on April 22.

title: Deforestation in Brazil
caption: This relatively clear scene acquired on April 21 over Brazil reveals the widespread deforestation taking place where the Xingu River flows into the Mato Grosso region.

title: Vapor Trails over Canada
caption: Many airplaine contrails were visible over southern Nova Scotia on April 12.

title: Biomass Burning in Sudan
caption: Dozens of fires were burning in southern Sudan on April 9.

title: Fires in Venezuela
caption: There were many fires burning in Venezuela on April 9, 2002.

title: Fires in Western Russia
caption: There were many fires burning in Western Russia throughout the summer of 2002. Beginning in April and continuing into September, an unusally active fire season created smoky skies all summer long.

title: Heavy Sediment from the Yangtze River
caption: The sediment discharge from the Yangtze River into the East China Sea colored the waters along the Chinese coastline light brown on April 12.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom Off Portugal
caption: Turquoise swirls marked the presence of a large phytoplankton bloom off the coast of Portugal on April 23, 2002.

title: Phytoplankton Bloom Around New Zealand
caption: A large phytoplankton bloom brightened the water around New Zealand on April 7, 2002.

title: Chiliques Volcano, Chile
caption: The Chiliques volcano, which hasnâ€™t erupted in at least 10,000 years, is now showing signs of life.

title: Smoke Plume from Mount Etna
caption: A smoke plume from Mount Etna that is streaming almost directly to the East.

title: Dust Storm in Burkina Faso
caption: A large cloud of Saharan Desert dust blew southward across Burkina Faso on April 10, 2002.

title: Ash Fall Around Shiveluch Volcano
caption: Unrest at Sheveluch Volcano on Russia?s Kamchatka Peninsula continues. This image shows ash fall from recent small eruptions.

title: Miyake-Jima Eruptions
caption: Japan’s Miyake-Jima continues to erupt and discharge significant quantites of sulfur dioxide gas from the summit crater.

title: Three Sisters Volcanoes
caption: The ground near one of the long-dormant Three Sisters volcanoes in Oregon’s Cascade Mountains has risen approximately 10 centimeters since 1996, meaning that underground magma is slowly flowing into the area.

title: Biomass Burning in Southeast Asia
caption: Many fires continued to burn throughout Southeast Asia, mostly concentrated in Myanmar on April 8, 2002.

title: Fires in the Philippines
caption: Roughly a dozen fires dotted the landscape on the main Philippine island of Luzon on April 1, 2002.

title: Wildfires in Northern Australia
caption: A number of wildfires were burning in Northern Australia on April 4, 2002

title: Flooding Along the Danube River
caption: Heavy rains in late March across Eastern Europe caused flooding along the Danube River.

title: NASA Images Confirm New York Drought
caption: Recent Terra images of the low water levels in the Ashokan Reservoir in the Catskill Mountains illustrate the current drought emergency facing residents of the New York City metropolitan area. New Yorkers depend upon this reservoir, and other reservoirs like it, for fresh water.

title: Dust over North Atlantic Ocean
caption: There was a heavy concentration of aerosol over the North Atlantic Ocean off the Canadian coast on April 2, 2002. It is unclear whether this dust is from the Asian dust storm.

title: Fires in Mexico and Central America
caption: The burning across the Mexican and Central American landscape throughout April has continued into May. On May 22, 2002, there were still scores of fires burning in the Sierra Madre Mountains in Mexico.

title: Wildfires in Okavango Delta
caption: There were a number of wildfires burning in the Okavango Delta, Botswana, on March 31, 2002.

title: Asian Dust Reaches Alaska
caption: Another wave of Asian dust was observed arriving on the northwestern shores of North America from the massive dust storm that originated in China on March 17, 2002. This latest SeaWiFS scene was acquired on April 13.

title: Dust over Much of Western Asia
caption: There were a number of large dust plumes blowing in parts of Western Asia on March 27, 2002.

title: Dust and Pollution over China
caption: There is a thick pall of haze over Eastern China, while there appears to be a new dust storm blowing out from the deserts of Mongolia on March 29, 2002.

title: Dust over Cape Verde
caption: Saharan dust has been blowing intermittently over the Cape Verde Islands off Africa’s northwest coast. This latest Terra MODIS image shows a brownish shroud of dust over the region on June 3.

title: Haze and Pollution over Western Europe
caption: Widespread haze and pollution was visible over much of Western Europe on March 28 and 29, 2002, as two low-pressure systems approached from the west.

title: Dust Over East Africa and Israel
caption: A large cloud of dust blew from northeastern Africa across Egypt, the Sinai Peninsula, and over Israel into the Middle East region on March 19, 2002.

title: Black Water off the Gulf Coast of Florida
caption: Mysterious black water appeared off the Gulf Coast of Florida in late winter 2002.  The black water returned to the waters off Sanibel Island in August 2002.

title: Anchorage Receives Record Snowfall
caption: Anchorage, Alaska, received 28.6 inches of snow this weekend, surpassing by far the previous record of snowfall for a 24-hour period.

title: Snow Cover Across Scandinavia
caption: Most of Scandinavia is covered by snow, as seen in this rare cloud-free scene acquired on March 15, 2002.

title: Dust Cloud over Sea of Japan
caption: Large plumes of dust continuted to blow out from East Asia over the Sea of Japan on April 14.

title: Fires and Smoke in Thailand
caption: Many fires continue to burn across Southeast Asia, filling the skies with a thick pall of smoke. This most recent scene over the region was acquired on April 5, 2002.

title: “Bull’s Eye” — The Richat Structure, Mauritania
caption:
This prominent circular feature in the Sahara desert of Mauretania has attracted attention 
since the earliest space missions.

title: Fires and Heavy Smoke in Sumatra
caption: Over the first two weeks of March, fires on Sumatra, Indonesia, bathed the island in a thick pall of smoke.  The most recent MODIS and MISR images were acquired on March 13, 2002.

title: Typhoon Mitag Northeast of the Philippines
caption: Now downgraded to a tropical depression, Typhoon Mitag is shown at full strength when it was located northeast of the Philippines in this true-color image taken on March 6, 2002.

title: Cyclone Hary Off Madagascar
caption: Cyclone Hary was located due east of Madagascar on March 12, 2002, moving southward slowly.

title: Red Tide Strands South African Rock Lobsters
caption: Red Tide Strands South African Rock Lobsters

title: Dust Storm over the Mediterranean Sea
caption: There was a large cloud of dust blowing from Northern Africa over the Mediterranean Sea on March 4, 2002.

title: Chikurachki Volcano
caption: Chikurachki volcano located on Paramushir Island in the North Kuriles began erupting on January 25, 2002.

title: Fires in Western Africa
caption: Many fires were burning all across the Sahel region of Africa throughout February 2000, filling the skies with thick smoke and haze.

title: Flooding in Brazil
caption: The Ilha do Bananal wetlands, along the Araguaia River in central Brazil, have been flooded since early January 2002.

title: Smoke Plume from Mt. Etna
caption: A thin, faint smoke plume was observed coming from Mt. Etna on Feb. 28, 2002.

title: Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa, Hawaii
caption: There is snow atop the Mauna Loa and Mauna Kea volcanoes in Hawai‘i; meanwhile the ongoing eruption of Kilauea continues.

title: Flooding on the Fitzroy River, Australia
caption: Heavy rains in northwestern Australia early in the week of Feb. 24, 2002, caused flooding all along the Fitzroy River.

title: Dust Over Great Australian Bight
caption: SeaWiFS captured this view of a dust cloud over the Great Australian Bight on Feb. 25, 2002.

title: Smoke Plume from Mt. Oyama
caption: A large, greyish volcanic plume was blowing eastward from Mt. Oyama on the Japanese island of Miyake-jima on Feb. 21, 2002.

title: Low-pressure System Off Australia
caption: There was a large low-pressure system off Australia's southern coast on Feb. 20, 2002.

title: Cyclone Guillaume Off Reunion Island
caption: Cyclone Guillaume was moving southeast in the Indian Ocean off of the coast of Madagascar at 10:20 a.m. local time on Tuesday, Febuary 19, 2002.

title: Wildfires in Chile
caption: Large wildfires south of Santiago, Chile, consumed thousands of acres of prized forests and filled the skies with smoke on Feb. 5, 2002.

title: Massive Dust Plume Emanates from China
caption: A large plume of dust and smoke was blowing eastward from Northern China, across the Yellow Sea, toward Japan on Feb. 12, 2002.

title: Saharan Dust over the Atlantic
caption: A large plume of African dust and smoke blew out over the Atlantic Ocean on Feb. 11, 2002, some of which appeared to be heading for Europe.

title: Plumes over Baja California
caption: Large dust plumes were observed blowing westward from the Baja California Peninsula on Feb. 10, 2002, as a large wildfire burned out of control near Fallbrook, California.

title: Colima Volcano Erupts in Mexico
caption: Red-hot rocks began falling down the slopes of Colima Volcano on February 5, 2002, which had been spewing smoke, ash and vapor for days.

title: Smoke Over Southern Andes Mountains
caption: There appeared to be some large fires burning in the Southern Andes Mountains on Feb. 6, 2002.

title: Cyclone Chris Hits Australia
caption: Packing wind gusts of up to 200 km per hour (125 mph), Cyclone Chris came ashore of Australia’s northwestern coast, on February 6, 2002, and passed just south of Port Hedland.

title: Dust Storm Off Southern Coast of Iceland
caption: There was a large plume of brownish dust blowing out over the North Atlantic Ocean from Iceland?s southern coast on May 11-12, 2002.

title: Réunion Island Volcano Erupts
caption: The Piton de la Fournaise volcano on the French island of Réunion erupted on January 5, 2002, sending a river of lava running down its eastern flank and into the Indian Ocean.

title: Tropical Cyclone 10s (Dina)
caption: Tropical Cyclone 10S (Dina) northeast of Mauritius and Reunion Islands.

title: Nyiragongo Volcano Erupts in the Congo
caption: Mount Nyiragongo, located in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, erupted on January 17, 2002, ejecting a large cloud of smoke and ash high into the sky and spewing lava down three sides of the volcano. One river of lava flowed right through the center of Goma and into Lake Kivu, effectively bisecting the city.

title: Smog Obscures Chinese Coast
caption: Most of eastern China has been covered by a thick greyish shroud of aerosol pollution for much of the last couple of months.

title: Dust Storm Hits Canary Islands
caption: A thick pall of Saharan Desert sand and dust engulfed the Canary Islands on April 22, 2002.

title: Thick Haze Over Northern India
caption: There is a thick haze of aerosol pollution over Northern India, which has persisted for weeks.

title: Cyclone Cyprien
caption: Cyclone Cyprien off the coast of Madagascar

title: Red Tide Along Florida's West Coast
caption: A major red tide bloom has persisted along Florida’s southwestern coastline for months. The harmful algal bloom has killed many thousands of fish and has had an impact on the shell fishing industry in a number of the state’s bays.

title: Severe Bush Fires Near Sydney, Australia
caption: A large number of wildfires continue to burn in southeastern Australia. News reports indicate that the danger to residents of Sydney has subsided somewhat.

title: El Misti Volcano and the City of Arequipa, Peru
caption: Scientists warn that the residents of Arequipa, Peru, are developing dangerously close to the El Misti volcano.

title: Winter Storm Sweeps Across Europe
caption: A severe winter storm swept across much of Europe delivering bitter cold temperatures, high winds, heavy snowfall, and flooding in some regions.
